fecal sphingolipids predict parenteral n.title: Fecal sphingolipids predict parenteral nutrition–associated cholestasis in the neonatal intensive care unit
fecal sphingolipids predict parenteral n.summary: This study identifies fecal biomarkers that can predict parenteral nutrition-associated cholestasis (PNAC) in neonates, using machine learning approaches and metabolomics. The research demonstrates the potential for stool metabolomics to enhance early identification of PNAC risk, allowing proactive mitigation with alterations to parenteral nutrition.
fecal sphingolipids predict parenteral n.methodology: The study used untargeted metabolomics in 200 serial stool samples from 60 infants, applying statistical and machine learning approaches to identify clinical features and metabolic biomarkers associated with PNAC risk. The data was processed using Python, Jupyter notebooks, pandas, scipy, numpy, and seaborn.
fecal sphingolipids predict parenteral n.statistics: Mann-Whitney U tests, Bonferroni method, Shapiro-Wilk test
fecal sphingolipids predict parenteral n.research_outcomes: The study identified 78 stool biomarkers with early predictive potential for PNAC, including 12 sphingomyelin lipids. The results suggest that fecal metabolomics can provide early detection of infants at risk of PNAC.

regression of high dimensional angular m.title: Regression of high dimensional angular momentum states of light
regression of high dimensional angular m.summary: This paper presents a regression approach to reconstruct input OAM states from measurements of spatial intensity distributions. The method combines dimensionality reduction via principal component analysis and linear regression, allowing for low computational cost during training and testing stages. The authors demonstrate the effectiveness of their approach on simulated data and experimentally generated four-dimensional OAM states.
regression of high dimensional angular m.methodology: The methodology combines dimensionality reduction via principal component analysis (PCA) and linear regression to reconstruct input OAM states from measurements of spatial intensity distributions.
regression of high dimensional angular m.research_outcomes: The authors demonstrate the effectiveness of their approach on simulated data and experimentally generated four-dimensional OAM states, achieving average fidelities close to 97%.
sources_of_inspiration: quantum walk dynamics in the polarization and OAM degrees of freedom

artificial intelligence to estimate wine.title: Artificial intelligence to estimate wine volume from single-view images
artificial intelligence to estimate wine.summary: This paper presents a method for estimating the volume of red wine in different types of glass containers using a single-view image. The proposed model uses a deep learning approach, specifically a convolutional neural network (CNN), to predict the volume with a Mean Absolute Error lower than 10 mL. This method has potential real-life applications in diet monitoring and wine consumption studies.
artificial intelligence to estimate wine.methodology: The proposed methodology uses a regression CNN approach, which includes a fully-connected (dense) layer with a single node and a linear activation function to predict continuous numerical data. The model is trained using the mean squared error function.
artificial intelligence to estimate wine.research_outcomes: The experimental evaluations show promising results, with a performance that reduces the Mean Absolute Error to less than 10 mL. This method is suitable for measuring liquid volume in nutritional studies and dietary assessment.

photoacoustic image synthesis with gener.title: Photoacoustic Image Synthesis with Generative Adversarial Networks
photoacoustic image synthesis with gener.summary: This paper presents a novel approach to photoacoustic tomography (PAT) image synthesis using generative adversarial networks (GANs). The method leverages real medical imaging data to optimize the realism of tissue geometries, which are then used for PAT image generation. This approach has the potential to improve the accuracy and reliability of PAT-based quantitative analysis.
photoacoustic image synthesis with gener.methodology: The proposed framework combines physics-based simulation with machine learning-driven approaches for image synthesis and decomposition. The method involves training a GAN on real medical imaging data to generate anatomical parameter images, which are then used to simulate PAT images.
photoacoustic image synthesis with gener.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates the feasibility of using GANs for realistic PAT image generation, with improved accuracy compared to traditional model-based approaches. The method has potential applications in various fields, including medical imaging and diagnostics.

integration of traditional ecological kn.title: Integration of traditional ecological knowledge and western science in natural resources management in the Okavango Delta, Botswana
integration of traditional ecological kn.summary: This paper examines the integration of traditional ecological knowledge (TEK) and Western Science (WS) in natural resources management in the Okavango Delta, Botswana. The study combines remote sensing, geographical information systems, literature review, and survey data to analyze land use and land cover change in three villages within the delta. The results reveal a widespread conversion of land and related resources, highlighting the importance of TEK in resource management.
integration of traditional ecological kn.methodology: The study uses institutional bricolage theory as its theoretical framework, combining remote sensing, geographical information systems, literature review, and survey data to analyze land use and land cover change in three villages within the Okavango Delta.
integration of traditional ecological kn.research_outcomes: The study reveals a widespread conversion of land and related resources, highlighting the importance of TEK in resource management.

optimizing measurement-based cooling by.title: Optimizing measurement-based cooling by reinforcement learning
optimizing measurement-based cooling by.summary: This paper proposes a hybrid sequence of unconditional and conditional measurements for cooling resonators, optimized using reinforcement learning. The method combines the advantages of both approaches to achieve faster cooling rates while maintaining high success probabilities.
optimizing measurement-based cooling by.methodology: The authors employ an unequal-time-spacing strategy with optimized measurement intervals and free-evolution times, optimized using a proximal policy optimization algorithm.
optimizing measurement-based cooling by.research_outcomes: The proposed method achieves faster cooling rates and higher success probabilities compared to traditional methods. The optimal sequence of measurements is determined through reinforcement learning.

pf-hin: pre-training for heterogeneous i.title: PF-HIN: Pre-Training for Heterogeneous Information Networks
pf-hin: pre-training for heterogeneous i.summary: This paper proposes a pre-training and fine-tuning framework, PF-HIN, to mine information contained in heterogeneous information networks. The framework is transferable across datasets and domains, outperforming state-of-the-art methods on four benchmark downstream tasks.
pf-hin: pre-training for heterogeneous i.methodology: The proposed framework uses self-supervised pre-training and fine-tuning to capture the features of a heterogeneous information network. Two pre-training tasks are designed: masked node modeling and adjacent node prediction, which help PF-HIN learn type-specific node features and relationships between nodes.
pf-hin: pre-training for heterogeneous i.research_outcomes: PF-HIN outperforms state-of-the-art methods on four benchmark downstream tasks across datasets.

automation and robotics in the cultivati.title: Automation and robotics in the cultivation of pome fruit: Where do we stand today?
automation and robotics in the cultivati.summary: This paper reviews current automation possibilities for orchard tasks in pome fruit cultivation, highlighting the need for labor reduction and increased efficiency. Despite significant research, no fully automated cost-efficient solution has been developed, suggesting a focus on mechanization rather than automation.
automation and robotics in the cultivati.methodology: The study combines activity research with an overall review of developments in automation for each major orchard task, using time tables to estimate labor duration and validate results through field observations.
automation and robotics in the cultivati.research_outcomes: The study finds excessive labor requirements for both apple and pear cultivation, with harvesting and pruning being the most labor-intensive tasks. An advanced harvesting method reduces labor time by up to 30.6% for apples and 12.6% for pears.

on universal approximation and error bou.title: On universal approximation and error bounds for Fourier Neural Operators
on universal approximation and error bou.summary: This paper investigates the universality of Fourier Neural Operators (FNOs) in approximating nonlinear infinite-dimensional operators. The authors prove that FNOs are universal and can efficiently approximate a large class of continuous nonlinear operators, including those arising from PDEs.
on universal approximation and error bou.methodology: The paper uses a pseudospectral Fourier Neural Operator (Ψ-FNO) architecture to prove universality and derive explicit error bounds for approximating PDEs.
on universal approximation and error bou.research_outcomes: The authors show that FNOs can efficiently approximate operators arising from PDEs, with the size of the network scaling polynomially in the error. This result highlights the potential of FNOs for operator learning and provides a theoretical justification for their use.

an extended scheme for shape matching wi.title: An Extended Scheme for Shape Matching with Local Descriptors
an extended scheme for shape matching wi.summary: This paper proposes an extended scheme for shape matching that can compensate for errors in existing local descriptors without modifying them. The main idea is to consider the correspondence of neighboring sample points when determining the correspondence of a focusing point, increasing the chance of finding a suitable correspondence.
an extended scheme for shape matching wi.methodology: The proposed scheme uses a branch-and-bound algorithm to efficiently approximate the matching cost between shapes, considering the correspondence of neighboring sample points.
an extended scheme for shape matching wi.research_outcomes: The extended scheme yields better matching results than conventional schemes that do not consider neighboring sample points, with only a small increase in execution time.

hr-depth: high resolution self-supervise.title: HR-Depth: High Resolution Self-Supervised Monocular Depth Estimation
hr-depth: high resolution self-supervise.summary: This paper presents HR-Depth, a self-supervised monocular depth estimation method that uses high-resolution images to improve accuracy. The authors redesign the skip connection and propose a feature fusion squeeze-and-excitation block to better fuse spatial and semantic information, achieving state-of-the-art performance with fewer parameters.
hr-depth: high resolution self-supervise.methodology: The paper uses self-supervised learning with image sequences as the only source of supervision. The authors redesign the skip connection to get high-resolution semantic feature maps and propose a feature fusion squeeze-and-excitation block to improve feature fusion.
hr-depth: high resolution self-supervise.statistics: The paper uses statistical methods such as bilinear interpolation and convolutional layers.
hr-depth: high resolution self-supervise.research_outcomes: The paper achieves state-of-the-art performance on KITTI benchmark with fewer parameters. The authors also present a lightweight network that can perform on par with large models like Monodepth2 at high-resolution with only 20% parameters.

logic writing of chinese declarative sen.title: Logic Writing of Chinese Declarative Sentences Relying on Marked Verb Matching Lambek Checking Algorithm
logic writing of chinese declarative sen.summary: This paper presents a natural language processing approach using the marked verb matching Lambek check algorithm to improve logic writing and processing of Chinese declarative sentences. The method combines word bank and statistics, enabling more accurate semantic analysis and disambiguation.
logic writing of chinese declarative sen.methodology: The methodology involves using the Lambek check and writing algorithm to segment vocabulary in text information, perform system operations, and return results for Lambek check and writing recognition.
logic writing of chinese declarative sen.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates improved logic writing and processing of Chinese declarative sentences using the marked verb matching Lambek check algorithm.

language governance of international cit.title: Language Governance of International Cities in Artificial Intelligent Technology Age
language governance of international cit.summary: This paper explores the role of artificial intelligence (AI) in language governance of international cities. The authors analyze how AI technologies, such as machine translation and natural language processing, are used to facilitate multilingual communication and improve language services in urban environments.
language governance of international cit.methodology: The study uses a mixed-methods approach, combining ethnographic research with online data collection and analysis. The authors examine the use of AI technologies in various contexts, including government websites, mobile apps, and public services.
language governance of international cit.research_outcomes: The study finds that AI technologies have the potential to break down language barriers and improve communication between people from different linguistic backgrounds. However, it also highlights the challenges and limitations of implementing AI solutions in complex urban environments.

neural network production split model ba.title: Neural Network Production Split Model Based on Kriging Interpolation Method and Grey Correlation Analysis Method
neural network production split model ba.summary: This paper presents a new production split model that combines Kriging interpolation, grey correlation analysis, and neural networks to improve the accuracy of oil well production splitting. The model is substantial in its use of machine learning, as it integrates these methods to comprehensively consider reservoir heterogeneity and dynamic and static parameters.
neural network production split model ba.methodology: The methodology involves preprocessing data using Kriging interpolation, selecting important factors through grey correlation analysis, and then training a double hidden layer neural network with these factors as inputs to predict oil production, water production, and water cut.
neural network production split model ba.research_outcomes: The new model shows high accuracy and is more practical than conventional methods like the KH method. It has a smaller error compared to the PLT method and demonstrates its effectiveness in predicting oil well production splitting.

trachoma.title: Trachoma
trachoma.summary: This paper provides an overview of the epidemiology, pathophysiology, and management of trachoma, a neglected tropical disease caused by Chlamydia trachomatis. The disease is characterized by repeated infection with conjunctival strains of Ct, leading to chronic keratoconjunctivitis and scarring of the eyelid. Trachoma is found in the poorest communities of low-income countries, particularly in sub-Saharan Africa, and is a major cause of blindness worldwide.
trachoma.methodology: The paper uses a descriptive approach to summarize the current state of knowledge on trachoma, drawing from existing literature and data sources.
trachoma.research_outcomes: The paper highlights the need for continued public health efforts to control and eliminate trachoma, particularly in areas where prevalence remains high.

genetic factors and shared environment c.title: Genetic factors and shared environment contribute equally to objective singing ability
genetic factors and shared environment c.summary: This paper explores the genetic and environmental influences on singing ability, using a validated online singing tool to measure performance in Australian twins. The study finds that both genetic and shared environmental factors contribute equally to singing ability, with childhood experiences of singing with family and being surrounded by music having a significant impact.
genetic factors and shared environment c.methodology: The study used a twin design to examine the heritability of singing ability, with participants completing three singing tasks. The data was analyzed using structural equation modeling to estimate the contributions of genetic and environmental factors.
genetic factors and shared environment c.research_outcomes: The study found that both genetic and shared environmental factors contribute equally to singing ability, with childhood experiences of singing with family and being surrounded by music having a significant impact. The results suggest that singing ability is a complex trait influenced by multiple factors.

the success of sars-cov-2 vaccines and c.title: The success of SARS-CoV-2 vaccines and challenges ahead
the success of sars-cov-2 vaccines and c.summary: This review discusses the rapid development, manufacture, and deployment of effective SARS-CoV-2 vaccines. While these vaccines have been successful in preventing symptomatic illness, there are challenges ahead, including reducing virus transmission and addressing variants of concern.
the success of sars-cov-2 vaccines and c.methodology: The review focuses on a selection of issues related to SARS-CoV-2 vaccines, including their goal, variants of concern, duration of immunity, need for booster doses or re-vaccination, and potential for immunologic imprinting or original antigenic sin.
the success of sars-cov-2 vaccines and c.research_outcomes: The review highlights the success of SARS-CoV-2 vaccines in preventing symptomatic illness, but notes that there are challenges ahead, including reducing virus transmission and addressing variants of concern.

reinforcement learning-based optimizatio.title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Optimization for Drone Mobility in 5G and Beyond Ultra-Dense Networks
reinforcement learning-based optimizatio.summary: This paper proposes a Q-learning-based approach to optimize handover decisions for drone mobility in ultra-dense 5G networks, addressing challenges such as high constructive and destructive interference, limited energy sources, and Doppler effect. The proposed algorithm effectively minimizes handover cost and ensures reliable connectivity.
reinforcement learning-based optimizatio.methodology: The authors propose a reinforcement learning-based approach to optimize handover decisions for drone mobility in ultra-dense 5G networks.
reinforcement learning-based optimizatio.research_outcomes: The proposed algorithm effectively minimizes handover cost and ensures reliable connectivity.

measurement of branching fraction and se.title: Measurement of Branching Fraction and Search for CP Violation in B→φφK
measurement of branching fraction and se.summary: This paper measures the branching fractions and CP-violation asymmetries in B→φφK decays using a large data sample. The results are consistent with Standard Model predictions, but an observation of large CP violation would indicate new physics beyond the Standard Model.
measurement of branching fraction and se.methodology: The authors use a combination of kinematic variables and neural networks to reconstruct B-meson candidates and suppress background events.
measurement of branching fraction and se.research_outcomes: The branching fractions for B+→φφK+ and B0→φφK0 are measured to be (3.43±0.48(stat)±0.22(syst))×10^−6 and (3.02±0.75(stat)±0.20(syst))×10^−6, respectively.

a ranking of countries concerning progre.title: A RANKING OF COUNTRIES CONCERNING PROGRESS TOWARDS A SOCIETY 5.0
a ranking of countries concerning progre.summary: This paper aims to understand the impact of ongoing changes and needs around sustainability, analyzing key indicators for Society 5.0. The study uses a synthetic indicator called S5I (Society 5.0 Index) to rank countries based on their progress towards this new society model.
a ranking of countries concerning progre.methodology: The study is an exploratory analysis using Principal Component Analysis and Stepwise Regression, with data collected from various sources including the ORIBER and Global Skills Index Report.
a ranking of countries concerning progre.statistics: PCA (Principal Component Analysis) and Stepwise Regression
a ranking of countries concerning progre.research_outcomes: A Society 5.0 Index -S5I was developed to represent the final model integrating variables and defining a ranking of countries.

reinforcement learning with fast stabili.title: Reinforcement Learning with Fast Stabilization in Linear Dynamical Systems
reinforcement learning with fast stabili.summary: This paper proposes a novel reinforcement learning algorithm, StabL, for online linear quadratic regulators (LQRs) that achieves fast stabilization and low regret. The algorithm balances exploration and exploitation using the optimism in the face of uncertainty principle and deploys an improved exploration strategy to achieve effective system identification.
reinforcement learning with fast stabili.methodology: The proposed algorithm, StabL, uses a combination of optimistic controller and isotropic exploration to balance exploration and exploitation. It deploys the OFU principle to guide the agent in balancing exploration vs. exploitation trade-off.
reinforcement learning with fast stabili.research_outcomes: StabL achieves fast stabilization and low regret in online LQRs, outperforming existing certainty equivalent and optimism-based learning from scratch methods.

on integral characteristics of polar low.title: On integral characteristics of Polar Lows
on integral characteristics of polar low.summary: This paper investigates the integral characteristics of Polar Lows (PLs), focusing on their prognostic criteria, including kinematic helicity and kinematic vorticity number. The authors use reanalysis data and numerical modeling with the WRF-ARW model to calculate these characteristics and identify PLs in the Nordic seas.
on integral characteristics of polar low.methodology: The authors employ a combination of reanalysis data and numerical modeling using the WRF-ARW model to investigate the integral characteristics of PLs. They use geopotential height fields and velocity fields from ECMWF reanalysis data to identify PLs and calculate their kinematic helicity and kinematic vorticity number.
on integral characteristics of polar low.research_outcomes: The study identifies the importance of kinematic helicity and kinematic vorticity number as prognostic criteria for PLs. The authors find that these characteristics can be used to improve the efficiency and accuracy of complex forecasting techniques.

modeling and simulation of multiphase fl.title: Modeling and Simulation of Multiphase Flow for Nanoparticle Translocation
modeling and simulation of multiphase fl.summary: This paper presents an in silico approach to predict the performance of microfluidic devices for encapsulating magnetite nanoparticles into liposomes. The authors developed a multiphase flow mixture model that estimates the interaction between ferrofluids and liposomes, considering the Michaelis-Menten equation for kinetics. The model is implemented using COMSOL and shows promising results in simulating the encapsulation process.
modeling and simulation of multiphase fl.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates the potential of microfluidic devices for improving encapsulation efficiencies, which is a crucial step in delivering therapeutic molecules. The authors' approach provides a framework for designing and optimizing these devices.

towards autonomous superyacht navigation.title: Towards autonomous superyacht navigation
towards autonomous superyacht navigation.summary: This paper explores the potential for increasing automation in vessel navigation control, particularly for superyachts. It discusses the evolution of navigation systems and the benefits of autonomy, including improved safety, reduced manning requirements, and financial savings.
towards autonomous superyacht navigation.methodology: The paper uses a qualitative approach to discuss the current state of navigation systems and the potential benefits of automation.
towards autonomous superyacht navigation.research_outcomes: The study highlights the need for further research into the development of autonomous navigation systems, including the integration of sensors, cameras, and other technologies. It also emphasizes the importance of considering human factors in the design of such systems.

identification and filtering of random e.title: Identification and Filtering of Random Error in Fiber Optic Current Transducer
identification and filtering of random e.summary: This paper focuses on the random error problem of fiber-optic current transformers (FOCT) and proposes a time series modeling method to accurately detect and identify various types of random error information. The research uses Wavelet transform and Kalman filtering algorithm to suppress random errors, improving current measurement accuracy.
identification and filtering of random e.research_outcomes: The proposed method can accurately detect and identify various types of random error information in FOCT output data, leading to improved current measurement accuracy.

improved estimation of parkinsonian vowe.title: Improved Estimation of Parkinsonian Vowel Quality through Acoustic Feature Assimilation
improved estimation of parkinsonian vowe.summary: This paper investigates the use of acoustic features to predict the perceived quality of sustained vowels produced by people impaired with Parkinson's disease. The authors develop a regression model that assimilates relevant acoustic features, including recurrence period density entropy (RPDE), Gammatone frequency cepstral coefficients (GFCCs), and modulation spectrogram features, to improve estimation of PD vowel quality ratings.
improved estimation of parkinsonian vowe.methodology: The authors employed multivariate linear regression and support vector regression techniques to assimilate feature sets, both with and without feature reduction techniques.
improved estimation of parkinsonian vowe.statistics: Linear regression (LR) and support vector regression (SVR) models were used. Statistical methods included Pearson's correlation coefficient and Spearman's rank-order correlation.
improved estimation of parkinsonian vowe.research_outcomes: The results showed that the RPDE measure performed the best among all individual features, while a regression model incorporating a subset of features produced the best overall correlation of 0.80 between the predicted and actual vowel quality ratings.

constraints on the variability of quark.title: Constraints on the variability of quark masses from nuclear binding
constraints on the variability of quark.summary: This paper explores anthropic constraints on quark masses and the Higgs vacuum expectation value, using recent work on nuclear binding. The authors refine the understanding of the viable range of quark masses that follow from the existence of heavy nuclei, and discuss the implications for fundamental physics.
constraints on the variability of quark.methodology: The authors use effective field theory to estimate the variation in quark masses that would 'unbind' heavy nuclei. They also consider a simple model for homogeneous nuclear matter to provide more physical insight into the sensitivity of nuclear binding to scalar interactions between nucleons.
constraints on the variability of quark.research_outcomes: The paper provides anthropically allowed ranges for the masses of the first generation of quarks and leptons, and discusses the implications for fundamental physics.

branes, anti-branes and brauer algebras.title: Branes, Anti-Branes and Brauer Algebras in Gauge-Gravity duality
branes, anti-branes and brauer algebras.summary: This paper proposes gauge theory operators built using a complex Matrix scalar which are dual to brane-anti-brane systems in AdS5 × S5 space-time. The authors use Brauer algebras to construct the relevant multi-trace Matrix operators and relate them to the physics of brane-anti-brane systems.
branes, anti-branes and brauer algebras.methodology: The authors use a combination of gauge theory and gravity dualities, specifically AdS/CFT duality, to propose new gauge theory operators. They also employ Brauer algebras to construct multi-trace Matrix operators.
branes, anti-branes and brauer algebras.research_outcomes: The paper proposes new gauge theory operators that are dual to brane-anti-brane systems in AdS5 × S5 space-time. The authors also relate their results to the physics of brane-anti-brane systems and propose a new formula for dual Brauer elements.

speech recognition rates and acoustic an.title: Speech recognition rates and acoustic analyses of English vowels produced by Korean students
speech recognition rates and acoustic an.summary: This paper investigates the pronunciation difficulties of English vowels in Korean students using speech recognition software. The study found that Korean students tend to experience difficulty pronouncing certain vowel pairs, and the results may provide pedagogical implications for teaching and evaluating English vowel pronunciation.
speech recognition rates and acoustic an.methodology: The study used a combination of speech recognition software (Microsoft Word's 'Dictate' feature) and acoustic analyses using Praat. The participants were 30 female Korean students who produced a list of 40 words twice each, which was then analyzed for correct pronunciation rates and formant trajectories.
speech recognition rates and acoustic an.statistics: Statistical analyses were conducted on the data using R.
speech recognition rates and acoustic an.research_outcomes: The study found an overall recognition rate of 54.7% and identified specific difficulties in pronouncing certain vowel pairs. The results suggest that speech recognition software can be useful for diagnosing pronunciation problems in English-language learners.

measurement of gamma + c + x and gamma +.title: Measurement of gamma + c + X and gamma + b + X production cross sections at sqrt(s) = 1.96 TeV
measurement of gamma + c + x and gamma +.summary: This paper presents the first measurements of differential gamma + c and gamma + b production cross sections at a hadron-hadron collider. The research focuses on understanding the sea quark content of the proton and gluon splitting into heavy-flavour quark pairs, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
measurement of gamma + c + x and gamma +.methodology: The methodology involves using experimental techniques to measure the production cross sections, including data selection, event reconstruction, and purity estimates. The analysis employs triggers that distinguish large depositions of energy in the electromagnetic calorimeter and uses artificial neural networks to identify photons and heavy-flavour jets.
measurement of gamma + c + x and gamma +.research_outcomes: The paper presents measurements of differential gamma + c and gamma + b production cross sections, which are compared to theoretical predictions. The results show agreement within uncertainties for gamma + b production but a rising discrepancy between data and theory for gamma + c production as p γ T increases.

towards the development of cascaded surf.title: Towards the development of cascaded surface plasmon resonance POF sensors exploiting gold films and synthetic recognition elements for detection of contaminants in transformer oil
towards the development of cascaded surf.summary: This paper presents the development of a multichannel optical chemical sensor based on molecularly imprinted polymers and surface plasmon resonance in a D-shaped multimode plastic optical fiber. The sensor is designed for detection of contaminants in transformer oil, with a focus on simultaneous determination of dibenzyl disulfide (DBDS) and furfural (2-FAL). The paper explores the possibility of using gold films and synthetic recognition elements to enhance the sensitivity and selectivity of the sensor.
towards the development of cascaded surf.methodology: The methodology involves the use of a D-shaped multimode plastic optical fiber with molecularly imprinted polymers as receptors. Surface plasmon resonance is excited by an evanescent wave from an optical fiber, allowing for sensitive and selective detection of contaminants in transformer oil.
towards the development of cascaded surf.research_outcomes: The research outcomes show that the proposed sensor system can detect DBDS and 2-FAL with high sensitivity and selectivity. The results demonstrate the potential of this approach for simultaneous determination of multiple analytes in transformer oil.

coherent raman pulses with quantum-rando.title: Coherent Raman Pulses with Quantum-Randomized Polarization
coherent raman pulses with quantum-rando.summary: This paper demonstrates the generation of coherent Stokes pulses with randomly-oriented linear polarizations using Raman amplification in diamond crystals. The method produces quantum-random polarization states, which are passively-generated and can be used for applications requiring high entropy rates.
coherent raman pulses with quantum-rando.methodology: The authors use a combination of theoretical modeling and experimental techniques to demonstrate the generation of coherent Stokes pulses with randomly-oriented linear polarizations. They employ Raman amplification in diamond crystals, which allows them to produce quantum-random polarization states.
coherent raman pulses with quantum-rando.research_outcomes: The paper demonstrates the successful generation of coherent Stokes pulses with randomly-oriented linear polarizations using Raman amplification in diamond crystals. The method produces quantum-random polarization states, which can be used for applications requiring high entropy rates.

data-driven subspace predictive control.title: Data-driven subspace predictive control of adaptive optics for high-contrast imaging
data-driven subspace predictive control.summary: This paper proposes a data-driven method to improve the performance of adaptive optics systems in high-contrast imaging. The proposed controller uses a closed-loop data-driven subspace identification algorithm to predict future wavefront sensor measurements, allowing for near-optimal control and a gain of several orders of magnitude in raw contrast.
data-driven subspace predictive control.methodology: The methodology involves using a linear auto-regressive model to capture the dynamics of the system, with the predictive controller working in a mode space of the deformable mirror. The algorithm is updated online to track non-stationarity and does not require pseudo-open loop reconstruction.
data-driven subspace predictive control.research_outcomes: The proposed controller performs near-optimal control in simulations for both stationary and non-stationary disturbances, with a gain of several orders of magnitude in raw contrast. The algorithm has been demonstrated in the lab with MagAO-X, showing a gain of more than two orders of magnitude in contrast.

differential phase extraction in dual in.title: Differential phase extraction in dual interferometers exploiting the correlation between classical and quantum sensors
differential phase extraction in dual in.summary: This paper presents an experimental demonstration of a method to extract the differential phase in dual atom interferometers, exploiting the correlation between classical and quantum sensors. The authors use a novel approach that combines the advantages of both methods, achieving optimal sensitivity in the differential phase extraction.
differential phase extraction in dual in.methodology: The authors use a combination of classical and quantum sensors to extract the differential phase in dual atom interferometers. They employ a Bloch elevator to launch atomic clouds upwards, which are then separated by a Raman pulse sequence. The atomic phase-shift at the output of each interferometer is given by the sum of the phases of the two counterpropagating Raman lasers.
differential phase extraction in dual in.research_outcomes: The authors demonstrate an optimal sensitivity in the differential phase extraction, limited by detection noise, for in-phase operation of the two interferometers.

feature enhancement for a defocusing str.title: Feature enhancement for a defocusing structured-light 3-D scanning system
feature enhancement for a defocusing str.summary: This paper proposes a hybrid method to enhance the calibration and scanning features of a defocusing structured-light 3D scanning system. The method uses a high-order sinusoidal pattern instead of conventional sequential binary patterns, improving reprojection error.
feature enhancement for a defocusing str.methodology: The proposed system uses a pan-tilt stage carrying a checkerboard to assist the simultaneous calibration of the camera and projector. It also utilizes the multiplication of vertical and horizontal stripe patterns to enhance corresponding features between the camera and projector.
feature enhancement for a defocusing str.research_outcomes: The experimental results show that the use of the high-order sinusoidal pattern significantly improves reprojection error.

efficacy of the radial pair potential ap.title: Efficacy of the Radial Pair Potential Approximation for Molecular Dynamics Simulations of Dense Plasmas
efficacy of the radial pair potential ap.summary: This paper investigates the efficacy of radial pair potential approximations in molecular dynamics simulations of dense plasmas. The authors compare three RPP models and find that force-matched RPPs are valid for simulating dense plasmas at temperatures above fractions of an eV, while the Yukawa model systematically fails at low temperatures.
efficacy of the radial pair potential ap.methodology: The authors use molecular dynamics simulations to compare the accuracy of three radial pair potential models: force-matched RPPs, Yukawa potentials, and NPA approaches. They analyze multiple metrics of comparison between RPP-MD and KS-MD, including relative force error, ion-ion equilibrium radial distribution function g(r), Einstein frequency, power spectrum, and self-diffusion transport coefficient.
efficacy of the radial pair potential ap.research_outcomes: The authors find that force-matched RPPs accurately describe the results obtained from KS-MD to within a few percent for all cases except low temperature carbon. They also conclude that the Yukawa model appears to systematically fail at describing results from KS-MD at low temperatures.

optical validation and characterization.title: Optical validation and characterization of Planck PSZ2 sources at the Canary Islands observatories. II. Second year of LP15 observations
optical validation and characterization.summary: This paper presents the second and final year of optical follow-up observations for unidentified PSZ2 sources in the northern sky. The authors use a combination of imaging and spectroscopic data to validate cluster candidates, with a focus on improving the purity and completeness of the PSZ2 sample.
optical validation and characterization.methodology: The authors use a multi-step approach to validate cluster candidates, including photometric observations, spectroscopic confirmation, and analysis of Compton y-maps. They also perform a richness study using galaxy counts in clusters.
optical validation and characterization.research_outcomes: The authors find that the purity of the PSZ2 sample has increased from 76.7% to 86.2%, with a corresponding decrease in contamination by interlopers. They also report a clear correlation between unconfirmed sources and galactic thermal dust emission.

optimization of spot efficiency of doubl.title: Optimization of Spot Efficiency of Double-Helix Point Spread Function and Its Application in Intracellular Imaging
optimization of spot efficiency of doubl.summary: This paper proposes an iterative optimization algorithm that combines Laguerre–Gaussian modes and Zernike polynomials to optimize the double-helix point spread function, resulting in a significant improvement in imaging quality. The ML impact is substantial as it is central to the methodology.
optimization of spot efficiency of doubl.methodology: The proposed algorithm uses an iterative scheme to optimize the weight of each Laguerre-Gaussian mode through iteration, reducing the influence of side lobes and attendant aberrations on energy concentration of the main lobe without affecting the characteristics of the defocus double helix.
optimization of spot efficiency of doubl.research_outcomes: The optimization method proposed here could increase the main lobes' light intensity concentration by more than 45%, and could significantly improve the imaging quality.
sources_of_inspiration: Xiaoli Yin et al. added an axicon before the phase modulation plate to suppress the side lobes [13]
The adaptive optical aberration correction method [17] can effectively improve the aberration problems of the imaging system

the 750 gev diphoton excess in unified $.title: The 750 GeV diphoton excess in unified $SU(2)_L\times SU(2)_R\times SU(4)$ models from noncommutative geometry
the 750 gev diphoton excess in unified $.summary: This paper discusses a possible interpretation of the $750$ GeV diphoton resonance in unified $SU(2)_L\times SU(2)_R\times SU(4)$ models with gauge coupling unification, imposed by non-commutative geometry. The authors show that the observed cross sections involving the $750$ GeV diphoton resonance could be realized through a SM singlet scalar field accompanied by colored scalars in these unified models.
the 750 gev diphoton excess in unified $.methodology: The authors use non-commutative geometry to impose gauge coupling unification and restrictively determine the Higgs content of the unified $SU(2)_L\times SU(2)_R\times SU(4)$ models. They then analyze the feasibility of these scenarios using renormalization group equation (RGE) analyses.
the 750 gev diphoton excess in unified $.research_outcomes: The authors conclude that even though the $750$ GeV diphoton resonance can be accommodated within the NCG motivated unified G $224$ models, the price one has to pay is a certain amount of fine tuning in the sector involving the necessary colored scalars.

vacuum alignment in a composite 2hdm.title: Vacuum alignment in a composite 2HDM
vacuum alignment in a composite 2hdm.summary: This paper studies the vacuum structure of a composite two Higgs doublet model based on a minimal underlying theory with 3 Dirac fermions in pseudo-real representations of the condensing gauge interactions. The authors find that the most general CP-conserving vacuum is characterised by three non-vanishing angles, and discuss various mechanisms for generating the top mass.
vacuum alignment in a composite 2hdm.methodology: The authors use a combination of theoretical analysis and numerical methods to study the vacuum structure of the composite two Higgs doublet model.
vacuum alignment in a composite 2hdm.research_outcomes: The authors find that the most general CP-conserving vacuum is characterised by three non-vanishing angles, and discuss various mechanisms for generating the top mass. They also present some numerical results on the mass of the Higgs boson candidate.

drastic suppression of superconducting $.title: Drastic suppression of superconducting $T_{c}$ by anisotropic strain near a nematic quantum critical point
drastic suppression of superconducting $.summary: This paper studies the effect of anisotropic strain on superconductivity in iron-based superconductors. The authors find that anisotropic strain can suppress the superconducting critical temperature, inducing a strain-tuned superconductor to metal quantum phase transition.
drastic suppression of superconducting $.methodology: The authors used electrical transport, magnetic susceptibility, and x-ray diffraction measurements to study the effect of anisotropic strain on superconductivity.
drastic suppression of superconducting $.research_outcomes: The authors found that anisotropic strain can suppress the superconducting critical temperature, inducing a strain-tuned superconductor to metal quantum phase transition.

rex: x-ray experiment on the water recov.title: REX: X-ray experiment on the Water Recovery Rocket
rex: x-ray experiment on the water recov.summary: This paper presents a suborbital sounding rocket mission that aimed to classify the Technology Readiness Level of onboard devices designed for space applications. The mission used X-ray telescopes and other sensors, but there is no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods being used.
rex: x-ray experiment on the water recov.methodology: The methodology involved using a suborbital sounding rocket to test the performance of various devices in space-like conditions.
rex: x-ray experiment on the water recov.research_outcomes: The mission successfully tested the performance of several devices, including X-ray telescopes and other sensors.

quantitative matching of forensic eviden.title: Quantitative Matching of Forensic Evidence Fragments Utilizing 3D Microscopy Analysis of Fracture Surface Replicas
quantitative matching of forensic eviden.summary: This paper presents a quantitative framework for forensic comparison of fractured surfaces using 3D microscopy analysis. The authors utilize statistical decision-making tools to quantify the range of features' resolution that generic silicon-type casting materials can capture to replicate the fracture topology.
quantitative matching of forensic eviden.methodology: The authors use a combination of fracture mechanics and statistics to arrive at a comparison decision. They apply a statistical analysis comparison protocol to 3D topological images of fractured surface pairs and their replicas to provide confidence in the quantitative statistical comparison between fractured items and their replicas.
quantitative matching of forensic eviden.research_outcomes: The proposed methodology correctly classified the fractured steel surfaces and their replicas with a posterior probability of match exceeding 99.96%. The replication technique shows the potential to accurately replicate fracture surface topological details with a wavelength greater than 20μm.

impact of warped extra dimensions on the.title: Impact of Warped Extra Dimensions on the Dipole Coefficients in b→sγ Transitions
impact of warped extra dimensions on the.summary: This paper investigates the FCNC process b → sγ in the minimal Randall-Sundrum model with a brane-localized Higgs sector. The authors derive integral expressions for the dipole coefficients using five-dimensional propagators and compare their results with those obtained in the KK-decomposed theory.
impact of warped extra dimensions on the.methodology: The authors use a five-dimensional approach to calculate the electro- and chromomagnetic dipole coefficients, including all contributions at one-loop order in the minimal RS model with a brane-localized Higgs sector.
impact of warped extra dimensions on the.research_outcomes: The paper presents a complete calculation of the electro-and chromomagnetic (quark) dipole coefficients, including all contributions at one-loop order. The authors derive expressions for the dipole coefficients using 5D propagators computed by retaining the full dependence on the Yukawa interactions.

deep learning\u2010based quantification.title: Deep learning‐based quantification of PET/CT prostate gland uptake: association with overall survival
deep learning\u2010based quantification.summary: This paper presents a deep-learning algorithm for automated quantification of prostate cancer on PET/CT images, which shows good agreement with manual measurements and is significantly associated with overall survival. The algorithm uses a fully convolutional neural network to segment the prostate gland and estimate its volume, as well as calculate various PET-measures.
deep learning\u2010based quantification.methodology: The paper employs a deep learning-based approach using a fully convolutional neural network (CNN) to segment the prostate gland on CT scans. The CNN is trained on manually segmented images and then applied to the validation group.
deep learning\u2010based quantification.statistics: Sørensen-Dice index, univariate Cox regression model
deep learning\u2010based quantification.research_outcomes: The algorithm shows good agreement with manual measurements of prostate volume (SDI: 0.78-0.79) and is significantly associated with overall survival (P = 0.02).

limiting fragmentation at lhc energies.title: Limiting Fragmentation at LHC Energies
limiting fragmentation at lhc energies.summary: This paper investigates the validity of limiting fragmentation in relativistic heavy-ion collisions at Large Hadron Collider (LHC) energies. The authors use a phenomenological three-source relativistic diffusion model to extrapolate pseudorapidity distributions of produced charged hadrons from RHIC to LHC energies, and find that their results are compatible with the limiting-fragmentation conjecture.
limiting fragmentation at lhc energies.methodology: Phenomenological analysis using a three-source relativistic diffusion model
limiting fragmentation at lhc energies.research_outcomes: The authors conclude that limiting fragmentation can be expected to occur in heavy-ion collisions at LHC energies, based on their extrapolations and predictions.

using in-situ laboratory and synchrotron.title: Using In-Situ Laboratory and Synchrotron-Based X-ray Diffraction for Lithium-Ion Batteries Characterization: A Review on Recent Developments
using in-situ laboratory and synchrotron.summary: This paper reviews recent developments in using in-situ laboratory and synchrotron-based X-ray diffraction for lithium-ion battery characterization. The focus is on improving the understanding of physical and chemical changes in battery materials under working conditions, with a deep analysis of structural evolution, redox processes, and transport properties during cycling.
using in-situ laboratory and synchrotron.methodology: The paper discusses in-situ synchrotron-based X-ray diffraction methods for battery materials research, including cell designs and materials, beamline experimental setup details, and future challenges and opportunities for battery technologies.
using in-situ laboratory and synchrotron.research_outcomes: The review highlights the importance of understanding degradation processes in lithium-ion batteries and provides a comprehensive overview of recent advancements in improving spatial and temporal resolution using in-situ X-ray diffraction methods.

celebrating 10th anniversary of photoaco.title: Celebrating 10th anniversary of Photoacoustics
celebrating 10th anniversary of photoaco.summary: This paper celebrates the 10th anniversary of the journal Photoacoustics, highlighting its growth and impact in the field of physics. The paper discusses various research trends and emerging technologies in photoacoustics, including all-optical optoacoustic systems, laser ultrasound imaging, and advanced methods of photoacoustic microscopy.
celebrating 10th anniversary of photoaco.methodology: The paper presents a review of the journal's past decade, highlighting its growth and impact. It discusses various research trends and emerging technologies in photoacoustics.
celebrating 10th anniversary of photoaco.research_outcomes: The paper recognizes the top 10 most influential research papers published in Photoacoustics based on their average annual number of citations.

the photometric lsst astronomical time-s.title: The Photometric LSST Astronomical Time-series Classification Challenge (PLAsTiCC)
the photometric lsst astronomical time-s.summary: This paper presents the PLAsTiCC challenge, an open competition to identify promising techniques for obtaining classification probabilities of transient and variable objects. The challenge aims to balance diverse science goals by engaging a broader community in probabilistic classifications, which are essential for upcoming deep photometric surveys like LSST.
the photometric lsst astronomical time-s.methodology: The paper describes the process used to develop an optimal performance metric for an open classification challenge that seeks probabilistic classifications. The authors compare the sensitivity of metrics of classification probabilities under various weighting schemes and choose a weighted modification of the cross-entropy as a metric for PLAsTiCC.
the photometric lsst astronomical time-s.research_outcomes: The study finds that the chosen metric yields qualitatively consistent results and can be meaningfully interpreted. The authors propose extensions of their methodology to ever more complex challenge goals and suggest guiding principles for approaching the choice of a metric of probabilistic classifications.

study protocol for \u201cpsilocybin as a.title: Study Protocol for “Psilocybin as a Treatment for Anorexia Nervosa: A Pilot Study”
study protocol for \u201cpsilocybin as a.summary: This pilot study investigates the feasibility, brain mechanisms, and preliminary outcomes of treating anorexia nervosa with psilocybin. The study aims to assess the potential efficacy of psilocybin-assisted therapy in reducing symptoms of AN, but does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
study protocol for \u201cpsilocybin as a.methodology: The study uses a pilot design, involving twenty female participants who will receive three oral doses of psilocybin over a 6-week period. The primary outcomes are psychopathology and readiness and motivation to engage in recovery.
study protocol for \u201cpsilocybin as a.research_outcomes: The results of this pilot study will shed light on the acceptability, brain mechanisms, and potential efficacy of psilocybin as an adjunct treatment for AN.

the effects of yoga versus stretching an.title: The effects of yoga versus stretching and resistance training exercises on psychological distress for people with mild-to-moderate Parkinson’s disease: study protocol for a randomized controlled trial
the effects of yoga versus stretching an.summary: This paper investigates the effects of yoga on psychological wellbeing in individuals with mild-to-moderate Parkinson’s disease. The study aims to compare the outcomes of a structured mindfulness yoga program with those of stretching and resistance training exercises, focusing on psychological wellbeing, physiological wellbeing, spiritual wellbeing, and health-related quality of life.
the effects of yoga versus stretching an.methodology: The study will be a single-blinded randomized controlled trial (RCT) with a permuted block randomization. Participants will be divided into experimental or control groups at a 1:1 ratio.
the effects of yoga versus stretching an.research_outcomes: The study aims to investigate the effect of yoga on psychological wellbeing, physiological wellbeing, spiritual wellbeing, and health-related quality of life in individuals with mild-to-moderate Parkinson’s disease. The outcomes will be compared between the experimental group (yoga) and the control group (stretching and resistance training exercises).

association between categorization of em.title: Association between categorization of emotionally-charged and neutral visual scenes and parameters of event-related potentials in carriers of COMT, HTR2A, BDNF gene polymorphisms
association between categorization of em.summary: This study investigates the association between event-related potentials and categorization of visual scenes in carriers of COMT, HTR2A, BDNF gene polymorphisms. The research focuses on understanding how genetic differences affect emotional processing and neural activity.
association between categorization of em.methodology: The study used electroencephalogram (EEG) and event-related potentials (ERPs) to record brain activity in response to visual scenes. Participants were genotyped for COMT, HTR2A, BDNF gene polymorphisms.
association between categorization of em.research_outcomes: The study found significant differences in ERPs between carriers of different genotypes, suggesting a link between genetic variations and emotional processing.

influence of turn-taking in musical and.title: Influence of Turn-Taking in Musical and Spoken Activities on Empathy and Self-Esteem of Socially Vulnerable Young Teenagers
influence of turn-taking in musical and.summary: This study investigates the impact of turn-taking in musical and spoken activities on empathy and self-esteem in socially vulnerable young teenagers. The research finds that shared rhythmicity, particularly at turn transitions, is essential for successful conversation and may enhance well-being.
influence of turn-taking in musical and.methodology: The study used a mixed-methods approach, combining psychometric testing with musical and linguistic activities designed to enhance interactive turn-taking properties of typical conversation.
influence of turn-taking in musical and.research_outcomes: The results show that the Turn-taking group increased in empathy on self-report and behavioral measures, and in the General subtest of the Culture-Free Self-Esteem Inventory. The study suggests that shared rhythmicity may be essential for successful conversation and may enhance well-being.

working with the predictable life of pat.title: Working With the Predictable Life of Patients: The Importance of “Mentalizing Interoception” to Meaningful Change in Psychotherapy
working with the predictable life of pat.summary: This paper explores the role of interoception and mentalizing interoception in psychotherapy, highlighting its importance for patients' emotional experience and subjective awareness. The authors argue that predictive processing can be used to understand how subjective states are inferred from sensory inputs, and how this can inform therapy.
working with the predictable life of pat.methodology: The paper uses a theoretical approach, combining neuroscientific evidence with psychodynamic constructs to discuss the role of interoception in psychotherapy.
working with the predictable life of pat.research_outcomes: The authors suggest that mentalizing interoception can help patients update their characteristic, dysfunctional responses to emotion and feelings; increase emotional insight; decrease cognitive distortions; and engender a more acute awareness of the present moment.

sex classification by resting state brai.title: Sex Classification by Resting State Brain Connectivity
sex classification by resting state brai.summary: This paper explores the use of machine learning to classify sex based on resting state brain connectivity. The authors employ a classifier trained on one sample and tested on two independent samples, achieving high accuracy in sex classification. The study highlights the potential of multivariate analyses in identifying complex patterns of differences between sexes, moving beyond traditional group studies.
sex classification by resting state brai.methodology: Machine learning approach using whole-brain structural and functional connectivity based on pre-defined regions of interest (ROIs) or brain parcellations
sex classification by resting state brai.research_outcomes: High accuracy in sex classification (80%), identification of specific networks showing sex differences in resting state fMRI data

multimodal communication in aphasia: per.title: Multimodal Communication in Aphasia: Perception and Production of Co-speech Gestures During Face-to-Face Conversation
multimodal communication in aphasia: per.summary: This study investigates the role of nonverbal communication in patients with post-stroke language impairment (aphasia) and how they perceive and produce co-speech gestures during face-to-face interaction. The research found that patients with aphasia may benefit from the multimodal information provided by co-speech gestures, but there is no significant ML/AI impact on the methodology.
multimodal communication in aphasia: per.methodology: The study used a head-mounted eye-tracking system to record samples of conversations in patients with aphasia and healthy participants. The produced co-speech gestures were coded according to a linguistic classification system.
multimodal communication in aphasia: per.research_outcomes: The main results are that meaning-laden gestures (e.g., iconic gestures representing object shapes) are more likely to attract visual attention than meaningless hand movements, and that patients with aphasia are more likely to fixate co-speech gestures overall than healthy participants.

psychosocial wellbeing and its' relation.title: Psychosocial Wellbeing and Its' Relationship with Attachment Patterns and Academic Achievement Motivation of Foster Care Children in Save Our Soul Enfants Ethiope, Burayu Orphanage Vocational Training and Production Center
psychosocial wellbeing and its' relation.summary: This study examines the psychosocial wellbeing of foster care children in Ethiopia, focusing on its relationship with attachment patterns and academic achievement motivation. The research uses a mixed-methods approach, collecting data from 134 foster children and six foster families. The findings suggest that most children have normal symptoms of psychosocial wellbeing, but it is related to their academic achievement motivation and anxious attachment.
psychosocial wellbeing and its' relation.methodology: The study employed a mixed research design, combining both quantitative and qualitative data collection methods.
psychosocial wellbeing and its' relation.research_outcomes: The majority of children have normal symptoms of psychosocial wellbeing, but it is related to their academic achievement motivation and anxious attachment.

from social gaze to indirect speech cons.title: From Social Gaze to Indirect Speech Constructions: How to Induce the Impression That Your Companion Robot Is a Conscious Creature
from social gaze to indirect speech cons.summary: This paper explores how social gaze can be used in companion robots to create the impression of consciousness. The authors implemented different modes of social gaze behavior in a robot and evaluated its impact on human perception, finding that it can induce a feeling of eye contact and natural personal interaction.
from social gaze to indirect speech cons.methodology: The authors used an iterative approach to extend the computer model of the robot to simulate realistic gaze behavior and create the impression of the robot changing its internal cognitive states.
from social gaze to indirect speech cons.research_outcomes: The study found that social gaze can be a key feature in creating the impression of consciousness in companion robots, and that individual differences in emotional intelligence play a role in human sensitivity to robotic gaze.

neonatal brain metabolite concentrations.title: Neonatal brain metabolite concentrations: Associations with age, sex, and developmental outcomes
neonatal brain metabolite concentrations.summary: This paper examines the associations between neonatal brain metabolite concentrations and developmental outcomes in healthy newborns. The study uses multi-voxel spectroscopic imaging techniques to investigate age correlates and sex differences in metabolite concentrations across the brain. The findings indicate that postmenstrual age correlated positively with NAA concentrations, while females had higher metabolite levels than males. However, ML/AI methods are not used in this paper.
neonatal brain metabolite concentrations.methodology: The study uses multi-voxel spectroscopic imaging techniques to measure brain metabolites, including N-acetylaspartate (NAA), creatine, and choline concentrations across the brain.
neonatal brain metabolite concentrations.research_outcomes: The study finds that postmenstrual age correlated positively with NAA concentrations, while females had higher metabolite levels than males. The findings suggest rapid development of neuronal viability, cellular energy metabolism, and cell membrane turnover during early life.

evaluating terrain indices for soil mois.title: Evaluating Terrain Indices for Soil Moisture Mapping: A Study on DEM Resolution and User-Defined Thresholds
evaluating terrain indices for soil mois.summary: This paper evaluates the use of terrain indices for soil moisture mapping, focusing on the impact of DEM resolution and user-defined thresholds. The authors used a combination of machine learning and traditional methods to analyze seven terrain indices at varying resolutions and thresholds, finding that Depth to Water Index (DTW) and Elevation Above Stream (EAS) performed best in their study area. However, they also highlight the challenges caused by heterogeneous soil types and the need for local knowledge when interpreting modelled results.
evaluating terrain indices for soil mois.methodology: The authors used a combination of machine learning and traditional methods to analyze seven terrain indices at varying resolutions and thresholds.
evaluating terrain indices for soil mois.research_outcomes: The study found that the variation in soil moisture conditions could be explained by terrain indices, with DTW and EAS being the best predictors. However, they also highlighted the challenges caused by heterogeneous soil types and the need for local knowledge when interpreting modelled results.

modulation of distinct intrinsic resting.title: Modulation of Distinct Intrinsic Resting State Brain Networks by Acute Exercise Bouts of Differing Intensity
modulation of distinct intrinsic resting.summary: This study investigates the effects of acute exercise bouts on resting state functional connectivity (rs-FC) in cognitive, sensorimotor, and affective networks. The authors found distinct rs-FC alterations driven by exercise intensity, with increased FC in the fronto-parietal network after low-intensity exercise and decreased FC in the sensorimotor network after high-intensity exercise.
modulation of distinct intrinsic resting.methodology: The study used functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) to measure rs-FC before and after acute exercise bouts of differing intensity. Participants underwent individual fitness assessments, followed by 'low' (35% below lactate threshold) and 'high' (20% above lactate threshold) intensity exercise bouts.
modulation of distinct intrinsic resting.research_outcomes: The study found distinct rs-FC alterations driven by exercise intensity, with increased FC in the fronto-parietal network after low-intensity exercise and decreased FC in the sensorimotor network after high-intensity exercise. These findings suggest that acute exercise bouts can transiently affect intrinsic brain activity.
sources_of_inspiration: Recent studies have reported enhanced FC of intrinsic brain networks after acute exercise bouts [5,6]. However, it remains unknown how these effects are influenced by the intensity of the exercise bout.

bidirectional associations across time b.title: Bidirectional Associations across Time between Entitativity, Positive Affect, Generosity, and Religiousness in Adolescents Training with a Religiously Affiliated Charity Marathon Team
bidirectional associations across time b.summary: This study examines the bidirectional associations between entitativity, positive affect, generosity, and religiousness across time among adolescents and emerging adults involved in charitable marathon training. The research focuses on how charitable sporting events can promote positive psychosocial developmental outcomes, particularly in terms of generosity and religiosity.
bidirectional associations across time b.methodology: Cross-lagged path analysis of latent factors to study concurrent and longitudinal effects of intrinsic religiousness, positive affectivity, and entitativity on interpersonal generosity and fundraising.
bidirectional associations across time b.research_outcomes: Results support the potential of charitable sporting events to promote positive psychosocial developmental outcomes. Participants who reported higher levels of pre-training generosity were more likely to experience positive affect during training, which predicted higher levels of post-race generosity.

the interpeduncular-ventral hippocampus.title: The Interpeduncular-Ventral Hippocampus Pathway Mediates Active Stress Coping and Natural Reward
the interpeduncular-ventral hippocampus.summary: This paper investigates the role of the interpeduncular-ventral hippocampus pathway in mediating active stress coping and natural reward. The study uses intersectional viral manipulation strategies to manipulate the function of this pathway in mice, revealing its specific involvement in mediating active coping under stress conditions and natural reward.
the interpeduncular-ventral hippocampus.methodology: Intersectional viral manipulation strategy using cre-dependent Designer Receptors Exclusively Activated by Designer Drugs (DREADD) AAV-hM4Di and retrograde AAV-cre
the interpeduncular-ventral hippocampus.research_outcomes: The IPN-vHipp pathway is specifically involved in mediating active coping under stress conditions and natural reward.

ehlers-danlos syndrome, hypermobility ty.title: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome, Hypermobility Type: Impact of Somatosensory Orthoses on Postural Control (A Pilot Study)
ehlers-danlos syndrome, hypermobility ty.summary: This study investigates the impact of somatosensory orthoses on postural control in patients with Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome, Hypermobility Type. The results show that wearing somatosensory orthoses improves postural stability, especially in eyes-closed conditions.
ehlers-danlos syndrome, hypermobility ty.methodology: The study used a pilot design to assess the impact of somatosensory deficit on subjective visual vertical and postural stability in patients with hEDS. Participants underwent a SVV evaluation and a postural control evaluation on a force platform, with or without visual information.
ehlers-danlos syndrome, hypermobility ty.research_outcomes: The study found that patients with hEDS showed greater postural instability than controls, but wearing somatosensory orthoses improved postural stability, especially in eyes-closed conditions.

aging agents: cross generational analysi.title: Aging Agents: Cross Generational Analysis of Behavior and Need Satisfaction Among Players of Tom Clancy’s The Division 2
aging agents: cross generational analysi.summary: This study examines the age and intergenerational relationships as vectors of diversity in an online multiplayer video game, Tom Clancy's The Division 2. Machine Learning algorithms were employed to analyze player behavior data, revealing significant differences in playtime, days played, and group playtime among generations.
aging agents: cross generational analysi.methodology: The study combined survey data from two large-scale surveys with behavioral data extracted from the game's tracking engine. A rank-based model was used for comparing independent sample means, and multiple Machine Learning algorithms were employed to analyze player behavior data.
aging agents: cross generational analysi.research_outcomes: Significant differences in playtime, days played, and group playtime among generations were found. Baby Boomers showed significantly higher playtime, days played, and group playtime compared to other generations.

prefrontal pv interneurons facilitate at.title: Prefrontal PV interneurons facilitate attention and are linked to attentional dysfunction in a mouse model of absence epilepsy
prefrontal pv interneurons facilitate at.summary: This paper investigates the role of prefrontal PV interneurons in attention and their link to attentional dysfunction in a mouse model of absence epilepsy. The study uses a combination of slice physiology, fiber photometry, electrocorticography (ECoG), optogenetics, and behavior to examine the relationship between PVIN activity and attentional performance.
prefrontal pv interneurons facilitate at.methodology: The study used a combination of in vitro and in vivo experiments to investigate the role of prefrontal PV interneurons in attention. Slice physiology was used to record network activity using evoked local field potentials (LFPs) in coronal slices collected from Scn8a +/mice and WT littermates.
prefrontal pv interneurons facilitate at.statistics: The study used statistical methods such as two-way ANOVA, paired t test, and linear regression model to analyze the data.
prefrontal pv interneurons facilitate at.research_outcomes: The study found that PVIN activity was modulated at long and intermediate cue lengths during correct trials in WT mice, but not in Scn8a +/mice. The peak amplitude of dF/F was significantly reduced in Scn8a +/mice at long and intermediate cues.

fictionalism of anticipation.title: Fictionalism of Anticipation
fictionalism of anticipation.summary: This paper explores the concept of anticipation in various fields, including psychology, philosophy, and biology. The author argues that traditional frameworks of anticipation are limited and proposes a fictionalist approach to understanding anticipatory behavior. While machine learning and artificial intelligence are not explicitly used in this paper, the discussion on cognitive processes and anticipatory systems touches on related concepts.
fictionalism of anticipation.methodology: The methodology involves a philosophical analysis of existing frameworks of anticipation and the introduction of a fictionalist approach to understanding anticipatory behavior.
fictionalism of anticipation.research_outcomes: The paper highlights the limitations of traditional frameworks of anticipation and proposes a new perspective on anticipatory behavior. The author argues that a fictionalist approach can provide a more comprehensive understanding of anticipatory systems.

study of detecting behavioral signatures.title: Study of detecting behavioral signatures within DeepFake videos
study of detecting behavioral signatures.summary: This paper investigates the possibility of detecting DeepFakes by analyzing behavioral signatures in video. The authors propose a method to distinguish between real and fake videos based on the speaker's behavior, rather than just visual appearance.
study of detecting behavioral signatures.methodology: The study compares synthetic imagery that originates from different sources, including the same person speaking a different utterance, a different person speaking the same utterance, and a different person speaking a different utterance. The authors analyze the behavioral signatures of the speakers in each case.
study of detecting behavioral signatures.research_outcomes: The study shows that synthetic videos are seen as less real and less engaging than the original source video, indicating that there may be a detectable behavioral signature that can distinguish between real and fake videos.

verbal and nonverbal mismatch negativity.title: Verbal and Nonverbal Mismatch Negativity in Children with Typical Development: Variables Analysis
verbal and nonverbal mismatch negativity.summary: This study analyzed the influence of ear, gender, and age variables on mismatch negativity (MMN) in children with typical development. The MMN was recorded using verbal and nonverbal stimuli, providing reference values for children aged 5-11 years.
verbal and nonverbal mismatch negativity.research_outcomes: No significant differences were noted for the ear, gender, and age variables in the MMN with both stimuli. Reference values were established for nonverbal and verbal stimuli.

representational unification in cognitiv.title: Representational unification in cognitive science: Is embodied cognition a unifying perspective?
representational unification in cognitiv.summary: This paper defends a novel, multidimensional account of representational unification, arguing that embodied cognition contributes to unification even if it fails to offer a grand unification of cognitive science. The authors propose an alternative framework for evaluating research programs, focusing on the importance of unification and problem-solving in scientific progress.
representational unification in cognitiv.methodology: The authors use a mechanistic perspective to investigate the issue of how research traditions contribute to representational unification, focusing on embodied cognition in cognitive science. They argue that research traditions should be evaluated based on their ability to solve problems and unify explanatory projects.
representational unification in cognitiv.research_outcomes: The paper proposes an alternative framework for evaluating research programs, arguing that unification and problem-solving are key aspects of scientific progress. The authors also defend a novel, multidimensional account of representational unification.

assessing suicide risk and emotional dis.title: Assessing Suicide Risk and Emotional Distress in Chinese Social Media: A Text Mining and Machine Learning Study
assessing suicide risk and emotional dis.summary: This study explores the use of computerized language analysis methods to assess suicide risk and emotional distress in Chinese social media users. The researchers used machine learning algorithms to analyze Weibo posts and identified language markers associated with suicide risk and emotional distress. While the results show promise, further optimization is needed for real-life applications.
assessing suicide risk and emotional dis.methodology: The study used a Web-based survey of Weibo users to collect data on their suicide risk factors, including depression, anxiety, and stress levels. The researchers then analyzed the language features in the Weibo posts using Simplified Chinese-Linguistic Inquiry and Word Count (SC-LIWC) categories.
assessing suicide risk and emotional dis.statistics: Logistic regression and support vector machine (SVM) models were used to analyze the data
assessing suicide risk and emotional dis.research_outcomes: The study found that certain language markers, such as pronoun usage and word count, were associated with suicide risk and emotional distress. The machine classifiers showed promise in identifying high-risk individuals, but further optimization is needed for real-life applications.

the preliminary efficacy of a program to.title: The Preliminary Efficacy of a Program to Facilitate Benefit Finding for People with Mental Illness: A Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial in Japan
