the preliminary efficacy of a program to.summary: This paper examines the preliminary efficacy of a new intervention program to facilitate benefit finding for people with mental illness. The program combines cognitive-behavioral stress management and own experiences, including what was found or realized through their lives since the onset of mental illness. However, the study did not find significant differences over time by groups, but medium to large effects in each scale or at least one subscale were observed.
the preliminary efficacy of a program to.methodology: The program used a workbook comprised of eight 90-min sessions with one held every week, and participants joined in a group-based intervention program. The introduction was held as 0.5 sessions, the stress management section was held as 3.5 sessions, followed by the next section as 3.0 sessions, with a wrap up as 1.0 session.
the preliminary efficacy of a program to.research_outcomes: The study found medium to large effects in each scale or at least one subscale (i.e., benefit finding, personal recovery, subjective well-being, and psychiatric symptoms and functional impairment). However, the study did not find significant differences over time by groups.

money or smiles: independent erp effects.title: Money or smiles: Independent ERP effects of associated monetary reward and happy faces
money or smiles: independent erp effects.summary: This paper investigates the neural correlates of processing facial expressions of emotion and neutral faces associated with motivational salience. The study uses event-related brain potentials (ERPs) to examine how happy facial expressions and monetary reward impact different stages of face processing.
money or smiles: independent erp effects.methodology: The study used an explicit associative learning paradigm, where participants learned to categorize happy and neutral faces as either reward- or zero-outcome-related. ERPs were recorded throughout the experiment, and separately analyzed before (learning phase) and after (consolidation phase) reaching a pre-defined learning criterion.
money or smiles: independent erp effects.research_outcomes: The study found that happy facial expressions boosted early processing stages, as reflected in enhanced amplitudes of the N170 and EPN. In contrast, effects of monetary reward became evident only after successful learning and in form of enlarged amplitudes of the LPC.

simple classification of the alzheimer\u.title: Simple Classification of the Alzheimer’s Severity in Supporting Strengthening the Diagnosis of Patients based on ROC Diagram
simple classification of the alzheimer\u.summary: This paper presents a simple classification method for determining the severity of Alzheimer's disease using Receiver Operating Characteristics (ROC) curves based on Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) values. The proposed method is designed to overcome limitations in developing countries where MRI machines and high-resolution images are scarce, and neurologists are limited in number.
simple classification of the alzheimer\u.methodology: The paper uses a ROC curve-based classification method, which involves pre-processing the image through enhancement and segmentation of hippocampus and ventricular areas using active contour and watershed methods. The CDR values are then used to classify the severity of Alzheimer's disease.
simple classification of the alzheimer\u.research_outcomes: The proposed method has a high level of accuracy above 90% and can be applied in developing countries with limited health facilities and human resources.
sources_of_inspiration: Mikhno [1] developed the Voxels of Interest (VOI) template to control the subject treatment of people with AD.
Platero [3]introduced the analysis of longitudinal images, hippocampal segmentation, and classification of longitudinal boundaries in the diagnosis of Alzheimer's.

efficiency of human resource management.title: Efficiency of Human Resource Management in Industrial Automation Enterprises with Prospects of Innovative Susceptibility
efficiency of human resource management.summary: This paper examines the efficiency of human resource management in industrial automation enterprises, focusing on innovative susceptibility. It compares HRMS development levels in global companies and Ukrainian enterprises, aiming to form a strategy for HRMS development and increase innovative susceptibility.
efficiency of human resource management.methodology: Methodological, statistical analysis method of technical and economic characteristics; comparative analysis method to characterize organizational management structures; expert and analytical assessments of HRMS
efficiency of human resource management.research_outcomes: The study concludes that the current level of development of HRMS is low in Ukrainian enterprises. It emphasizes the importance of strengthening the role of corporate preparation of specialists with a balanced combination of management and personnel ensuring subsystems.

financial journalism in today\u2019s hig.title: Financial journalism in today’s high-frequency news and information era
financial journalism in today\u2019s hig.summary: This study examines the role of financial journalists in today's high-frequency news and information era, assessing their watchdog function, production processes of financial news, and impact on the stock market. The research finds a discrepancy between ideal and actual roles of financial journalists, with limited influence on driving stock market prices.
financial journalism in today\u2019s hig.methodology: The study relies on expert interviews and a survey among 40 financial journalists in the United States to reassess their role in today's high-frequency information and news era.
financial journalism in today\u2019s hig.research_outcomes: Findings point to a discrepancy between ideal active watchdog role journalists picture for themselves and their actual role enactment. The influence of regular financial reporting in driving stock market prices has been found to be limited but contingent on various factors such as unexpected news, repeatedly negative reporting, or news about a merger.

ethical challenges and countermeasures o.title: Ethical Challenges and Countermeasures of Autonomous Vehicles
ethical challenges and countermeasures o.summary: This paper explores the ethical challenges and countermeasures of autonomous vehicles, discussing the conflicts in bioethical standards and ownership of accident responsibility. The authors analyze the domestic and foreign intelligent vehicle market, listing and analyzing legal and countermeasures of ethical dilemmas in various countries.
ethical challenges and countermeasures o.methodology: The research uses a qualitative approach, analyzing data from various sources, including reports and surveys.
ethical challenges and countermeasures o.research_outcomes: The paper highlights the need for a perfect solution to the ethical dilemma of autonomous cars, emphasizing the importance of addressing the issue through legislation and regulation.

wearable technology and health: a biblio.title: Wearable Technology and Health: A Bibliometric Analysis
wearable technology and health: a biblio.summary: This paper performs a bibliometric analysis of the growth of wearable technology and health publications between 2000 and 2017, using Scopus data and SciMAT software. The study finds an increasing trend in publications on this topic, with a focus on monitoring systems, devices, and algorithms.
wearable technology and health: a biblio.methodology: Bibliometric analysis using Scopus database and SciMAT software
wearable technology and health: a biblio.research_outcomes: The study found that the number of publications on wearable technology and health increased over time, with a focus on monitoring systems, devices, and algorithms.

attempts to attract eyesight in e-commer.title: Attempts to Attract Eyesight in E-Commerce May Have Negative Effects
attempts to attract eyesight in e-commer.summary: This paper examines the effects of different ways of highlighting products on user attention and perception. The study found that while attempts to attract user attention may have negative effects, a low-intensity background highlight is the most effective solution.
attempts to attract eyesight in e-commer.methodology: The study used eye tracking, cart's contents tracking, and a supplementary survey to collect data. Various levels of intensity were considered for each highlight: low, medium, and strong.
attempts to attract eyesight in e-commer.research_outcomes: A low-intensity background highlight resulted in the best fixation times and most users' selections. However, high-intensity animations had negative effects on user attention.

industry cluster innovation upgrading an.title: Industry Cluster Innovation Upgrading and Knowledge Evolution: A Simulation Analysis Based on Small-World Networks
industry cluster innovation upgrading an.summary: This paper examines the innovation and knowledge evolution of industry clusters through a simulation analysis. It focuses on the effects of hub firms and network member interactions on cluster upgrading, using two patterns of knowledge learning and innovation: STI (science, technology, and innovation) and DUI (doing, using, and interacting). The study finds that hub enterprises' influence on cluster evolution is crucial, but knowledge absorption problems among members can weaken innovation performance.
industry cluster innovation upgrading an.methodology: Simulation analysis based on small-world networks
industry cluster innovation upgrading an.research_outcomes: The study highlights the importance of hub firms and network member interactions in cluster upgrading. It also emphasizes the need to address knowledge absorption problems among members to enhance innovation performance.

what is research rigor? lessons for a tr.title: What is Research Rigor? Lessons for a Transdiscipline
what is research rigor? lessons for a tr.summary: This paper explores the concept of research rigor, its definition, and application across various disciplines. The authors analyze 62 articles on rigor in social science research, identifying different definitions and relationships between rigor and relevance. They conclude by proposing a framework for defining rigor that supports transdisciplinary research.
what is research rigor? lessons for a tr.methodology: Content analysis of 62 articles on rigor in social science research
what is research rigor? lessons for a tr.research_outcomes: The paper offers an approach to defining rigor that is theory-based and suitable for transdisciplinary research, highlighting the importance of considering the context and purpose of research.

performance in the workplace: a critical.title: Performance in the Workplace: a Critical Evaluation of Cognitive Enhancement
performance in the workplace: a critical.summary: This paper critically evaluates the impact of AI technologies on work organizations, arguing that recent research focuses on developing accurate and precise performance models to predict patterns of behavior. The authors propose that cognitive load measurement will shape human performance in manufacturing systems, leading to a reorganization of work and social relations.
performance in the workplace: a critical.methodology: The paper uses a critical evaluation approach, analyzing the relationship between human cognition and performance within the context of AI research.
performance in the workplace: a critical.research_outcomes: The authors claim that cognitive load measurement will shape human performance in manufacturing systems, leading to a reorganization of work and social relations.

influence of artificial intelligence in.title: Influence of Artificial Intelligence in Civil Engineering toward Sustainable Development—A Systematic Literature Review
influence of artificial intelligence in.summary: This paper presents a systematic literature review to explore the influence of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in civil engineering toward sustainable development. The study found that AI has provided various benefits and opportunities, including data collection, sustainable assessment, and productivity. The trend of construction is diverted toward sustainability with the aid of digital technologies.
influence of artificial intelligence in.methodology: Systematic literature review (SLR) was carried out through a systemic analysis to achieve the objectives suggested in the introduction of this paper
influence of artificial intelligence in.research_outcomes: The study found that AI has provided various benefits and opportunities, including data collection, sustainable assessment, and productivity. The trend of construction is diverted toward sustainability with the aid of digital technologies.

gamifying the gig: transitioning the dar.title: Gamifying the Gig: Transitioning the Dark Side to Bright Side of Online Engagement
gamifying the gig: transitioning the dar.summary: This paper investigates digital platform gig work dropouts through the moderating impact of gamified interventions on online platforms. The study applies social exchange theory and self-determination theory to understand gig workers' motivation, with a focus on how gamification can control their intentions to quit.
gamifying the gig: transitioning the dar.methodology: Partial least square structural equation modelling (PLS-SEM)
gamifying the gig: transitioning the dar.research_outcomes: Results confirm that gamifying the online platform would enhance job satisfaction and productivity of gig employees, thereby reducing their chances of quitting gig work.

impact of industry 4.0 and lean manufact.title: Impact of Industry 4.0 and Lean Manufacturing on the Sustainability Performance of Plastic and Petrochemical Organizations in Saudi Arabia
impact of industry 4.0 and lean manufact.summary: This paper explores the impact of Industry 4.0 technologies and lean manufacturing on the sustainability performance of plastic and petrochemical organizations in Saudi Arabia. While the study finds a positive relationship between these technologies and sustainability, it does not explicitly mention the use of machine learning or AI methods.
impact of industry 4.0 and lean manufact.research_outcomes: Industry 4.0 and lean manufacturing have a positive impact on sustainability performance.

structural uncertainty and uncertainty m.title: Structural uncertainty and uncertainty management in four common Land Use Cover Change (LUCC) model software packages
structural uncertainty and uncertainty m.summary: This paper compares the structural uncertainty of four common LUCC model software packages, CA_Markov, Dinamica EGO, Land Change Modeler, and Metronamica. The authors aim to fill a research gap by characterizing the overall structural uncertainty of these models, which is essential for planning agents and real-world problem-solving.
structural uncertainty and uncertainty m.methodology: The comparison followed a qualitative and quantitative analysis of each software, including model structures, change potential calculation, quantity of changes estimation, allocation of changes, pattern simulation, and validation and outputs.
structural uncertainty and uncertainty m.statistics: Pearson correlation coefficient, Kappa Simulation (Ksim), and spatial metrics
structural uncertainty and uncertainty m.research_outcomes: The study found that the available options for uncertainty management vary depending on the model, and no model pays enough attention to the communication of uncertainties. The results also showed that user-driven approaches were not more successful than statistical or automatic approaches.

collaboratively optimizing power schedul.title: Collaboratively Optimizing Power Scheduling and Mitigating Congestion using Local Pricing in a Receding Horizon Market
collaboratively optimizing power schedul.summary: This paper presents a distributed, hierarchical market-based approach to solve the economic dispatch problem. The method requires minimal information sharing and uses local pricing differences to mitigate congestion. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this research.
collaboratively optimizing power schedul.methodology: The authors introduce a distributed, hierarchical market-based approach that requires only a minimal amount of information to be shared between the central market operator and end-users. Price signals from the market operator are sent down to end-user device agents, which respond with power schedules.
collaboratively optimizing power schedul.research_outcomes: The results show that in 20% of evaluated scenarios, solutions are identical to the global optimum when perfect knowledge is available. In the other 80%, results are not significantly worse while providing higher scalability and increasing consumer privacy.

predicting stock price trend using macd.title: Predicting Stock Price Trend Using MACD Optimized by Historical Volatility
predicting stock price trend using macd.summary: This paper proposes an improved stock price forecasting model using a new technical indicator called MACD-HVIX, which is optimized by historical volatility. The model outperforms traditional MACD in terms of accuracy and stability, making it useful for trading.
predicting stock price trend using macd.methodology: The methodology involves developing a new technical indicator called MACD-HVIX, which is optimized by historical volatility. The authors use historical data from the Shanghai stock market to test the model's performance.
predicting stock price trend using macd.research_outcomes: The study finds that the proposed MACD-HVIX model outperforms traditional MACD in terms of accuracy and stability, making it useful for trading.

the psychosocial antecedents of the adhe.title: The psychosocial antecedents of the adherence to the Mediterranean diet
the psychosocial antecedents of the adhe.summary: This paper investigates the psychosocial factors influencing people's intention to adhere to the Mediterranean Diet. The study proposes and tests an integrated theoretical model, considering rational, social, emotional, motivational, and behavioral antecedents. The results confirm the plausibility of the proposed model, with perceived behavioral control being the strongest predictor of intention.
the psychosocial antecedents of the adhe.methodology: Structural Equation Modelling (SEM) analyses were used to test the hypotheses.
the psychosocial antecedents of the adhe.research_outcomes: The study found that perceived behavioral control was the strongest predictor of intention, followed by emotional and social antecedents. Motivational antecedents had only an indirect impact on intention via emotional antecedents.

longevity foundation: perspective on dec.title: Longevity Foundation: Perspective on Decentralized Autonomous Organization for Special-Purpose Financing
longevity foundation: perspective on dec.summary: This paper presents a perspective on decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs) for special-purpose financing, considering longevity as a model example. While the paper discusses modern technologies and blockchain-based smart contracts, it does not explicitly mention or utilize machine learning (ML)/artificial intelligence (AI) methods.
longevity foundation: perspective on dec.methodology: The paper proposes a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) for special-purpose financing, using blockchain-based smart contracts. It introduces participants' types of the Foundation ecosystem and discusses qDAO governance features.
longevity foundation: perspective on dec.research_outcomes: The proposed system aims to facilitate and accelerate early-stage longevity research, provide access to funding decisions, and offer benefits such as recognition and honors with non-fungible tokens (NFT).

smart companies: company & board members.title: Smart Companies: Company & board members liability in the age of AI
smart companies: company & board members.summary: This paper examines how artificial intelligence (AI) can be used to augment the decision-making process of the board of directors in companies, and proposes a change in the corporate governance paradigm for Smart Companies. The authors argue that AI will become an integral part of the boardroom in the next years, and propose adaptations to the current accountability mechanisms when AI is used in the decision-making process.
smart companies: company & board members.methodology: A multidisciplinary approach is used to examine the possible stages of AI use in the boardroom, including a comparative analysis on company and securities law.
smart companies: company & board members.research_outcomes: The authors propose adaptations to the current accountability mechanisms when AI is used in the decision-making process, and discuss the possibility of companies being owned and run by an AI.
sources_of_inspiration: European Commission, Report from the Commission to the European Parliament, the Council and the European Economic and Social Committee, Report on the safety and liability implications of Artificial Intelligence, the Internet of Things and robotics
Artur Kiulian, "Decentralized Artificial Intelligence Is Coming: Here's What You Need To Know", Forbes

seafarers high quality training provisio.title: Seafarers high quality training provision by means of VR technologies in the context of maritime transport sustainability
seafarers high quality training provisio.summary: This paper explores the use of virtual reality (VR) technologies to improve seafarers' environmental awareness and competence in maritime transport sustainability. The study aims to form ecological consciousness of future seafarers using educational VR technologies, highlighting the importance of human interaction with the sea and the need for proper training.
seafarers high quality training provisio.methodology: The paper uses a blended learning approach combining traditional and online classes, incorporating modern information technology to facilitate deep learning and active use of the Internet environment. Simulation and virtual learning technologies are used to create conditions for student-centered learning.
seafarers high quality training provisio.research_outcomes: The study found that the quality of environmental competence formation in the experimental group was 88%, compared to 82% in the control group.

exploring the relevance of intangible as.title: Exploring the Relevance of Intangible Assets and Capital Structure
exploring the relevance of intangible as.summary: This paper explores the role of intangible assets in company financing, examining their impact on capital structure and potential as collateral for loans. The study finds that intangible assets have significant positive correlation with a company's capital structure, indicating they can be used as an additional financing tool.
exploring the relevance of intangible as.methodology: Empirical study of publicly listed companies in Taiwan from 2013 to 2019
exploring the relevance of intangible as.research_outcomes: Intangible assets have significant positive correlation with a company's capital structure, indicating they can be used as an additional financing tool.

applying research-based teaching strateg.title: Applying Research-Based Teaching Strategies in a Biomedical Engineering Programming Course
applying research-based teaching strateg.summary: This paper explores the application of research-based teaching strategies in a biomedical engineering programming course. The authors detail their four-week module, which combined traditional lectures with project-based learning (PBL) and scaffolding to promote student engagement and learning. While machine learning or AI methods are not explicitly mentioned, the focus on PBL and scaffolding suggests an emphasis on student-centered learning and instructor facilitation.
applying research-based teaching strateg.methodology: The authors used a combination of traditional lectures, project-based learning (PBL), and scaffolding to promote student engagement and learning. The module was designed to focus on both the acquisition and application of knowledge in computer programming for biomedical engineering students.
applying research-based teaching strateg.research_outcomes: Students demonstrated significant gains in conceptual knowledge, confidence with material, and belief in the usefulness of material from the beginning to end of the module. Students also had high perceptions of gains in knowledge and attitudes toward instructor support.

ceo exposure, media influence, and stock.title: CEO Exposure, Media Influence, and Stock Returns
ceo exposure, media influence, and stock.summary: This paper explores the role of CEO media behavior on the relationship between media content and stock markets. The authors use daily frequency data for a sample of Chinese stocks to show that higher CEO media exposure attenuates the media effect on stock markets, especially consumer-related stocks.
ceo exposure, media influence, and stock.methodology: The study uses sentiment analysis to quantify the influence of news articles on stock markets and examines the role of CEO exposure in the relationship between stock returns and news articles in different industry sectors.
ceo exposure, media influence, and stock.research_outcomes: The results show that higher CEO media exposure attenuates the media effect on stock markets, especially consumer-related stocks. The study also finds that the sentiment of news articles has an impact on stock movements in Chinese stock markets.

semi-static and sparse variance-optimal.title: Semi-Static and Sparse Variance-Optimal Hedging
semi-static and sparse variance-optimal.summary: This paper focuses on hedging of a contingent claim by a 'semi-static' strategy composed of a dynamic position in one asset and static positions in other assets. The authors develop methods for variance-optimality and provide tractable formulas using Fourier-integration in the Heston model, but do not utilize machine learning or AI techniques.
semi-static and sparse variance-optimal.methodology: The paper uses mathematical finance techniques, including Fourier integration and martingale decomposition, to develop a semi-static hedging strategy.
semi-static and sparse variance-optimal.research_outcomes: The authors provide general representations of the optimal strategy and hedging error under variance-optimality, as well as tractable formulas for the Heston model. They also consider the problem of optimally selecting a sparse semi-static hedging strategy.

a cubic regression model to measure the.title: A Cubic Regression Model to Measure the Impact of Accidents on Traffic Incidences in Kuwait
a cubic regression model to measure the.summary: This paper aims to study the annual total number of traffic incidences in relation to the total annual number of traffic accidents in Kuwait. A cubic regression model was specified and estimation was done using the least square estimation (LS) method, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
a cubic regression model to measure the.methodology: The paper uses a cubic regression model to fit the annual traffic accident data's impact on the total annual number of incidents in Kuwait during the period 2002-2017. The estimation results using the least square estimation and the goodness of fit using the sample autocorrelation function are used to demonstrate the appropriateness of the estimated cubic regression model.
a cubic regression model to measure the.research_outcomes: The study found that the cubic regression model is supported using the residual analysis through the sample ACF, the sample partial ACF, and the normal probability plot NPP figures of the residuals. The results show a significant impact of accidents on traffic incidences in Kuwait.

modern design methodologies and the deve.title: Modern Design Methodologies and the Development of Mechatronic Products
modern design methodologies and the deve.summary: This paper discusses modern design methodologies for mechatronic product development, focusing on the integration of Design Thinking, Concurrent Engineering, and Agilism. The authors explore various design processes, including the VDI 2206 standard, and propose new approaches to address challenges in mechatronics design.
modern design methodologies and the deve.methodology: The paper presents a review of modern design methodologies for mechatronic product development, focusing on the integration of Design Thinking, Concurrent Engineering, and Agilism. The authors explore various design processes, including the VDI 2206 standard, and propose new approaches to address challenges in mechatronics design.
modern design methodologies and the deve.research_outcomes: The paper presents a comprehensive review of modern design methodologies for mechatronic product development, highlighting the importance of integration and collaboration among designers. The authors propose new approaches to address challenges in mechatronics design, including the use of model-based systems engineering and artificial intelligence.

how small consultancies grow: challengin.title: How Small Consultancies Grow: Challenging Problem-Based Theorising
how small consultancies grow: challengin.summary: This paper examines the growth of small management consultancies, challenging problem-based theorizing. It identifies five common barriers to growth and how they were overcome by founders who sold their companies. The study finds no evidence to support the 'problem-based' theory of growth for small professional service firms.
how small consultancies grow: challengin.methodology: In-depth interviews with 42 founders who grew and sold their consultancies
how small consultancies grow: challengin.research_outcomes: The paper identifies five common barriers to growth: cash-flow, client acquisition, recruitment, the complexity of operations, and governance strategy. It also finds that most interviewees anticipated crises and made necessary changes in advance.

gap filling of advanced technology micro.title: Gap Filling of Advanced Technology Microwave Sounder Data as Applied to Hurricane Warm Core Animations
gap filling of advanced technology micro.summary: This paper presents a new methodology for gap-filling ATMS SDR brightness temperature data using the DCT-PLS smoothing algorithm, which is essential for monitoring hurricane warm core structures. The authors develop three regression-based retrieval algorithms to produce vertical atmospheric temperature fields under all weather conditions, and create a 3-D image animation system showing atmospheric temperature anomaly distribution of hurricane warm core structures.
gap filling of advanced technology micro.methodology: The DCT-PLS smoothing algorithm is used to fill gaps in ATMS SDR data, which are then used as input for the regression-based retrieval algorithms. The algorithms use gap-filled ATMS SDR data from Channel 5 through Channel 12 to produce vertical atmospheric temperature fields.
gap filling of advanced technology micro.statistics: Penalized Least Square Discrete Cosine Transform
gap filling of advanced technology micro.research_outcomes: The authors demonstrate that their methodology can accurately fill gaps in ATMS SDR data and provide high-quality atmospheric temperature fields. The 3-D image animation system shows the effectiveness of the methodology in visualizing hurricane warm core structures.

unprecedented differences in phytoplankt.title: Unprecedented differences in phytoplankton community structures in the Amundsen Sea Polynyas, West Antarctica
unprecedented differences in phytoplankt.summary: This paper investigates the phytoplankton community structure in the Amundsen Sea Polynyas, West Antarctica, and finds unprecedented differences between adjacent polynyas. The study uses automated continuous observation instruments to measure phytoplankton species abundance, but does not employ machine learning or AI methods.
unprecedented differences in phytoplankt.methodology: The study used a combination of automated continuous observation instruments and discrete water samples to measure phytoplankton species abundance and nutrient concentrations. Phytoplankton were identified using epifluorescence microscopy and high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC).
unprecedented differences in phytoplankt.research_outcomes: The study found unprecedented differences in phytoplankton community structures between adjacent polynyas, with Dactyliosolen tenuijunctus dominating the Pine Island Bay region. The results suggest that changes in ice melting conditions may influence phytoplankton distribution and composition.

energy-aware and bandwidth allocation fo.title: Energy-aware and Bandwidth Allocation for Air Pollution Monitoring System using Data Analytics
energy-aware and bandwidth allocation fo.summary: This paper proposes a novel framework for air pollution monitoring using wireless sensor networks, leveraging data analytics to improve the accuracy and efficiency of pollutant detection. While machine learning is mentioned as part of the methodology, its role appears minimal in this context.
energy-aware and bandwidth allocation fo.methodology: The proposed research technique uses a bandwidth allocation aware Air pollution monitoring system with cuckoo and fish swarm approach to effectively monitor air pollutant values using sensors equipped in various locations.
energy-aware and bandwidth allocation fo.research_outcomes: The paper presents a novel framework for air pollution monitoring, which can help assess the severity of air contamination on a daily basis, predict interactions between pollutants, and validate computer models. The results can be used to inform policy decisions and improve public awareness about air quality.

forest fires detection using deep transf.title: Forest Fires Detection using Deep Transfer Learning
forest fires detection using deep transf.summary: This paper presents a deep transfer learning approach for forest fire detection, utilizing pre-trained computer vision architectures to achieve a detection rate of over 99.9%. The methodology integrates deep learning with traditional image processing methods to identify wildfires earlier.
forest fires detection using deep transf.methodology: The proposed approach uses transfer learning from pre-trained computer vision architectures, including Xception, Dense-Net, MobileNet, and NASNetMobile, to detect forest fires. The methodology combines deep learning with traditional image processing methods.
forest fires detection using deep transf.research_outcomes: The study achieved a detection rate of over 99.9% using the proposed approach.

deep learning based thermal image proces.title: Deep Learning Based Thermal Image Processing Approach for Detection of Buried Objects and Mines
deep learning based thermal image proces.summary: This paper presents a deep learning based thermal imaging approach for the detection of buried objects and surface mines. The proposed method uses a Region Convolution Neural Network (RCNN) to identify buried objects in thermal images, achieving 90% accuracy in predicting target locations.
deep learning based thermal image proces.methodology: The proposed approach involves training a neural network using an image dataset of buried objects at known locations. The steps involved include thermal image acquisition and augmentation, gray-scale conversion and thresholding, selection of region of interest for detection, development of RCNN, and training, testing, and validation.
deep learning based thermal image proces.research_outcomes: The proposed method achieved 90% accuracy in predicting target locations of buried objects. The results show that the thermal imaging approach can be effective in detecting buried mines.
sources_of_inspiration: Other relevant works mentioned in the paper

applying machine learning for firebrand.title: Applying Machine Learning for Firebrand Production Prediction
applying machine learning for firebrand.summary: This paper presents a machine learning-based metamodeling framework for firebrand production prediction, which can provide high accuracy fire modeling in real-time. The framework uses non-linear non-parametric ML models to predict the firebrand areal mass density and number density of landing firebrands.
applying machine learning for firebrand.methodology: The metamodeling framework was implemented using a large set of data from full-scale laboratory firebrand production experiments, with independent variables including landing distance, wind speed, and fuel type.
applying machine learning for firebrand.research_outcomes: The KNN model predicted discrete FAND and FAMD values with an accuracy higher than 90%.

citrus orchards under formation evaluate.title: Citrus orchards under formation evaluated by UAV-Based RGB Imagery
citrus orchards under formation evaluate.summary: This study evaluates the use of aerial UAV images with automated routines to estimate biometric attributes of citrus orchards under formation. The method uses RGB sensors and achieves high accuracy in estimating crown projection area and plant height, making it a substantial contribution to the field.
citrus orchards under formation evaluate.methodology: The study uses a multirotor UAV programmed to capture images at three different map scales with a frontal and side overlap of 80%. Geoprocessing is carried out both with and without ground control points on each scale. An automated routine is developed in an opensource environment, consisting of three processing phases: i) Estimation of plant biometric attributes, ii) Statistical analysis, and iii) Statistical Report Map (SRM).
citrus orchards under formation evaluate.statistics: Statistical methods used include zonal statistics, arithmetic mean, and Delaunay algorithm.
citrus orchards under formation evaluate.research_outcomes: The study achieves high accuracy in estimating crown projection area and plant height using aerial UAV images with automated routines. The method can be easily adapted to other applications.

understanding adverse biological effect.title: Understanding Adverse Biological Effect Predictions Using Knowledge Graphs
understanding adverse biological effect.summary: This paper presents a novel approach for extrapolating adverse biological effects of chemicals using knowledge graphs and their vector embeddings. The method improves prediction performance by up to 40% in terms of R^2 coefficient of determination, providing quantitative and qualitative insights into the predictions.
understanding adverse biological effect.methodology: The authors use a stressor-effect informed knowledge graph (KG) and its vector embeddings to provide additional information to the extrapolation models. They integrate key data concerning chemicals and species, and apply KGE models such as DistMult and TransE to extract low-dimensional vector representations of entities.
understanding adverse biological effect.research_outcomes: The results show that using knowledge graph embeddings in the gap-filling prediction task can improve both the results and the interpretation of a complex model. The method provides quantitative and qualitative insights into the predictions, increasing confidence in effect prediction.

walking in a heterogeneous landscape: di.title: Walking in a heterogeneous landscape: Dispersal, gene flow and conservation implications for the giant panda in the Qinling Mountains
walking in a heterogeneous landscape: di.summary: This paper investigates the genetic status of the Qinling giant panda population, examining the factors that underpin the structuring of genetic variation within populations. The study uses a landscape genetics approach to identify the role of isolation-by-barriers (IBB), isolation-by-distance (IBD) and isolation-by-resistance (IBR) in shaping the pattern of genetic variation in this giant panda population.
walking in a heterogeneous landscape: di.methodology: landscape genetics, microsatellite data set, complementary analysis methods
walking in a heterogeneous landscape: di.research_outcomes: The Qinling population comprises one continuous genetic cluster, and gene flow was found to be correlated with resistance gradients for two topographic factors, slope aspect and topographic complexity.

geant4-based simulations of charge colle.title: Geant4-based simulations of charge collection in CMOS Active Pixel Sensors
geant4-based simulations of charge colle.summary: This paper presents Geant4-based simulations of charge collection in CMOS Active Pixel Sensors, focusing on the development of a charge transport model for accurate Monte Carlo simulations. The model includes charge generation, diffusion, and sharing across adjacent pixels, as well as the full electronic chain for a CMOS APS.
geant4-based simulations of charge colle.methodology: The paper uses Geant4 toolkit for simulation, with custom classes added to reproduce detector response. Energy deposition in sensitive volume is scored using standard Geant4 libraries, and individual proton interactions are approximated with a 100-nm step size.
geant4-based simulations of charge colle.research_outcomes: A charge transport model has been developed, validated against experimental data acquired with protons in an energy range relevant for pCT. The model includes charge generation, diffusion, collection, and sharing across adjacent pixels.

cloud detection by luminance and inter-b.title: Cloud Detection by Luminance and Inter-band Parallax Analysis for Pushbroom Satellite Imagers
cloud detection by luminance and inter-b.summary: This paper proposes a cloud detection algorithm for Earth observation images obtained by pushbroom satellite imagers, exploiting the inter-band disparity to detect clouds. The method is shown to be effective in detecting clouds with a balanced accuracy rate close to 98%.
cloud detection by luminance and inter-b.methodology: The proposed algorithm is based on the analysis of parallax effects observed between the three color bands and uses an optical flow method for subpixel precision disparity map computation.
cloud detection by luminance and inter-b.research_outcomes: The paper demonstrates a balanced accuracy rate close to 98% for cloud and non-cloud classification for Sentinel-2 images, showing the effectiveness of the proposed method.

age-dependent dispersal and relatedness.title: Age-Dependent Dispersal and Relatedness in Tiger Sharks (Galeocerdo cuvier)
age-dependent dispersal and relatedness.summary: This paper investigates the dispersal patterns of tiger sharks, focusing on the relationship between physical and reproductive dispersal. The authors use genetic data to examine fine-scale structure in populations, finding evidence of male-biased dispersal and female philopatry. However, tracking studies have shown that both males and females move similar distances, exhibiting repeated site fidelity.
age-dependent dispersal and relatedness.methodology: The authors used a suite of microsatellite loci and DNA samples from previously-tagged tiger sharks to evaluate reproductive dispersal in light of demographic and published tracking data.
age-dependent dispersal and relatedness.research_outcomes: The study found that lumping size classes together resulted in genetic panmixia across sites, but systematic removal of large individuals showed significant population-level differentiation and three separate population clusters among juveniles less than 260 cm total length. Tests for relatedness found that 8.9% of the sample set was composed of first-order related pairs.

remote aircraft target recognition metho.title: Remote Aircraft Target Recognition Method Based on Superpixel Segmentation and Image Reconstruction
remote aircraft target recognition metho.summary: This paper proposes a remote aircraft target recognition method based on superpixel segmentation and image reconstruction. The method uses histograms of oriented gradients to estimate the orientation of an aircraft, followed by improved SLIC superpixel segmentation algorithm to segment the target from complex backgrounds and shadow areas. The approach is robust to noise and recognizes targets more accurately than other methods.
remote aircraft target recognition metho.methodology: The methodology involves estimating the orientation of an aircraft using histograms of oriented gradients, followed by improved SLIC superpixel segmentation algorithm to segment the target.
remote aircraft target recognition metho.research_outcomes: The proposed method recognizes targets more accurately than other methods and is robust to noise.

multi$^{\text{3}}$net: segmenting floode.title: Multi$^{	ext{3}}$Net: Segmenting Flooded Buildings via Fusion of Multiresolution, Multisensor, and Multitemporal Satellite Imagery
multi$^{\text{3}}$net: segmenting floode.summary: This paper proposes a novel approach for rapid segmentation of flooded buildings by fusing multiresolution, multisensor, and multitemporal satellite imagery in a convolutional neural network. The model significantly expedites the generation of satellite imagery-based flood maps, crucial for first responders and local authorities in the early stages of flood events.
multi$^{\text{3}}$net: segmenting floode.methodology: The network consists of multiple streams of encoder-decoder architectures that extract spatiotemporal information from medium-resolution images and spatial information from high-resolution images before fusing the resulting representations into a single medium-resolution segmentation map of flooded buildings.
multi$^{\text{3}}$net: segmenting floode.research_outcomes: The model performs best on both tasks of building footprint segmentation as well as for the segmentation of flooded buildings. It produces highly accurate segmentation maps of flooded buildings using only publicly available medium-resolution data instead of significantly more detailed but sparsely available very high-resolution data.

forecasting hydropower generation in gha.title: Forecasting Hydropower Generation in Ghana Using ARIMA Models
forecasting hydropower generation in gha.summary: This paper uses the Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) model to forecast hydropower generation and water level of the Akosombo dam in Ghana. The study focuses on the importance of accurate forecasting for sustainable electricity supply, particularly in developing countries like Ghana.
forecasting hydropower generation in gha.methodology: The Box-Jenkins strategy was used to identify the ARIMA model parameters. The ACF and PACF plots were analyzed to determine the order of the autoregressive (AR) component p and the moving average (MA) component q.
forecasting hydropower generation in gha.statistics: Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) and Mean Absolute Percentage error (MAPE) were used to evaluate the forecasting accuracy of the selected model.
forecasting hydropower generation in gha.research_outcomes: The study found that the ARIMA model can accurately forecast hydropower generation and water level of the Akosombo dam. The results suggest that the Volta River Authority and managers of the electricity company in Ghana may find this study useful for planning sustainable electricity supply.

support vector machine tropical wind spe.title: Support vector machine tropical wind speed retrieval in the presence of rain for Ku-band wind scatterometry
support vector machine tropical wind spe.summary: This paper explores the application of support vector machines (SVM) to improve wind speed retrieval during rain for tropical regions. The authors apply SVM in machine learning to solve this complex problem, leveraging data-oriented regression and triple collocation to demonstrate better similarity between resolved Ku-band winds and collocated C-band winds.
support vector machine tropical wind spe.methodology: The authors use a combination of MLE and Joss indicators to segregate wind variability and rain effects in Ku-band retrievals, applying SVM with knowledge of the underlying principles to derive complexly associated wind and rain information.
support vector machine tropical wind spe.research_outcomes: The results demonstrate that SVM can correct rain-contaminated winds with Ku-band winds and their QC indicators alone, achieving a minimum mean difference of -0.12 m/s at about 8 m/s and a largest difference of -3.25 m/s at about 14 m/s ASCAT speed.

multiresolution segmentation for extract.title: MULTIRESOLUTION SEGMENTATION FOR EXTRACTING PLASTIC GREENHOUSES FROM DEIMOS-2 IMAGERY
multiresolution segmentation for extract.summary: This paper presents a multi-resolution segmentation approach for extracting plastic greenhouses from Deimos-2 imagery. The authors use object-based image analysis (OBIA) techniques to segment the images and assess the quality of the segmentations using the AssesSeg tool.
multiresolution segmentation for extract.methodology: The authors used a bottom-up region-merging technique, multi-resolution segmentation (MRS), implemented in Trimble eCognition Developer v. 9.5. They also used the AssesSeg tool to evaluate the quality of the segmentations.
multiresolution segmentation for extract.research_outcomes: The authors found that the best segmentation results were obtained using the atmospherically corrected pansharpened Deimos-2 orthoimage, achieving very good results.

reducing pollutant emissions from vessel.title: Reducing pollutant emissions from vessel maneuvering in port areas
reducing pollutant emissions from vessel.summary: This paper proposes an activity-based model to calculate ships' exhaust emissions while maneuvering in port, and evaluates the effectiveness of green port policies. The study finds that lower speeds and onshore power supply can reduce local air pollution, and assist transportation authorities to proactively respond to the International Maritime Organization's regulations for ensuring a sustainable future.
reducing pollutant emissions from vessel.methodology: The authors apply an activity-based model to evaluate the performance of ports in Taiwan from 2011 to 2020 and their green harbor policies.
reducing pollutant emissions from vessel.research_outcomes: The study finds that lower speeds and onshore power supply can reduce local air pollution, and assist transportation authorities to proactively respond to the International Maritime Organization's regulations for ensuring a sustainable future.
sources_of_inspiration: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNC-TAD) 2019

palaeo-tsunami inundation distances dedu.title: Palaeo-tsunami inundation distances deduced from roundness of gravel particles in tsunami deposits
palaeo-tsunami inundation distances dedu.summary: This paper presents a new approach to estimate tsunami inundation distance based on the mixture ratio of gravels from several sources in tsunami deposits. The method uses roundness measurements and mixture ratios to identify an abrupt change in the mixture ratio at a constant percentile, regardless of tsunami magnitude. This relationship allows for the estimation of palaeo-tsunami run-up height and/or inundation area.
palaeo-tsunami inundation distances dedu.methodology: The study used image analysis to measure the roundness values of gravel particles in beach sediments and fluvial sediments, and then calculated the mixture ratios of these materials. The authors analyzed 164 tsunami deposit samples taken from 56 sites along a line orthogonal to the coast.
palaeo-tsunami inundation distances dedu.research_outcomes: The main finding is that the mixture ratios of source materials in tsunami deposits abruptly change at the same inundation distance percentile, regardless of tsunami magnitude. This allows for the estimation of palaeo-tsunami run-up height and/or inundation area.

termpicks: a century of greenland glacie.title: TermPicks: A century of Greenland glacier terminus data for use in machine learning applications
termpicks: a century of greenland glacie.summary: This paper presents a comprehensive dataset of manually digitized glacier termini for Greenland's outlet glaciers, which will be used as training data for machine learning methods. The dataset includes 39,060 individual terminus traces for 278 glaciers and has been cleaned and reformatted for use in scientific analysis.
termpicks: a century of greenland glacie.methodology: The authors collected terminus traces through email requests to authors who had published papers that made use of such data or from publicly available online databases. The data were then re-projected into NSIDC Sea Ice Polar Stereographic North (EPSG:3413) and exported into a single ESRI line shapefile format.
termpicks: a century of greenland glacie.research_outcomes: The dataset provides a comprehensive understanding of glacier termini for Greenland's outlet glaciers, which will aid in the interpretation of glacier dynamics in response to climate variability. The authors also highlight the need for coordinated data management and the potential for machine learning methods to automate accurate extraction of glacier termini.

study on the dust content in dead-end dr.title: Study on the Dust Content in Dead-End Drifts in the Potash Mines for Various Ventilation Modes
study on the dust content in dead-end dr.summary: This paper investigates dust content reduction in potash mines using various ventilation modes. The study focuses on the dynamics of a dust-air mixture and proposes a mathematical model for numerical simulation, but does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
study on the dust content in dead-end dr.methodology: The Euler-Euler approach and the model of a homogeneous multicomponent medium are used to simulate the dust-air mixture dynamics. Experimental studies were carried out in three cases: forced ventilation systems with different distances between the end of the ventilation duct and the combine driver's cab, and an exhaust ventilation system.
study on the dust content in dead-end dr.research_outcomes: The study concludes that the most effective parameters of ventilation systems can minimize dust concentration in dead-end drifts. The results provide a basis for optimizing ventilation modes to reduce occupational diseases among miners.

focusing on shadows for predicting heigh.title: Focusing on Shadows for Predicting Heightmaps from Single Remotely Sensed RGB Images with Deep Learning
focusing on shadows for predicting heigh.summary: This paper proposes a deep learning model that uses shadows in remotely sensed images to predict heightmaps. The model takes advantage of the shadow map, which is calculated efficiently using image operators, and achieves superior performance on the task.
focusing on shadows for predicting heigh.methodology: The proposed DL model receives a single aerial image and a binary map of its shadows as input, and predicts its heightmap. The shadows map is inserted as an extra information channel to the image, alongside the colour channels.
focusing on shadows for predicting heigh.research_outcomes: The model achieves superior performance on the task of predicting heightmaps from single remotely sensed images, outperforming other methods that require expensive and precise data preprocessing.

bayesian network modelling provides spat.title: Bayesian network modelling provides spatial and temporal understanding of ecosystem dynamics within shallow shelf seas
bayesian network modelling provides spat.summary: This paper uses Bayesian networks to model the complex interactions between physical and biological variables in shallow shelf seas, providing a data-driven understanding of ecosystem dynamics. The study focuses on four contrasting regions in the North Sea, examining changes over 30 years and identifying key indicators of abundance or biomass change.
bayesian network modelling provides spat.methodology: The authors used a machine learning optimization technique to find data-driven estimates of interactions among physical and biological variables, incorporating a hidden variable to model non-stationary dynamics.
bayesian network modelling provides spat.research_outcomes: The study identified key indicators of abundance or biomass change, including physical (e.g. bottom temperature, potential energy anomaly) and biological variables (e.g. sandeel larvae, net primary production). The results highlight the importance of considering non-stationary dynamics in ecological analyses.

ecosystem respiration and gross primary.title: Ecosystem Respiration and Gross Primary Productivity in a Subalpine Grassland
ecosystem respiration and gross primary.summary: This paper investigates ecosystem respiration and gross primary productivity in a subalpine grassland, but does not utilize machine learning or AI methods. The study focuses on the effects of warming and altered water availability on plant performance and carbon budget.
ecosystem respiration and gross primary.methodology: The authors used a combination of field measurements and modeling to estimate ecosystem respiration and gross primary productivity. They measured net ecosystem exchange (NEE) using a static cuvette and infrared CO2 probe, and parameterized light response curves for GPP.
ecosystem respiration and gross primary.research_outcomes: The study found that warming and altered water availability had significant effects on plant performance and carbon budget. However, the results of the irrigation treatment were inconclusive due to a lack of explicit evidence of drought.

assessment of habitat change processes w.title: Assessment of Habitat Change Processes within the Oti-Keran-Mandouri Network of Protected Areas in Togo (West Africa) from 1987 to 2013 Using Decision Tree Analysis
assessment of habitat change processes w.summary: This paper assesses habitat change processes within the Oti-Keran-Mandouri complex of protected areas in Togo using decision tree analysis. The study uses satellite-derived land cover maps to identify habitat change processes and their impact on biodiversity conservation.
assessment of habitat change processes w.research_outcomes: The study identifies habitat loss, fragmentation, and degradation as major threats to biodiversity in the Oti-Keran-Mandouri complex. The results highlight the importance of understanding habitat change processes for effective conservation planning.

effect of granulation methods on drug re.title: Effect of Granulation Methods on Drug Release Studies in Sustained Release Matrix Tablets of a Poorly Soluble Drug prepared using Synthetic Polymers
effect of granulation methods on drug re.summary: This paper investigates the effect of granulation methods on drug release in sustained release matrix tablets of a poorly soluble drug. The study uses synthetic polymers and evaluates various compression techniques to optimize tablet formulation.
effect of granulation methods on drug re.methodology: The study employs wet granulation technique and direct compression techniques to prepare sustained release tablets using Eudragit RS 100 and HPMC K15M as natural polymers.
effect of granulation methods on drug re.research_outcomes: The optimized formulation (F3) containing drug and polymers in the ratio 1:1 prepared by wet granulation technique could sustain the drug release over a period of 12h.

novel 3\u2032-substituted-1\u2032,2\u203.title: Novel 3′-Substituted-1′,2′,4′-Oxadiazole Derivatives of 18βH-Glycyrrhetinic Acid and Their O-Acylated Amidoximes
novel 3\u2032-substituted-1\u2032,2\u203.summary: This paper presents the synthesis and evaluation of novel glycyrrhetinic acid derivatives containing 3′-(alkyl/phenyl/pyridin(-2″, -3″, and -4″)-yl)-1′,2′,4′-oxadiazole moieties at the C-30 position. The compounds were synthesized using a condensation reaction between triterpenoid's carboxyl group and amidoximes, followed by cyclization. The cytotoxicity of these derivatives was evaluated in various cell lines, showing improved antiproliferative activity compared to the parent compound.
novel 3\u2032-substituted-1\u2032,2\u203.methodology: The synthesis involved a condensation reaction between triterpenoid's carboxyl group and amidoximes, followed by cyclization. The cytotoxicity was evaluated using MTT assay in various cell lines.
novel 3\u2032-substituted-1\u2032,2\u203.research_outcomes: The study found that the formation of O-acylated amidoxime with aliphatic substituents increased the cytotoxicity of derivatives compared to the parent compound. However, bulky tert-butyl substitution completely abolished the antiproliferative activity.

high-throughput computational studies in.title: High-Throughput Computational Studies in Catalysis and Materials Research
high-throughput computational studies in.summary: This paper reviews high-throughput computational studies for new materials and catalysts, highlighting the impact of automation and data science tools on rational design and discovery. The authors emphasize the efficiency of virtual high-throughput screening (HTPS) in searching for materials with tailored properties, leveraging open-source codes and large computational resources.
high-throughput computational studies in.methodology: The paper describes a four-stage process: model development, candidate library generation, high-throughput screening, and data mining and informatics analyses. The authors use computational models to predict material properties, generate candidate libraries, and screen materials using HTPS codes.
high-throughput computational studies in.research_outcomes: The paper highlights the potential of computational HTPS in discovering next-generation materials for various applications, including catalysis, energy storage, gas separation, photovoltaics, thermoelectrics, and OLEDs.

sorbent based on polyvinyl butyral and p.title: Sorbent Based on Polyvinyl Butyral and Potassium Polytitanate for Purifying Wastewater from Heavy Metal Ions
sorbent based on polyvinyl butyral and p.summary: This paper presents a novel composite sorbent based on polyvinyl butyral and potassium polytitanate for purifying wastewater from heavy metal ions. The study focuses on the development of a cost-effective method for wastewater treatment, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
sorbent based on polyvinyl butyral and p.methodology: The methodology involves co-deposition of a mixture based on a polymer solution and a filler suspension to obtain a composite material. The influence of deposition conditions on the structure and properties of the resulting composites was studied, as well as the optimal ratio of components.
sorbent based on polyvinyl butyral and p.research_outcomes: The developed sorbent can be suitably used in wastewater treatment systems of galvanic industries, enterprises producing chemical current sources, and other areas. The study also presents microphotographs of composite samples obtained by scanning electron microscopy (SEM).

fluorescence lifetime imaging microscopy.title: Fluorescence Lifetime Imaging Microscopy: Fundamentals and Advances
fluorescence lifetime imaging microscopy.summary: This paper provides an overview of fluorescence lifetime imaging microscopy (FLIM) principles, instrumentation, and analysis. FLIM is a powerful technique for distinguishing the unique molecular environment of fluorophores, but it does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
fluorescence lifetime imaging microscopy.methodology: The methodology involves reviewing FLIM principles, theory, and applications, including advantages over intensity-based fluorescence measurements.
fluorescence lifetime imaging microscopy.research_outcomes: FLIM is advantageous for probing molecular environments of fluorophores to inform on fluorophore behavior that cannot be elucidated with intensity measurements alone.

simulation of coke quality indicators us.title: Simulation of Coke Quality Indicators Using Artificial Neural Network
simulation of coke quality indicators us.summary: This paper explores the application of artificial neural networks to model coke quality indicators, specifically Coke Reactivity Index (CRI) and Coke Strength after Reaction (CSR). The authors use a two-layer neural network with optimization methods to train the network and achieve accurate predictions.
simulation of coke quality indicators us.methodology: The authors used a two-layer artificial neural network with logistic function as a compressive function, trained using error back propagation and optimized using steepest descent and conjugate gradients methods.
simulation of coke quality indicators us.research_outcomes: The paper achieves accurate predictions of CRI and CSR values with an average difference between experimental and calculated data not exceeding 2%.

experimental investigation of the impact.title: Experimental Investigation of the Impact of CO, C2H6, and H2 on the Explosion Characteristics of CH4
experimental investigation of the impact.summary: This paper investigates the explosion characteristics of methane in coal mines by experimentally studying the effect of multicomponent flammable gases, including CO, C2H6, and H2. The results show that the presence of these gases increases the explosion pressure and rate of pressure rise, making the explosions more dangerous and destructive.
experimental investigation of the impact.methodology: Experimental investigation using a 20 L spherical closed vessel
experimental investigation of the impact.research_outcomes: The study found that the presence of CO, C2H6, and H2 increases the explosion pressure and rate of pressure rise, making the explosions more dangerous and destructive.

simultaneous quantification of five lign.title: Simultaneous Quantification of Five Lignans from Schisandra chinensis in Various Tissues of Rats
simultaneous quantification of five lign.summary: This paper presents a rapid and sensitive high-performance liquid chromatography – electrospray ionization – tandem mass spectrometry (HPLC – ESI – MS/MS) method for the simultaneous quantification of five lignans from Schisandra chinensis in various tissues of rats. The study focuses on the tissue distribution of these lignans, which are known to have antihepatotoxic effects.
simultaneous quantification of five lign.methodology: High-performance liquid chromatography – electrospray ionization – tandem mass spectrometry (HPLC – ESI – MS/MS)
simultaneous quantification of five lign.research_outcomes: The study found that the major target organs of the five lignans in rats were the livers and kidneys.

next steps for access to safe, secure dn.title: Next Steps for Access to Safe, Secure DNA Synthesis
next steps for access to safe, secure dn.summary: This paper discusses the need for continued improvement in biosecurity safety nets provided by DNA synthesis order screening. The authors propose regular red teaming as a means to assess evolving risk of vulnerabilities in screening systems, and suggest that this approach can also serve as effective regression tests during software development.
next steps for access to safe, secure dn.methodology: The paper discusses the current state of DNA synthesis industry best practices and proposes improvements through regular red teaming.
next steps for access to safe, secure dn.research_outcomes: The authors recommend that synthesis companies engage in periodic red teaming to assess evolving risk of vulnerabilities in screening systems, and suggest that this approach can also serve as effective regression tests during software development.

self-propelling microdroplets generated.title: Self-propelling Microdroplets Generated and Sustained by Liquid-liquid Phase Separation in Confined Spaces
self-propelling microdroplets generated.summary: This paper explores the phenomenon of self-propelling microdroplets generated through liquid-liquid phase separation in confined spaces. The authors reveal an effective pathway for rapid transport of microdroplets, which is driven by concentration gradients and interfacial energy.
self-propelling microdroplets generated.methodology: The authors used a combination of experimental and numerical methods to study the behavior of self-propelling droplets. They employed high-speed imaging and fluorescence microscopy to visualize the droplet motion, and numerical simulations to model the diffusion of ethanol from solution A to solution B.
self-propelling microdroplets generated.research_outcomes: The authors found that the velocity of propelling microdroplets reaches up to ~160 µm/s. They also demonstrated that the phenomenon of self-propelling droplets is common for various unstable liquid mixtures even with high viscosity.

dermacozine n, a novel linear pentacycli.title: Dermacozine N, a Novel Linear Pentacyclic Oxazinophenazine with Near Infrared Absorption Maxima
dermacozine n, a novel linear pentacycli.summary: This paper reports the isolation and structure elucidation of dermacozine N, a novel linear pentacyclic oxazinophenazine with near infrared absorption maxima. The compound was isolated from the Mariana Trench sediment strain Dermacoccus abyssi MT 1.1T and its structure was determined using a combination of NMR, MS, and UV-Vis spectroscopy.
dermacozine n, a novel linear pentacycli.methodology: The authors used a combination of NMR, MS, and UV-Vis spectroscopy to determine the structure of dermacozine N.
dermacozine n, a novel linear pentacycli.research_outcomes: The compound was found to have near infrared absorption maxima, making it an excellent candidate for research in biosensing chemistry, photodynamic therapy (PDT), opto-electronic applications, and metabolic mapping at the cellular level.

application of raman spectroscopic metho.title: Application of Raman Spectroscopic Methods in Food Safety: A Review
application of raman spectroscopic metho.summary: This review paper discusses the application of Raman spectroscopic methods for food safety detection, highlighting their non-destructive, rapid, and sensitive nature. The authors summarize recent developments in Raman spectroscopy, including micro-Raman spectroscopy, Raman imaging, and surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS), and discuss their potential applications in detecting biological, chemical, and physical contaminants in foods.
application of raman spectroscopic metho.methodology: The paper reviews the principles of Raman spectroscopy, its applications in food safety detection, and recent advances in micro-Raman spectroscopy, Raman imaging, and SERS.
application of raman spectroscopic metho.research_outcomes: The review highlights the potential of Raman spectroscopic methods for rapid and sensitive detection of contaminants in foods, with applications in ensuring food safety.

base\u2010free oxidative esterification.title: Base‐free Oxidative Esterification of HMF over AuPd/nNiO‐TiO2
base\u2010free oxidative esterification.summary: This paper investigates the catalytic performance of Au, Pd and AuPd NPs on nNiO, TiO2 and mixed nNiO-TiO2 supports in the base-free oxidative esterification of HMF. The study aims to unveil the synergistic effects deriving from the Au-Pd alloy formation and from metal-support interactions.
base\u2010free oxidative esterification.methodology: The authors used a sol-immobilization procedure to deposit monometallic (Au and Pd) and bimetallic (AuPd, with optimized internal Au:Pd molar ratio of 6:4) nanoparticles on nNiO, TiO2 and nNiO-TiO2 supports.
base\u2010free oxidative esterification.research_outcomes: The study found that the catalytic performance of Au, Pd and AuPd NPs on nNiO, TiO2 and mixed nNiO-TiO2 supports in the base-free oxidative esterification of HMF was influenced by the synergistic effects deriving from the Au-Pd alloy formation and from metal-support interactions.

automated optimisation of coarse-grained.title: Automated Optimisation of Coarse-Grained Force Fields Using Free Energy Data
automated optimisation of coarse-grained.summary: This paper presents an automated approach for optimising coarse-grained force fields by reproducing free energy gradients derived from atomistic simulations. The method is implemented in the ForceBalance software and applied to optimise the SIRAH CG protein force field using atomistic hydration free energy data, resulting in improved solvation free energies.
automated optimisation of coarse-grained.methodology: The approach uses thermodynamic integration theory and a linear coupling parameter to connect the reference and target states. The objective function is minimised by optimising the coarse-grained parameters, which indirectly improves the hydration free energies.
automated optimisation of coarse-grained.research_outcomes: The newly optimised SIRAH-OBAFE force field shows improved agreement with experiment and atomistic simulations in conventional MD simulations of proteins in solution.

in situ sensors for flow reactors \u2013.title: In situ sensors for flow reactors – a review
in situ sensors for flow reactors \u2013.summary: This paper reviews the state of in situ sensors for flow reactors, highlighting their importance in optimizing controllable variables and enabling real-time measurements. While machine-learning and artificial intelligence tools are mentioned as potential future applications, they do not play a central role in the current methodology.
in situ sensors for flow reactors \u2013.methodology: The paper reviews various methods of integrating in situ sensors with flow reactors, including inline and online analytical methods, and discusses their advantages over traditional offline measurements.
in situ sensors for flow reactors \u2013.research_outcomes: The review highlights the potential benefits of in situ measurements for process control and optimization in flow chemistry, including improved accuracy, reduced manual intervention, and increased automation abilities.

first synthetic report and antioxidant p.title: First synthetic report and antioxidant potential of natural product (±)-5,7-dihydroxy-8-methyl-3-(2',4'-dihydroxybenzyl)chroman-4-one from Chinese medicine Gan Luo Xin pill
first synthetic report and antioxidant p.summary: This paper presents the first synthetic route for a natural product, (±)-5,7-dihydroxy-8-methyl-3-(2',4'-dihydroxybenzyl)chroman-4-one, from Chinese medicine Gan Luo Xin pill. The synthesis involves 9 steps with readily available reagents and is significant in enhancing the availability of natural products throughout the year.
first synthetic report and antioxidant p.methodology: The synthetic route was developed via retrosynthesis followed by characterization of the recently isolated compound using FT-IR, 1H NMR, 13C NMR, and LCMS analysis.
first synthetic report and antioxidant p.research_outcomes: The synthesized natural product showed antioxidant activity with DPPH radical scavenging activity of 97% at 1 mg/ml concentration and ABTS radical scavenging activity of 87% at the same concentration.

de novo creation of a naked eye\u2013det.title: De novo creation of a naked eye–detectable fluorescent molecule based on quantum chemical computation and machine learning
de novo creation of a naked eye\u2013det.summary: This paper presents the de novo design of a fluorescent molecule using a combination of quantum chemical computation and machine learning. The authors used a random forest regression model in scikit-learn to predict molecular properties, achieving 75% accuracy in designing fluorescent molecules.
de novo creation of a naked eye\u2013det.methodology: The methodology involves the use of de novo molecule generator (DNMG) coupled with quantum chemical computation (QC) and machine learning. The authors used massive parallel computation to generate candidate molecules, which were then synthesized and characterized using various spectroscopic techniques.
de novo creation of a naked eye\u2013det.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates the successful design of fluorescent molecules with high accuracy, including an unreported molecule that emits fluorescence detectable by the naked eye. The results highlight the potential of combining quantum chemical computation and machine learning for molecular design.

multivariate analysis for the classifica.title: Multivariate Analysis for the Classification of Chocolate According to its Percentage of Cocoa by Using Terahertz Time-Domain Spectroscopy (THz-TDS)
multivariate analysis for the classifica.summary: This paper explores the use of terahertz time-domain spectroscopy (THz-TDS) for classifying chocolate according to its cocoa percentage. The authors employ multivariate analysis and machine learning algorithms, specifically support vector machines (SVM), to achieve a high accuracy rate of 93%. This study demonstrates the potential of THz-TDS in the food industry for non-destructive inspection and quality control.
multivariate analysis for the classifica.methodology: The authors used terahertz time-domain spectroscopy (THz-TDS) to analyze the absorbance spectra of chocolate samples with different cocoa percentages. They employed multivariate analysis and machine learning algorithms, specifically support vector machines (SVM), to classify the samples.
multivariate analysis for the classifica.research_outcomes: The study achieved a high accuracy rate of 93% in classifying chocolate according to its cocoa percentage using THz-TDS and SVM. The authors also demonstrated the potential of THz-TDS for non-destructive inspection and quality control in the food industry.

crop modeling with less data: the fao mo.title: Crop Modeling with Less Data: The FAO Model for Soybean Yield Estimation
crop modeling with less data: the fao mo.summary: This paper presents a low-input methodology for soybean yield estimation using the FAO-33 model and agroecological zone approach. The study combines indirect data with climate information from ECMWF to estimate yields, achieving reasonable accuracy.
crop modeling with less data: the fao mo.methodology: The study uses a combination of the FAO-33 model and agroecological zone approach for soybean yield estimation. Agrometeorological data from ECMWF is used in conjunction with indirect data to estimate yields.
crop modeling with less data: the fao mo.research_outcomes: The study achieves reasonable accuracy in estimating soybean yields using a low-input methodology.

assessment of flood susceptibility using.title: Assessment of Flood Susceptibility Using Support Vector Machine in the Belt and Road Region
assessment of flood susceptibility using.summary: This paper assesses flood susceptibility using a support vector machine (SVM) model in the Belt and Road region. The SVM model is used to generate a flood susceptibility map, and the results reveal that Southeast Asia is most susceptible to flooding. The study introduces the flood susceptibility comprehensive index (FSCI) to quantify the flood susceptibility levels of countries and sub-regions.
assessment of flood susceptibility using.methodology: The SVM model was used to generate a flood susceptibility map based on 11 flood condition factors, including maximum three-day precipitation, altitude, standard deviation of elevation, slope, flow accumulation, topographic wetness index, river density, fractional vegetation cover, percentage of impervious surface, land cover, and soil texture.
