assessment of flood susceptibility using.statistics: The study uses statistical methods to analyze the relationship between flood susceptibility and various factors. The SVM model is used to generate a flood susceptibility map, and the results are evaluated using metrics such as accuracy and AUC values.
assessment of flood susceptibility using.research_outcomes: The study reveals that Southeast Asia is most susceptible to flooding, and the FSCI is introduced to quantify the flood susceptibility levels of countries and sub-regions. The SVM model is shown to be effective in generating a flood susceptibility map.

classification of sidr honey and detecti.title: Classification of Sidr honey and detection of sugar adulteration using right angle fluorescence spectroscopy and chemometrics
classification of sidr honey and detecti.summary: This paper presents a method for classifying Sidr honey and detecting sugar adulteration using right angle fluorescence spectroscopy and chemometrics. The authors employed machine-assisted classification using the bagging algorithm, achieving high accuracy in discriminating between Sidr, sugar, and mixed Sidr-sugar samples.
classification of sidr honey and detecti.methodology: The study used a combination of fluorescence spectroscopy and chemometrics to analyze honey samples. The authors employed principal component analysis (PCA) and the bagging algorithm for machine-assisted classification.
classification of sidr honey and detecti.research_outcomes: The results showed high accuracy in discriminating between Sidr, sugar, and mixed Sidr-sugar samples. The method has potential applications in developing a quick, eco-friendly, and non-destructive analytical tool for honey researchers, producers, exporters, consumers, and retailers.

an extensive dataset for successful reco.title: An extensive dataset for successful recognition of fresh and rotten fruits
an extensive dataset for successful reco.summary: This paper presents a large-scale dataset for the classification of fresh and rotten fruits, which is crucial for agricultural productions and fruit processing industries. The dataset contains 16 types of fruit classes with 3200 original images and 12,335 augmented images, making it an essential resource for researchers to develop effective algorithms for recognizing more variety of fruits.
an extensive dataset for successful reco.methodology: The authors used a deep learning approach, specifically convolutional neural networks (CNN), to classify fresh and rotten fruits. The dataset was preprocessed using augmentation techniques such as rotation, scaling, shearing, cropping, shifting, adjusting brightness, contrast, saturation, and hue.
an extensive dataset for successful reco.statistics: Histogram Equalization is another approach that was used to improve image contrast.
an extensive dataset for successful reco.research_outcomes: The authors demonstrated the effectiveness of their dataset in classifying fresh and rotten fruits with high accuracy. The results show that the proposed method can be used for real-life applications such as early detection and classification of fresh and rotten fruits.

assessment of in vitro pollen germinatio.title: Assessment of in Vitro Pollen Germination and Pollen Tube Growth of Annona Cherimola Mill
assessment of in vitro pollen germinatio.summary: This paper assesses the in vitro pollen germination and growth of nine ecotypes and one cultivar of Annona cherimola Mill. The study evaluates the percentage of pollen germination and length of pollen tubes after 2 and 24 hours of incubation, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods used.
assessment of in vitro pollen germinatio.methodology: The study uses a completely randomized design with four replications to evaluate the variables studied. The pollen was obtained from the A. cherimola collection of the Austro Experimental Station and evaluated in vitro using an optical microscope.
assessment of in vitro pollen germinatio.research_outcomes: The study found that Fabulosa and Austro ecotypes had the highest pollen germination in the male phenological stage, after 2 and 24 hours in both seasons. The ideal phenological stage for pollen collection was at anther dehiscence.

evaluation of five gas diffusion models.title: Evaluation of Five Gas Diffusion Models Used in the Gradient Method for Estimating CO 2 Flux with Changing Soil Properties
evaluation of five gas diffusion models.summary: This paper evaluates the applicability of five commonly used gas diffusion models in estimating soil CO 2 flux using the gradient method. The study assesses the effects of changing soil properties on the accuracy of these models and compares their performance with a reference method.
evaluation of five gas diffusion models.methodology: The authors use Fick's first law to estimate soil CO 2 flux based on CO 2 concentration in the vertical soil profile and the CO 2 diffusion coefficient in the soil. They evaluate five gas diffusion models: Millington-Quirk, Penman, Marshall, Penman-Millington-Quirk, and Moldrup.
evaluation of five gas diffusion models.research_outcomes: The study finds that the Moldrup model yields the highest accuracy in estimating soil CO 2 flux, followed by the Millington-Quirk model. The other models perform poorly. The results also indicate that soil CO 2 flux is highly sensitive to the diffusion model used.

violence detection in ranches using comp.title: Violence Detection in Ranches Using Computer Vision and Convolution Neural Network
violence detection in ranches using comp.summary: This paper proposes a violence detection system using computer vision and convolutional neural networks to detect animal fights in ranches, reducing the need for close supervision and monitoring. The system uses machine learning models to identify fights and alert ranchers, with an accuracy of up to 93%.
violence detection in ranches using comp.methodology: The study proposes a method that detects and reports activities of violence to ranchers using computer vision and machine learning. Different machine learning models were built for each animal species.
violence detection in ranches using comp.research_outcomes: The proposed system can detect animal fights with high accuracy, reducing the need for close supervision and monitoring in ranches.

the factors influencing market price of.title: The Factors Influencing Market Price Of Sago Starch In Meranti Islands By Linear Regression
the factors influencing market price of.summary: This paper investigates the factors influencing market price of sago starch in Meranti Islands using linear regression. The study finds that the number of sago farmers, annual production, and area of sago land significantly impact the market price. Linear regression is used to analyze the relationship between variables, providing a graphical visualization of the distribution of data.
the factors influencing market price of.methodology: The paper uses linear regression as a machine learning method to analyze the effect of exogenous variables on endogenous variables.
the factors influencing market price of.research_outcomes: The study finds that the number of sago farmers, annual production, and area of sago land significantly impact the market price of sago starch. The results can be used as a reference for industry and trade offices in Meranti district to determine the market price.
sources_of_inspiration: Deforestation driven by urban population growth and agricultural trade in the twenty-first century

image processing technology based on int.title: Image Processing Technology Based on Internet of Things in Intelligent Pig Breeding
image processing technology based on int.summary: This paper explores the application of image processing technology based on the Internet of Things in intelligent pig breeding. The authors use image processing to monitor and manage pig growth environment, health, diet, and other aspects, significantly improving production efficiency and reducing labor costs.
image processing technology based on int.methodology: The authors used a comparative reference method to establish an experimental group and a control group with 10 cubs in each group. The experimental group adopted intelligent breeding, while the control group used traditional breeding methods.
image processing technology based on int.research_outcomes: The results showed that the weight gain of pigs in the experimental group was significantly faster than that of the control group, and the probability of infection was significantly lower than that of the control group.

recent advances in novel packaging techn.title: Recent Advances in Novel Packaging Technologies for Shelf-Life Extension of Guava Fruits
recent advances in novel packaging techn.summary: This review discusses the physiology, mechanism of ripening, oxidation, and ethylene production of guava fruits. It also reviews recent developments in packaging technologies such as modified atmosphere packaging (MAP), controlled atmosphere packaging (CAP), and edible films or coatings for extending shelf life.
recent advances in novel packaging techn.methodology: The review discusses the physiology and mechanism of ripening, oxidation, and ethylene production of guava fruits. It also reviews recent developments in packaging technologies such as MAP, CAP, and edible films or coatings.
recent advances in novel packaging techn.research_outcomes: The review highlights the importance of proper storage and packaging of guava fruits to extend shelf life. It also discusses the critical factors for higher perishability of guava, including early increase in respiration rate and biosynthesis of ethylene after harvest.

effects of in ovo injection of microalga.title: Effects of in ovo injection of microalgae on hatchability, antioxidant and immunity-related genes expression, and post-hatch performance in broilers and Japanese quails
effects of in ovo injection of microalga.summary: This paper investigates the effects of in ovo injection of microalgae on hatchability, antioxidant and immunity-related genes expression, and post-hatch performance in broilers and Japanese quails. The study found that in ovo injection of Spirulina platensis improved hatchability, antioxidant, and immunity-related gene expression in quail chicks.
effects of in ovo injection of microalga.methodology: The study used a controlled experiment design with two separate experiments. In the first experiment, fertilised eggs were divided into six groups: control, sham control, and four treatment groups with different concentrations of Spirulina platensis injected into the air sac of the fertile eggs.
effects of in ovo injection of microalga.statistics: Statistical methods used include analysis of variance (ANOVA) and real-time PCR to evaluate gene expression.
effects of in ovo injection of microalga.research_outcomes: The study found that in ovo injection of Spirulina platensis improved hatchability, antioxidant, and immunity-related gene expression in quail chicks. The results also showed that the treatment groups had lower feed conversion ratio (FCR) compared to the control group.

deep learning techniques for in-crop wee.title: Deep Learning Techniques for In-Crop Weed Identification: A Review
deep learning techniques for in-crop wee.summary: This paper reviews recent developments of deep learning techniques in image-based weed detection, highlighting the potential for accurate and efficient weed control. The review discusses various deep learning architectures, including convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and graph neural networks (GNNs), and their applications in weed identification.
deep learning techniques for in-crop wee.methodology: The paper reviews recent developments of deep learning techniques in image-based weed detection, discussing various architectures and their applications.
deep learning techniques for in-crop wee.research_outcomes: The review highlights the potential for accurate and efficient weed control using deep learning techniques.

classification modeling method for near-.title: Classification Modeling Method for Near-Infrared Spectroscopy of Tobacco Based on Multimodal Convolution Neural Networks
classification modeling method for near-.summary: This paper presents a method for identifying the origin of tobacco using near-infrared spectroscopy and multimodal convolutional neural networks. The proposed approach improves the accuracy of tobacco origin classification by leveraging the strong feature extraction ability of CNNs.
classification modeling method for near-.methodology: The methodology involves extracting features from one-dimensional near-infrared spectrum data using a one-dimensional convolutional neural network (1-D CNN), and then combining these features with structure features extracted from two-dimensional spectral images by the two-dimensional convolutional neural network (2-D CNN) method.
classification modeling method for near-.research_outcomes: The proposed approach achieves classification accuracy of 93.15% and 93.05% for 1-D CNN and 2-D CNN models, respectively, outperforming traditional PLS-DA methods.

using artificial neural networks and rem.title: Using Artificial Neural Networks and Remotely Sensed Data to Evaluate the Relative Importance of Variables for Prediction of Within-Field Corn and Soybean Yields
using artificial neural networks and rem.summary: This paper uses artificial neural networks (ANN) to predict within-field corn and soybean yields, leveraging remotely sensed data from satellite images. The study evaluates the relative importance of various predictor variables and identifies the most significant ones for each crop type.
using artificial neural networks and rem.methodology: The authors used a combination of ANN and remote sensing techniques to develop models that predict corn and soybean yields at the within-field level. They employed a range of spectral indices derived from satellite images, including NDVI, NDVIre, and Simple Ratio.
using artificial neural networks and rem.statistics: The study reports on the performance of the ANN models using metrics such as mean absolute error (MAE) and relative MAE.
using artificial neural networks and rem.research_outcomes: The results show that the ANN models can accurately predict corn and soybean yields at the within-field level, with the SR index and slope being identified as the most important predictor variables for both crop types.

hyperspectral spectroscopic study of soi.title: Hyperspectral Spectroscopic Study of Soil Properties- A Review
hyperspectral spectroscopic study of soi.summary: This paper reviews the use of hyperspectral spectroscopy for estimating soil properties, highlighting its potential as an alternative to traditional laboratory methods. However, machine learning or AI techniques are not used in this review.
hyperspectral spectroscopic study of soi.methodology: The methodology involves reviewing existing literature on hyperspectral spectroscopy and its applications in soil analysis.
hyperspectral spectroscopic study of soi.research_outcomes: The paper highlights the potential of hyperspectral spectroscopy for estimating soil properties, but does not present any new research outcomes or findings.

faba bean: an untapped source of quality.title: Faba Bean: An Untapped Source of Quality Plant Proteins and Bioactives
faba bean: an untapped source of quality.summary: This paper provides a comprehensive review of the nutritional and biofunctional qualities of faba beans, with a particular focus on protein-derived bioactive peptides. The study highlights the potential of faba beans as a sustainable and quality dietary protein source due to their high protein content, well-balanced amino acid profile, and presence of health-enhancing bioactive compounds.
faba bean: an untapped source of quality.methodology: The paper employs a comprehensive review approach, summarizing the latest key findings related to the nutritional qualities of faba beans and their biofunctional properties.
faba bean: an untapped source of quality.research_outcomes: The study highlights the potential of faba beans as a sustainable and quality dietary protein source due to their high protein content, well-balanced amino acid profile, and presence of health-enhancing bioactive compounds.

prediction of active ingredients in salv.title: Prediction of active ingredients in Salvia miltiorrhiza Bunge. based on soil elements and artificial neural network
prediction of active ingredients in salv.summary: This paper uses an artificial neural network to predict the active ingredients in Salvia miltiorrhiza Bunge. based on soil elements, expanding the application of artificial neural network methods in medicinal botany and providing references for its application in other directions.
prediction of active ingredients in salv.methodology: The study used a BP neural network model to analyze the relationship between soil elements and active components of medicinal plants, establishing a prediction model based on input values from soil elements.
prediction of active ingredients in salv.research_outcomes: The results showed that the artificial neural network model had the best performance (MSE = 0.0203, 0.0164; R2 = 0.93, 0.94) and could be used to screen suitable cultivation sites and optimize fertilizer application.

storage stability of freeze-dried lactob.title: Storage stability of freeze-dried Lactobacillus plantarum S20 starter culture as affected by various formulations of drying medium, and its fermentation characteristics in mung bean (Vigna radiata L.) slurry
storage stability of freeze-dried lactob.summary: This paper investigates the storage stability of freeze-dried Lactobacillus plantarum S20 starter culture using various formulations of drying medium, including mung bean powder with sucrose and trehalose. The study aims to evaluate the influence of these protective agents on the survival of L. plantarum S20 during freeze-drying and subsequent storage. The results show that supplementing mung bean powder with either sucrose or trehalose improves the survival of freeze-dried L. plantarum S20, but no significant difference was observed between the two disaccharides.
storage stability of freeze-dried lactob.methodology: The study used a freeze-drying method to preserve Lactobacillus plantarum S20 starter culture. The drying medium formulations were prepared by mixing mung bean powder with sucrose and trehalose, and the viability of L. plantarum S20 was evaluated after freeze-drying and subsequent storage at 6±2°C and 30±1°C.
storage stability of freeze-dried lactob.research_outcomes: The study found that supplementing mung bean powder with either sucrose or trehalose improves the survival of freeze-dried L. plantarum S20, but no significant difference was observed between the two disaccharides.

imaging of plant current pathways for no.title: Imaging of plant current pathways for non-invasive root Phenotyping using a newly developed electrical current source density approach
imaging of plant current pathways for no.summary: This paper presents a new method for non-invasive root phenotyping using an electrical current source density approach. The method, called inversion of Current Source Density (iCSD), images the positions where the current passes from the plant to the soil by measuring the distribution of the electric potential. The authors develop and test an iCSD inversion code that does not rely on prior assumptions on root architecture and function, and design and conduct rhizotron experiments to validate the approach.
imaging of plant current pathways for no.methodology: The authors use a numerical inversion procedure to invert the acquired data from laboratory rhizotron experiments. The method is based on the distribution of electric current in the root-soil system.
imaging of plant current pathways for no.research_outcomes: The study shows that the iCSD approach can image the positions where the current passes from the plant to the soil, providing direct insight into the root electrical behavior. The authors also evaluate the application of the iCSD method on different plant species (maize and cotton) and growing medium (soil and nutrient solution).

a surrogate modeling approach for the de.title: A Surrogate Modeling Approach for the Development of Biorefineries
a surrogate modeling approach for the de.summary: This paper introduces a generic approach to develop surrogate models for biorefining processes by integrating first-principle knowledge. The proposed methodology is applied to a real-life lignocellulosic organosolv technology, and three case studies demonstrate its potential.
a surrogate modeling approach for the de.methodology: The systematic framework involves an iterative procedure that gradually increases the complexity of the system used for the development of the surrogate model.
a surrogate modeling approach for the de.research_outcomes: The proposed methodology is able to develop accurate surrogate models for biorefining processes, which can be used for optimization and design purposes.

strategic priorities of the scientific p.title: Strategic Priorities of the Scientific Plan of the European Research Infrastructure METROFOOD-RI for Promoting Metrology in Food and Nutrition
strategic priorities of the scientific p.summary: This paper discusses the strategic priorities of the METROFOOD-RI, a pan-European research infrastructure for promoting metrology in food and nutrition. The paper outlines the key thematic areas of research in the food and nutrition domain, including sustainability, traceability, and FAIR data management practices.
strategic priorities of the scientific p.methodology: The methodology involves identifying strengths and weaknesses of the RI in relation to emerging topics of scientific research in food and nutrition, and aligning them with wider societal goals and challenges.
strategic priorities of the scientific p.research_outcomes: The paper identifies key thematic areas for research in the food and nutrition domain, including sustainability, traceability, and FAIR data management practices.

optimization of cardamom fruit extractio.title: Optimization of cardamom fruit extraction using the Box–Behnken design
optimization of cardamom fruit extractio.summary: This paper focuses on optimizing cardamom fruit extraction using the Box-Behnken design to recover polyphenolic compounds. The study aims to identify optimal conditions for solvent ratio, ethanol concentration, and extraction time to yield total phenolic content, total flavonoids, and antioxidant activity.
optimization of cardamom fruit extractio.methodology: The Box-Behnken Design is used as an extraction optimization method based on the response surface method. The study involves maceration using 2 g of dried cardamom fruit powder with variables shown in Tables 1 and 2.
optimization of cardamom fruit extractio.statistics: Statistical methods such as Folin-Ciocalteu, aluminum chloride, glacial acetic acid, proanalytical ethanol, and microplate reader are used to analyze total phenolic content, total flavonoid content, and antioxidant activity.
optimization of cardamom fruit extractio.research_outcomes: The study identifies optimal conditions for solvent ratio, ethanol concentration, and extraction time to yield total phenolic content, total flavonoids, and antioxidant activity. The results can provide knowledge and information about the commercial use of cardamom as an alternative plant in pharmacology.

spatiotemporal assessment and trade-offs.title: Spatiotemporal assessment and trade-offs of multiple ecosystem services based on land use changes in Zengcheng, China
spatiotemporal assessment and trade-offs.summary: This paper assesses the spatiotemporal effects of urbanization on multiple ecosystem services in Zengcheng, China. The study uses land use classification and raster maps to detect past changes in land use types, and evaluates the trade-offs among different ecosystem services.
spatiotemporal assessment and trade-offs.methodology: The authors used a combination of land use classification and raster maps to assess the spatiotemporal effects of urbanization on multiple ecosystem services. They classified land use types into seven categories according to the national standard for classification of land use.
spatiotemporal assessment and trade-offs.research_outcomes: The study found that urbanization has negatively affected ecosystem services in Zengcheng, China. The authors recommend implementing sustainable land use planning policies and ecological engineering measures to improve ecosystem services.

authentication of peaberry and civet cof.title: Authentication of Peaberry and Civet Coffee Using UV-Visible Spectroscopy and PLS-DA Method
authentication of peaberry and civet cof.summary: This paper investigates the influence of particle size on the authentication of peaberry and civet coffee using UV-visible spectroscopy combined with partial least squares-discriminant analysis (PLS-DA) method. The study finds that particle size significantly affects the performance of PLS-DA model, but a calibration model can be developed to compensate for this influence.
authentication of peaberry and civet cof.research_outcomes: The study shows that particle size affects the performance of PLS-DA model, but a calibration model can be developed to compensate for this influence.

signaling pathway activities improve pro.title: Signaling Pathway Activities Improve Prognosis for Breast Cancer
signaling pathway activities improve pro.summary: This paper demonstrates that pathway-level features, such as signaling circuit activities, outperform conventional gene-level features in breast cancer prognosis. The authors use the canonical circuit activity analysis method to recode gene expression values into measurements of signaling circuit activities, which can be used as multigenic mechanistic biomarkers for cancer prognosis.
signaling pathway activities improve pro.methodology: The authors applied the canonical circuit activity analysis method to model signaling activity in breast cancer. They used a dataset from The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) and removed batch effects using the COMBAT method. The resulting normalized values were then entered into the pathway analysis method.
signaling pathway activities improve pro.statistics: trimmed mean of M-values normalization method (TMM)
signaling pathway activities improve pro.research_outcomes: The study shows that signaling circuit activities outperform gene-level features in breast cancer prognosis, and that the proposed classification scheme can suggest relevant signaling circuits related to disease outcome.

the hsp40 chaperone ydj1 drives amyloid.title: The HSP40 chaperone Ydj1 drives amyloid beta 42 toxicity
the hsp40 chaperone ydj1 drives amyloid.summary: This paper investigates the role of the HSP40 chaperone Ydj1 in driving amyloid beta 42 toxicity. The authors use a combinatory genetic and proteomic approach in yeast models to identify Ydj1 as a crucial factor in Abeta42-mediated cell death. However, the study's findings are limited by the use of episomal plasmids, which makes it difficult to interpret the results.
the hsp40 chaperone ydj1 drives amyloid.methodology: The authors used a combinatory genetic and proteomic approach in yeast models to investigate the role of Ydj1 in driving Abeta42 toxicity. They identified Ydj1 as a crucial factor in Abeta42-mediated cell death, but their findings are limited by the use of episomal plasmids.
the hsp40 chaperone ydj1 drives amyloid.research_outcomes: The study found that Ydj1 exacerbates the detrimental effects of amyloid-beta42 through the modulation of its aggregation state. However, the results are difficult to interpret due to the limitations of the yeast model used.

roles of primary cilia in the developing.title: Roles of Primary Cilia in the Developing Brain
roles of primary cilia in the developing.summary: This paper reviews recent advances in understanding the interactions between primary cilia and signaling pathways essential for cellular homeostasis and brain development. Primary cilia play central roles in transducing or regulating several signaling pathways, including Sonic hedgehog (Shh) and Wnt signaling.
roles of primary cilia in the developing.methodology: The paper uses a review approach to summarize recent advances in understanding the interactions between primary cilia and signaling pathways essential for cellular homeostasis and brain development.
roles of primary cilia in the developing.research_outcomes: The study highlights the importance of primary cilia in regulating several signaling pathways, including Shh and Wnt signaling, which are critical to brain development. Defects in primary cilia contribute to a group of syndromic disorders known as “ciliopathies”.

dynamic regulation of canonical tgf\u03b.title: Dynamic regulation of canonical TGFβ signalling by endothelial transcription factor ERG protects from liver fibrogenesis
dynamic regulation of canonical tgf\u03b.summary: This paper investigates the role of the endothelial transcription factor ERG in regulating canonical TGFβ signalling to protect from liver fibrogenesis. The study shows that ERG maintains homoeostatic balance by promoting SMAD1 pathway while repressing SMAD2/3 activity, and its loss leads to spontaneous EndMT and tissue fibrogenesis.
dynamic regulation of canonical tgf\u03b.methodology: The authors used a combination of molecular analysis, gene ontology, and protein interaction studies to investigate the role of ERG in regulating TGFβ signalling.
dynamic regulation of canonical tgf\u03b.research_outcomes: The study identifies a central role for ERG in regulating EC canonical TGFβ-SMAD signalling to prevent EndMT and ultimately tissue fibrogenesis. Loss of endothelial ERG expression is an early, causative event during tissue fibrogenesis.

genetic determinants highlight the exist.title: Genetic Determinants Highlight the Existence of Shared Etiopathogenetic Mechanisms Characterizing Age-Related Macular Degeneration and Neurodegenerative Disorders
genetic determinants highlight the exist.summary: This paper explores the genetic determinants associated with age-related macular degeneration (AMD) and their potential relationship with neurodegenerative disorders (NDDs). The study found that certain genetic variants are shared between AMD and NDDs, suggesting a common etiopathogenetic mechanism. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods were not used in this study.
genetic determinants highlight the exist.methodology: The study used genotyping analysis of 120 genetic variants by OpenArray technology to identify associated single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) with AMD risk.
genetic determinants highlight the exist.statistics: Statistical analysis was performed to reveal the association between SNPs and AMD risk.
genetic determinants highlight the exist.research_outcomes: The study found that 23 SNPs are associated with AMD risk, and certain miRNA variants may contribute to AMD and NDDs by synergistic modulation of disease-relevant genes.

fine tuning of an oxidative stress model.title: Fine Tuning of an Oxidative Stress Model with Sodium Iodate Revealed Protective Effect of NF-κB Inhibition and Sex-Specific Difference in Susceptibility of the Retinal Pigment Epithelium
fine tuning of an oxidative stress model.summary: This paper investigates the effects of sodium iodate on retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) cells in mice, with a focus on NF-κB inhibition and sex-specific differences. The study uses a morphometric method to quantify RPE damage caused by NaIO3-induced oxidative stress.
fine tuning of an oxidative stress model.methodology: The authors used a combination of immunofluorescence staining and confocal microscopy to analyze the effects of NaIO3 on RPE cells in mice. They also performed reverse transcription-quantitative PCR (RT-qPCR) to analyze gene expression levels.
fine tuning of an oxidative stress model.statistics: one-way ANOVA, Student's t test, simple linear regression model
fine tuning of an oxidative stress model.research_outcomes: The study found that NF-κB inhibition protected RPE cells from NaIO3-induced oxidative stress. They also observed sex-specific differences in the susceptibility of RPE cells to NaIO3.

microvascular dysfunction in covid-19: t.title: Microvascular dysfunction in COVID-19: the MYSTIC study
microvascular dysfunction in covid-19: t.summary: This paper investigates microvascular alterations in patients with COVID-19, using a prospective, observational, cross-sectional study to quantify endothelial glycocalyx dimensions and circulating markers of endothelial dysfunction. The results show severe alterations of the microcirculation and endothelial glycocalyx in patients with COVID-19, highlighting the importance of systemic vascular involvement in the disease.
microvascular dysfunction in covid-19: t.methodology: Prospective, observational, cross-sectional study using multiplex analysis of circulating endothelial and glycocalyx-associated markers and novel state-of-the-art image acquisition and analysis approach to detect in vivo alterations of the sublingual microcirculation
microvascular dysfunction in covid-19: t.statistics: non-parametric Mann-Whitney U test and chi-square test
microvascular dysfunction in covid-19: t.research_outcomes: Severe alterations of the microcirculation and endothelial glycocalyx in patients with COVID-19, with significant reductions in vascular density and RBC velocity.

developmental emergence of sparse coding.title: Developmental Emergence of Sparse Coding: A Dynamic Systems Approach
developmental emergence of sparse coding.summary: This paper presents a dynamic systems modeling study that provides mechanistic insights into the sparsification phenomenon in developing neural networks. The authors use system dynamics methods to model the development of neural networks from before to after eye-opening, and demonstrate how specific developmental changes in neuronal and synaptic parameters drive sparsification. They reveal how these changes refine the information processing capabilities of an in vivo developing network, mainly by showing a developmental reduction in the instability of network's firing activity.
developmental emergence of sparse coding.research_outcomes: The study provides mechanistic insights into the sparsification phenomenon and demonstrates how specific developmental changes drive this process. The results show that immature networks lack spontaneous, non-quiescent stable FPs up to a few days prior to eye-opening.

protein kinase a inhibition induces epac.title: Protein kinase A inhibition induces EPAC-dependent acrosomal exocytosis in human sperm
protein kinase a inhibition induces epac.summary: This paper investigates the role of cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP)-dependent processes on acrosomal exocytosis in human sperm. The authors found that inhibition of protein kinase A (PKA) at the end of capacitation induced EPAC-dependent acrosomal exocytosis, with a 50% increase in intracellular cAMP levels.
protein kinase a inhibition induces epac.methodology: The study used various biochemical and microscopic techniques to assess sperm acrosomal exocytosis, including enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for cAMP determination and fluorescence microscopy for actin polymerization analysis.
protein kinase a inhibition induces epac.statistics: analysis of variance (ANOVA) followed by Tukey's honestly significant difference (HSD) comparison
protein kinase a inhibition induces epac.research_outcomes: The study found that inhibition of PKA at the end of capacitation induced EPAC-dependent acrosomal exocytosis, with a 50% increase in intracellular cAMP levels. The authors also found that relatively high concentrations of EPAC substrate inhibited AE.

drug\u2013target interaction prediction.title: Drug–target interaction prediction via multiple classification strategies
drug\u2013target interaction prediction.summary: This paper proposes a new drug-target interaction (DTI) prediction method, MCSDTI, which uses multiple classification strategies to predict interactions for targets with larger numbers of interactions and those with smaller numbers of interactions. The method is shown to be competitive compared to previous methods on most datasets.
drug\u2013target interaction prediction.methodology: The proposed method, MCSDTI, divides targets into two parts: TWLNI (targets with larger numbers of interactions) and TWSNI (targets with smaller numbers of interactions). Different classification strategies are used for each part to predict interactions.
drug\u2013target interaction prediction.statistics: AUCs are compared between the proposed method and previous methods on various datasets.
drug\u2013target interaction prediction.research_outcomes: The proposed method is shown to be competitive compared to previous methods on most datasets, indicating that using different classification strategies for different target parts can improve DTI prediction effectiveness.

mirna targets: from prediction tools to.title: miRNA Targets: From Prediction Tools to Experimental Validation
mirna targets: from prediction tools to.summary: This review discusses the key strategies for miRNA target identification, including computational prediction and experimental validation. Machine Learning methods are used to predict potential targets of miRNAs, with a focus on thermodynamic stability and sequence conservation.
mirna targets: from prediction tools to.research_outcomes: The review provides practical advice for selecting the right approach to miRNA target prediction, including strengths and weaknesses of different methods.

transcriptional differences for covid-19.title: Transcriptional Differences for COVID-19 Disease Map Genes between Males and Females Indicate a Different Basal Immunophenotype Relevant to the Disease
transcriptional differences for covid-19.summary: This paper presents DeCovid, a Shiny app for exploring basal expression level differences between two demographic risk factors, age and sex, for the COVID-19 Disease Map and COVID-19 related pathway genes expressed at several human tissues. The authors used data from the GTEx database to study basal expression differences in COVID-19 associated genes between different demographic groups, identifying a similar immunological state prevalent in young people and women, which is different than that found in men and old people.
transcriptional differences for covid-19.methodology: The authors used RNA-seq data from the Genotype-Tissue Expression project (GTEx) containing data from 44 tissue sources obtained from individuals from both sexes who are deceased but were considered healthy, and that belonged to a wide range of ages. Gene read counts matrix and annotation files were obtained from the GTEx portal.
transcriptional differences for covid-19.research_outcomes: The authors found that a similar immunological state is prevalent in young people and women, which is different than that found in men and old people. This study provides ground for hypotheses on the molecular basis of the COVID-19 sex and age bias.

phosphatidylserine synthase 2 and phosph.title: Phosphatidylserine synthase 2 and phosphatidylserine decarboxylase are essential for aminophospholipid synthesis in T rypanosoma brucei
phosphatidylserine synthase 2 and phosph.summary: This paper investigates the role of phosphatidylserine synthase 2 (TbPSS2) and phosphatidylserine decarboxylase (TbPSD) in aminophospholipid synthesis in Trypanosoma brucei. The study reveals that TbPSS2 is essential for normal growth of T. brucei, while down-regulation of TbPSD affects mitochondrial integrity and ATP production.
phosphatidylserine synthase 2 and phosph.methodology: The authors used tetracycline-inducible down-regulation of gene expression and in vivo and in vitro metabolic labeling to study the role of TbPSS2 and TbPSD in aminophospholipid synthesis.
phosphatidylserine synthase 2 and phosph.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates that TbPSS2 is essential for normal growth of T. brucei, while down-regulation of TbPSD affects mitochondrial integrity and ATP production.

aquaculture state, challenges and techno.title: Aquaculture State, Challenges and Technologies in the Middle East
aquaculture state, challenges and techno.summary: This review paper discusses the current state of aquaculture in the Middle East, highlighting its challenges, technologies, and future prospects. The paper emphasizes the importance of aquaculture for food security and economic growth, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
aquaculture state, challenges and techno.methodology: The methodology involves a review of existing literature on aquaculture in the Middle East, including its challenges, technologies, and future prospects.
aquaculture state, challenges and techno.research_outcomes: The paper highlights the importance of aquaculture for food security and economic growth in the Middle East. It also discusses the challenges faced by the industry, including water access and limitations, climate and geography, and pollution.

deep longitudinal phenotyping of wearabl.title: Deep longitudinal phenotyping of wearable sensor data reveals independent markers of longevity, stress, and resilience
deep longitudinal phenotyping of wearabl.summary: This paper presents a deep learning-based approach to predict biological age acceleration (BAA) from wearable sensor data. The GeroSense system, a deep artificial neural network, extracts health-associated features from physical activity recordings and predicts BAA with high accuracy. The model's output is a single dynamic variable closely related to BAA, which can be used as a biomarker of aging in humans.
deep longitudinal phenotyping of wearabl.methodology: The authors applied deep learning technology to systematically address challenges associated with wearable sensor data, including inaccuracies, missing data, outliers, and varying measurements between devices. They trained the GeroSense system using cross-entropy loss to predict binary labels: the prevalence of at least one chronic disease.
deep longitudinal phenotyping of wearabl.statistics: log-linear proportional hazards models, logistic regression
deep longitudinal phenotyping of wearabl.research_outcomes: The study found that BAA from wearable sensors data is a superior predictor of life expectancy in various professional occupations compared to average daily physical activity-based BAA. The number of non-resilient individuals doubled every 8 years, which is compatible with the mortality rate doubling time characteristic to the Gompertz mortality law.

dysfunctional vascular endothelium as a.title: Dysfunctional Vascular Endothelium as a Driver of Atherosclerosis: Emerging Insights Into Pathogenesis and Treatment
dysfunctional vascular endothelium as a.summary: This review paper examines the role of the vascular endothelium in atherosclerosis, highlighting its involvement in directing site-specificity of plaque formation and governing plaque progression through intracellular processes. The authors discuss emerging evidence that implicates the activated endothelium as a driver of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease.
dysfunctional vascular endothelium as a.methodology: The paper presents a review of existing research on the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis, with a focus on the role of the vascular endothelium. The authors discuss various cellular mechanisms and signaling pathways involved in atherogenesis.
dysfunctional vascular endothelium as a.research_outcomes: The study highlights the importance of understanding the complex cell-cell interactions that drive atherosclerosis, and identifies potential therapeutic targets for preventing or mitigating its clinical sequelae.

the alteration of intrinsic excitability.title: The Alteration of Intrinsic Excitability and Synaptic Transmission in Lumbar Spinal Motor Neurons and Interneurons of Severe Spinal Muscular Atrophy Mice
the alteration of intrinsic excitability.summary: This paper investigates the intrinsic excitability and synaptic transmission in lumbar spinal motor neurons and interneurons of severe spinal muscular atrophy mice. The study found increased excitability and synaptic abnormality in both types of neurons, suggesting a compensatory adjustment occurring in SMA.
the alteration of intrinsic excitability.methodology: The authors used electrophysiology and mouse genetics to identify and manipulate the activity of components of the spinal locomotor networks.
the alteration of intrinsic excitability.research_outcomes: The study found increased excitability and synaptic abnormality in both types of neurons, suggesting a compensatory adjustment occurring in SMA.

an integrated transcriptomic and proteom.title: An Integrated Transcriptomic and Proteomic Analysis Identifies Significant Novel Pathways for Henoch-Schönlein Purpura Nephritis Progression
an integrated transcriptomic and proteom.summary: This study integrates transcriptomic and proteomic analyses to explore the underlying mechanism of Henoch-Schönlein purpura nephritis (HSPN) progression. Although machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not explicitly used, the study employs advanced statistical methods and pathway enrichment analysis to identify significant novel pathways associated with HSPN progression.
an integrated transcriptomic and proteom.methodology: The study employed RNA sequencing and tandem mass tag-based quantitative proteomics to gain serum transcriptomic and proteomic profiles of patients with different types of HSPN. Student's t-tests were performed to obtain the significance of differential gene expression, and clusterProfiler was used for functional annotation.
an integrated transcriptomic and proteom.research_outcomes: The study identified four pathways closely related to HSPN progression, which may play an important role in the progression of HSPN. The results suggest that HSPN progression is mainly due to the inhibition of inflammation, promotion of apoptosis, and repair of renal injury.

rpamide neuropeptides nlp-22 and nlp-2 a.title: RPamide Neuropeptides NLP-22 and NLP-2 Act Through GnRH-like Receptors to Promote Sleep and Wakefulness in C. elegans
rpamide neuropeptides nlp-22 and nlp-2 a.summary: This paper investigates the role of RPamide neuropeptides NLP-22 and NLP-2 in regulating sleep and wakefulness in C. elegans. The authors identify two opposing neuropeptide/receptor signaling pathways: NLP-22 promotes behavioral quiescence, whereas NLP-2 promotes movement during lethargus, by signaling through gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) related receptors. The study demonstrates that GNRR-6 is a receptor for NLP-22 in the regulation of body movement and that NLP-2 peptides promote wakefulness during L4 lethargus.
rpamide neuropeptides nlp-22 and nlp-2 a.methodology: The authors used a combination of in vitro and in vivo experiments to investigate the role of RPamide neuropeptides in regulating sleep and wakefulness. They used a cellular receptor activation assay to test the ability of various peptides to activate GnRH/AKH-like receptors, and they also performed behavioral assays to measure the effects of NLP-22 and NLP-2 overexpression on locomotion quiescence.
rpamide neuropeptides nlp-22 and nlp-2 a.statistics: The authors used statistical methods to analyze the data from their in vitro and in vivo experiments. They used EC50 values to quantify the potency of various peptides in activating GnRH/AKH-like receptors, and they also performed statistical tests to compare the effects of NLP-22 and NLP-2 overexpression on locomotion quiescence.
rpamide neuropeptides nlp-22 and nlp-2 a.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates that RPamide neuropeptides play a crucial role in regulating sleep and wakefulness in C. elegans. The authors identify two opposing neuropeptide/receptor signaling pathways: NLP-22 promotes behavioral quiescence, whereas NLP-2 promotes movement during lethargus. They also show that GNRR-6 is a receptor for NLP-22 in the regulation of body movement and that NLP-2 peptides promote wakefulness during L4 lethargus.

small orfs as new regulators of pri-mirn.title: Small ORFs as New Regulators of Pri-miRNAs and miRNAs Expression in Human and Drosophila
small orfs as new regulators of pri-mirn.summary: This paper investigates the role of small open reading frames (smORFs) in regulating pri-miRNA and miRNA expression in human and Drosophila. The study finds that smORFs can act as cis-regulatory elements, influencing the levels and activity of mature miRNAs.
small orfs as new regulators of pri-mirn.methodology: The authors used a combination of molecular biology techniques, including transfection assays and luciferase reporter assays, to investigate the role of smORFs in regulating pri-miRNA and miRNA expression.
small orfs as new regulators of pri-mirn.research_outcomes: The study identifies smORFs as new cis-acting elements involved in the regulation of pri-miRNAs and miRNAs expression. The results suggest that smORFs can act to regulate the levels and activity of mature miRNAs, and that this regulation is independent of the nucleotide composition of the smORF.

a 19-mirna support vector machine classi.title: A 19-miRNA Support Vector Machine classifier and a 6-miRNA risk score system designed for ovarian cancer patients
a 19-mirna support vector machine classi.summary: This paper presents a machine learning approach to predict the recurrence of ovarian cancer using a Support Vector Machine classifier and a risk score system based on 19 miRNAs. The study aims to improve prognosis and treatment outcomes for ovarian cancer patients by identifying potential biomarkers.
a 19-mirna support vector machine classi.methodology: The methodology involves data standardization, differential expression analysis using limma, and construction of a Support Vector Machine classifier using the Caret package. Recursive feature elimination is used to select the optimal miRNA set.
a 19-mirna support vector machine classi.statistics: univariate and multivariate Cox regression analysis
a 19-mirna support vector machine classi.research_outcomes: A 19-miRNA Support Vector Machine classifier was constructed to predict the recurrence of ovarian cancer, and a 6-miRNA risk score system was developed based on the expression levels of significant miRNAs. The study provides a theoretical basis for prognostic prediction and targeted therapy of ovarian cancer.

assessment of mutation susceptibility in.title: Assessment of Mutation Susceptibility in DNA Sequences with Word Vectors
assessment of mutation susceptibility in.summary: This paper assesses the susceptibility of DNA sequences to mutations using word vectors. The authors apply the dna2vec method, a word embedding approach inspired by Word2Vec, to reveal semantic and syntactic relationships between k-mers in human and mouse genomes. They find a correlation between mutation counts and cosine similarity, suggesting that vector embeddings can predict mutations in genomes.
assessment of mutation susceptibility in.methodology: The authors use the dna2vec method to generate word vectors for k-mers in human and mouse genomes. They then compare the mutation counts and cosine similarity of these vectors to assess their predictive power.
assessment of mutation susceptibility in.research_outcomes: The study finds a correlation between mutation counts and cosine similarity, with 80% of human mutations and 70% of mouse mutations having overlapping top ranks. The authors also prepare confusion matrices for both human and mouse genomes to assess the predictive power of cosine similarity.

immune literacy: reading, writing, and e.title: Immune Literacy: Reading, Writing, and Editing Adaptive Immunity
immune literacy: reading, writing, and e.summary: This review highlights state-of-the-art methods in systems and synthetic biology for understanding adaptive immunity. It showcases novel approaches that integrate immune repertoire sequencing, immunoinformatics, and immunogenomic engineering to reprogram immune responses for translational medicine.
immune literacy: reading, writing, and e.methodology: The paper uses a combination of systems and synthetic biology methods, including immune repertoire sequencing, immunoinformatics, and immunogenomic engineering.
immune literacy: reading, writing, and e.research_outcomes: The review highlights the potential of these approaches to transform the design and breadth of molecular and cellular immunotherapies.

data-driven translational prostate cance.title: Data-driven translational prostate cancer research: from biomarker discovery to clinical decision
data-driven translational prostate cance.summary: This paper reviews the current state of data-driven translational prostate cancer research, focusing on the integration of big data and artificial intelligence to improve clinical decision-making. The authors discuss the heterogeneity and complexity of prostate cancer development and evolution, as well as the role of systems medicine in precision healthcare.
data-driven translational prostate cance.methodology: The paper uses a review-based approach, integrating data from various sources to discuss the current research frontiers in informatics for prostate cancer clinical translation.
data-driven translational prostate cance.research_outcomes: The authors highlight the importance of systems medicine and translational informatics in improving prostate cancer diagnosis and treatment outcomes. They also discuss the challenges and future perspectives related to prostate cancer systems medicine.

pd-1 blockade aggravates epstein\u2013ba.title: PD-1 Blockade Aggravates Epstein–Barr Virus+ Post-Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disorder in Humanized Mice Resulting in Central Nervous System Involvement and CD4+ T Cell Dysregulations
pd-1 blockade aggravates epstein\u2013ba.summary: This paper investigates the effects of PD-1 blockade on post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder (PTLD) in humanized mice. The study found that PD-1 blockade aggravated PTLD and central nervous system involvement, leading to CD4+ T cell dysregulations.
pd-1 blockade aggravates epstein\u2013ba.methodology: The authors used a preclinical model of PTLD in humanized mice to evaluate the effects of PD-1 blockade. The study involved infecting mice with EBV strains and treating them with a PD-1 blocking monoclonal antibody.
pd-1 blockade aggravates epstein\u2013ba.research_outcomes: PD-1 blockade aggravated PTLD and central nervous system involvement, leading to CD4+ T cell dysregulations.

application of granular biocomposites ba.title: Application of Granular Biocomposites Based on Homogenised Peat for Absorption of Oil Products
application of granular biocomposites ba.summary: This paper investigates the use of granular biocomposites made from homogenized peat, devulcanised rubber, and cenospheres for oil product absorption. The study focuses on the material's properties, such as hydrophobicity, porosity, and sorption capacity, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
application of granular biocomposites ba.methodology: The authors used a combination of experimental techniques, including scanning electron microscopy (SEM), X-ray micro-computed tomography (microCT), and digital microscopy to study the material's properties. They also performed sorption capacity tests using diesel fuel and motor oil.
application of granular biocomposites ba.research_outcomes: The study found that the granular biocomposites have a high sorption capacity for oil products, with up to 1.55 g·g−1 sorption capacity for diesel fuel. The authors also observed that the material's hydrophobicity and porosity play important roles in its sorption properties.

robust identification of strain waves du.title: Robust Identification of Strain Waves due to Low-Velocity Impact with Different Impactor Stiffness
robust identification of strain waves du.summary: This paper focuses on the development of an automated impact monitoring system for aeronautical structures. The authors investigate the effects of different impactor stiffnesses on strain wave generation and velocity, aiming to reduce their influence on impact-related features. Signal processing techniques are used to extract features from dynamic strain signals acquired using sensor networks.
robust identification of strain waves du.methodology: Experimental setup involves choosing representative aeronautical structures (metallic plate and sandwich panel) and adopting classical sensor technologies to acquire dynamic strain signals. The authors process the signals to assess strain wave velocity and evaluate the possibility of extracting unique features for each specimen.
robust identification of strain waves du.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates the importance of considering impactor stiffness in impact identification and proposes a method to reduce its influence on impact-related features.

the influence of the chamber configurati.title: The Influence of the Chamber Configuration on the Hydrodynamic Efficiency of Oscillating Water Column Devices
the influence of the chamber configurati.summary: This paper evaluates the influence of the front wall thickness on the hydrodynamic performance of Oscillating Water Column (OWC) devices. The study uses numerical results and compares them with literature values, finding good agreement. The research focuses on the design and construction of OWCs, particularly in breakwaters, and aims to improve their efficiency.
the influence of the chamber configurati.methodology: The potential flow approach was used via the boundary element method (BEM) to analyze the effects of front wall thickness and chamber bottom configurations on OWC device efficiency.
the influence of the chamber configurati.research_outcomes: The study found that a thinner front wall can increase the efficiency band, but may compromise structural integrity. The design of the chamber and power take-off system is crucial for optimal performance.

an efficient stochastic constrained path.title: An Efficient Stochastic Constrained Path Planner for Redundant Manipulators
an efficient stochastic constrained path.summary: This paper proposes a novel stochastic method to efficiently plan collision-free trajectories for redundant manipulators. The approach exploits the kinematics of mechanisms with redundant actuation and maximizes manipulability while avoiding obstacles, providing smooth trajectories that can be directly commanded to the robot.
an efficient stochastic constrained path.methodology: The proposed method uses a stochastic algorithm to generate collision-free trajectories by exploiting the null-space at each configuration along the path to maximize manipulability. It handles kinematic restrictions exactly and does not rely on discretization of task space or configuration space.
an efficient stochastic constrained path.research_outcomes: The proposed method delivers fitting experimental performance for challenging motion problems, providing smooth trajectories that can be directly commanded to the robot without the need for posterior smoothing phase.

overcurrent relay coordination with grid.title: Overcurrent relay coordination with grid-connected and islanding capability on distribution network with distributed generation
overcurrent relay coordination with grid.summary: This paper proposes a method to establish overcurrent relay settings that coordinate correctly for both grid-connected and islanding conditions on distribution networks with distributed generation. The proposed method is based on the idea that a single setting can work for both conditions, and it has been successfully implemented in a case study.
overcurrent relay coordination with grid.methodology: The proposed method involves finding a compromise between the settings for grid-connected and islanding conditions using a flowchart-based approach. The method starts with the setting for grid-connected condition and then creates a new setting based on the islanding condition if necessary.
overcurrent relay coordination with grid.research_outcomes: The proposed method has successfully established a setting that works correctly for both grid-connected and islanding conditions in a case study.

performance of composite shear walls sub.title: Performance of Composite Shear Walls Subjected to In-plane Cyclic Loading-A Numerical Parametric Study
performance of composite shear walls sub.summary: This paper investigates the performance of composite shear walls under in-plane cyclic loading through a numerical parametric study. The research focuses on evaluating the behavior and comparing the performance of different types of composite shear walls, including RC shear walls, composite shear walls with single or double external steel plates, and other configurations.
performance of composite shear walls sub.methodology: Numerical finite element analysis using ABAQUS software
performance of composite shear walls sub.research_outcomes: The study found that the wall4 has the best performance among all four types of shear walls, with an energy absorption capacity approximately two times greater than that of other configurations.
sources_of_inspiration: Rafiei et al. [7] and Hossain et al. [8]

optimal placement of facts devices based.title: Optimal Placement of FACTS Devices Based on Whale Optimization Algorithm for Power System Security Enhancement
optimal placement of facts devices based.summary: This paper presents a methodology to enhance the security of power systems by optimally placing FACTS devices using the Whale Optimization Algorithm. The method analyzes system security based on loading of transmission lines and variations of bus voltages, and combines security constraints with Optimal Power Flow to resolve this problem.
optimal placement of facts devices based.methodology: The methodology uses a metaheuristic technique, Whale Optimization Algorithm (WOA), to solve the optimal power flow problem in the presence of FACTS devices. The WOA's performance is better than state-of-the-art meta-heuristic and conventional algorithms.
optimal placement of facts devices based.research_outcomes: The paper presents an index called Line Overload Severity Index (LOSI) to identify the most critical line in a given system, and evaluates the LOSI value under various load conditions. The optimal location for UPFC device can be determined based on the LOSI value.

demand response contextual remuneration.title: Demand Response Contextual Remuneration of Prosumers with Distributed Storage
demand response contextual remuneration.summary: This paper proposes a methodology to optimally manage community resources, including distributed generation and energy storage systems. The authors aim to address fair and contextual remuneration of prosumers participating in demand response events, reducing uncertainty and improving self-consumption.
demand response contextual remuneration.methodology: The proposed methodology involves optimizing prosumer behavior using past DR events to predict and classify their response, evaluating several approaches for increasing remuneration fairness, and comparing energy price schemes from the community manager and prosumer perspectives.
demand response contextual remuneration.research_outcomes: The authors' results show that it was possible to improve the fairness of the remuneration, which is an incentive and compensation for the loss of comfort. The single fair remuneration approach was more beneficial to the community manager, since the total remuneration was lower than the remaining approaches.

comparative analysis and experimental re.title: Comparative analysis and experimental results of advanced control strategies for vibration suppression in aircraft wings
comparative analysis and experimental re.summary: This paper presents a comparative analysis of two active vibration control methods, Linear Quadratic Regulator and Fractional Order Proportional Derivative controller, for suppressing vibrations in aircraft wings. The study focuses on the experimental results and settling times obtained using these controllers.
comparative analysis and experimental re.methodology: The authors present a tuning method for two controllers: Linear Quadratic Regulator and Fractional Order Proportional Derivative controller. The dynamics of the smart beam is considered as a simple second-order system, allowing for robustness to be addressed.
comparative analysis and experimental re.research_outcomes: The study shows that both types of controllers can successfully reduce oscillations in aircraft wings. The Fractional Order Proportional Derivative controller outperforms the classical PID controller.

fault detection method for permanent mag.title: Fault Detection Method for Permanent Magnet Synchronous Generator Wind Energy Converters Using Correlation Features Among Three-phase Currents
fault detection method for permanent mag.summary: This paper presents a fault detection method for permanent magnet synchronous generator (PMSG) wind energy converters using correlation features among three-phase currents. The proposed method uses an artificial neural network (ANN) trained by the features extracted from motor currents and the DC-link current to detect open-circuit faults (OCFs) in PMSG drives at different wind speeds.
fault detection method for permanent mag.methodology: The proposed method uses a correlation feature identification approach, which extracts features by considering the balance among three-phase currents. The ANN is trained using these features to detect OCFs.
fault detection method for permanent mag.research_outcomes: The results show that the proposed method can detect OCFs in both single and double switches for PMSG drives at different wind speeds with a diagnostic rate greater than 99.4%.

a review on augmentation of voltage stab.title: A Review on Augmentation of Voltage Stability Using Optimization Technique
a review on augmentation of voltage stab.summary: This paper reviews the importance of voltage stability and optimal reactive power dispatch in power systems, discussing traditional and advanced optimization techniques. The authors propose a review of LP Technique and PSO algorithm for system parameters development to improve voltage stability and profile improvement.
a review on augmentation of voltage stab.methodology: The authors use linear programming (LP) and particle swarm optimization (PSO) algorithms to optimize reactive power dispatch and improve voltage stability in power systems.
a review on augmentation of voltage stab.research_outcomes: The study shows that PSO algorithm is more efficient and better than LP technique for optimizing the objective function (ΣL^2) for IEEE 39 bus system.

data-based pid control of flexible joint.title: Data-based PID control of flexible joint robot using adaptive safe experimentation dynamics algorithm
data-based pid control of flexible joint.summary: This paper proposes a data-based PID controller for flexible joint robots using the adaptive safe experimentation dynamics (ASED) algorithm. The ASED algorithm is an enhanced version of the SED algorithm, which improves convergence accuracy by adapting to changes in the objective function.
data-based pid control of flexible joint.methodology: The proposed method uses a data-based approach to design PID controllers for flexible joint robots. The ASED algorithm is used to find the optimal PID parameters that minimize the control objective function.
data-based pid control of flexible joint.research_outcomes: The results show that the proposed data-based PID controller using ASED outperforms the conventional SED method in terms of control accuracy.

free-hand gas identification based on tr.title: Free-hand gas identification based on transfer function ratios without gas flow control
free-hand gas identification based on tr.summary: This paper presents a novel gas identification protocol based on transfer function ratios (TFR) that is intrinsically independent of the gas input pattern. The protocol, combined with MEMS-based sensors, enables free-hand gas identification without gas flow control units, expanding the applicability of gas sensors to portable electronics.
free-hand gas identification based on tr.methodology: The methodology involves combining a novel gas identification protocol based on TFR with MEMS-based sensors. The TFR is calculated from sensing signals obtained through free-hand measurement, allowing for gas species identification without the need for gas flow control units.
free-hand gas identification based on tr.research_outcomes: Highly accurate machine learning models can identify odors of spices and herbs as well as solvent vapors using the proposed protocol. The compact measurement system enables practical artificial olfaction.

numerical simulation and experimental in.title: Numerical simulation and experimental investigation of submersible sewage mixer performance
numerical simulation and experimental in.summary: This paper presents an experimental and numerical investigation of submersible sewage mixer performance. The authors focus on evaluating the efficiency of a submersible mixer using both theoretical and numerical methods, comparing their results with experimental data. Machine learning or AI techniques are not used in this research.
numerical simulation and experimental in.methodology: The methodology involves an experimental setup to measure thrust, torque rotation speed, and electric power, as well as a numerical simulation using CFD Ansys FLUENT software to analyze the operation of the submersible mixer.
numerical simulation and experimental in.research_outcomes: The study presents performance data from experiment and CFD simulation, allowing other researchers to compare their results with a known and validated solution. The authors also discuss the limitations of current design methods for submersible mixers and propose further research in this area.

artificial neural network and response s.title: Artificial Neural Network and Response Surface Methodology Based Analysis on Solid Particle Erosion Behavior of Polymer Matrix Composites
artificial neural network and response s.summary: This paper investigates the erosion behavior of polymer matrix composites using a combination of response surface methodology and artificial neural networks. The study demonstrates how machine learning can be used to model complex material phenomena, with the ANN model showing good agreement with experimental results.
artificial neural network and response s.methodology: The paper uses a Box-Behnken design for experimental planning and a second-order polynomial regression model for correlation of erosion in terms of coded parameters. The artificial neural network model is used to validate the attained outcomes for an optimum solution.
artificial neural network and response s.research_outcomes: The study shows that the impingement angle was the most significant erosion parameter for the solid particle jet erosion process. The combined effect of machining parameters on erosion is also investigated.

a novel method for effective cell segmen.title: A Novel Method for Effective Cell Segmentation and Tracking in Phase Contrast Microscopic Images
a novel method for effective cell segmen.summary: This paper presents a novel method for effective cell segmentation and tracking in phase contrast microscopic images. The proposed method uses the K-means clustering technique to eliminate the halo effect, which interferes with precise segmentation of cell shapes. The method is verified by comparing it with manual tracking results and state-of-the-art unsupervised methods.
a novel method for effective cell segmen.methodology: The proposed method uses a combination of noise reduction using block-matching 3D filtering, k-means clustering to mitigate the halo signal, and active contours for cell boundary detection.
a novel method for effective cell segmen.research_outcomes: The proposed method achieves lower error rates compared to conventional active contour methods and state-of-the-art unsupervised methods.

appliance-level monitoring with micro-mo.title: Appliance-Level Monitoring with Micro-Moment Smart Plugs
appliance-level monitoring with micro-mo.summary: This paper proposes a micro-moment-based smart plug system for energy efficiency, which collects contextual information and enables real-time power measurements. The system is part of the broader (EM ) 3 project that uses artificial intelligence to achieve high domestic energy performance.
appliance-level monitoring with micro-mo.methodology: The proposed system combines energy tracking at the device level with environmental details of the current household space, using a micro-moment-based approach.
appliance-level monitoring with micro-mo.research_outcomes: The system delivers cost-effective deployment while maintaining adequate computation and wireless performance.

power system small-signal stability as a.title: Power System Small-Signal Stability as Affected by Grid-Connected SmartPark
power system small-signal stability as a.summary: This paper examines the impact of grid-connected smart charging stations on power system small-signal stability. The authors employ damping torque analysis to investigate the effects of smart charging station integration on transmission system dynamics, finding that optimal charging capacity is crucial for maintaining dynamic stability.
power system small-signal stability as a.methodology: Damping Torque Analysis (DTA) and linearized models
power system small-signal stability as a.research_outcomes: The study reveals the importance of considering optimal charging capacity in smart charging station design to ensure power system small-signal stability.

forecasting short-term load using econom.title: Forecasting Short-term load using Econometrics time series model with T-student Distribution
forecasting short-term load using econom.summary: This paper focuses on short-term load forecasting, a crucial aspect of electrical system planning and dispatching. The authors propose an Autoregressive integrated moving average (SARIMA) - generalized autoregressive conditional heteroskedasticity (GARCH) model with T-student Distribution to forecast electric load for one day ahead. Although the paper uses econometrics time series models, which are not typically considered machine learning or AI methods, it does not explicitly mention any ML/AI techniques.
forecasting short-term load using econom.methodology: The authors use real electricity load data from the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) and apply various econometrics time series models to forecast electric load. They compare their proposed SARIMA-GARCH model with the ARIMA model and validate its effectiveness using real data.
forecasting short-term load using econom.statistics: time series regression, Augmented Dickey-Fuller test, McLeod-Li test
forecasting short-term load using econom.research_outcomes: The authors demonstrate that their proposed SARIMA-GARCH model outperforms the ARIMA model in forecasting electric load for one day ahead. They also show that the model can handle non-stationary and heteroscedastic data.

experimental analysis of modified dc-p&o.title: Experimental Analysis of Modified DC-P&O Technique with Arm Controller for a Stand-Alone 40 W PV System
experimental analysis of modified dc-p&o.summary: This paper presents an experimental analysis of a modified direct-control perturbation & observation (DC-P&O) technique for a stand-alone 40 W photovoltaic system. The authors focus on improving the efficiency of solar cells by proposing a modified DC-P&O method using an efficient DC-DC boost convertor and an intelligent, efficient and low-cost 32-bit ARM Cortex microcontroller.
experimental analysis of modified dc-p&o.methodology: The methodology involves step-by-step discussion of the workflow, including the use of a block diagram to help learners understand the overall process. The authors propose a modified DC-P&O technique using an efficient DC-DC boost convertor and an intelligent, efficient and low-cost 32-bit ARM Cortex microcontroller.
experimental analysis of modified dc-p&o.research_outcomes: The proposed modified DC-P&O technique enhances the efficiency of the controller by 84.48% for real-time parameters of the PV panel at maximum power point (MPP) for a 57% duty ratio.

sequential algorithm for combined state.title: Sequential Algorithm for Combined State of Charge and State of Health Estimation of Lithium Ion Battery based on Active Current Injection
sequential algorithm for combined state.summary: This paper proposes a sequential algorithm for estimating the state of charge (SoC) and state of health (SoH) of lithium-ion batteries using active current injection. The algorithm uses frequency-scale separation to estimate parameters/states sequentially, improving estimation performance compared to concurrent algorithms.
sequential algorithm for combined state.methodology: The proposed sequential algorithm consists of three main steps: estimating the ohmic resistance Rs independently by injecting a high-frequency current and incorporating a high-pass filter; characterizing the RC pair by injecting a medium-frequency current based on the estimated Rs; and estimating the battery capacity and SoC concurrently.
sequential algorithm for combined state.research_outcomes: The proposed sequential algorithm significantly increases estimation accuracy compared to concurrent algorithms. Experimental results verify its effectiveness for various battery capacities.

high density resistive array readout sys.title: High Density Resistive Array Readout System for Wearable Electronics
high density resistive array readout sys.summary: This paper presents a wearable sensing system for high-density resistive array readout, which measures the resistance change of sensors using a custom graphical user interface. The system consists of a readout board and a battery housed in a wristband chassis.
high density resistive array readout sys.methodology: The methodology involves collecting and multiplexing sensor output, processing it using an analog-to-digital converter, and sending the converted data to a PC or smartphone.
high density resistive array readout sys.research_outcomes: The system shows promising results for applications in IoT, point-of-care testing, and low-cost wearable devices.

assessment of rough set theory in relati.title: Assessment of Rough Set Theory in Relation to Risks Regarding Hydraulic Engineering Investment Decisions
assessment of rough set theory in relati.summary: This paper assesses the application of rough set theory in hydraulic engineering investment decisions, proposing innovations for optimizing water conservancy project investment decision-making. The study uses rough set theory to analyze imprecise and uncertain information, discovering hidden knowledge that can be used to discover potential rules.
assessment of rough set theory in relati.methodology: Rough set theory is applied to analyze various kinds of imprecise, inconsistent, uncompleted, or imperfect information from which it can find hidden knowledge that can be used to discover a potential rule.
