assessment of rough set theory in relati.research_outcomes: The study proposes the application of rough set theory in the optimization of water conservancy project investment decision-making, providing a scientific basis for water conservancy project investment decision-making. The data processed by the rough set method are discrete, and unlike other methods, this theory can solve the discrete phenomenon of data.

prediction and evaluation of photovoltai.title: Prediction and evaluation of photovoltaic-thermal energy systems production using artificial neural network and experimental dataset
prediction and evaluation of photovoltai.summary: This paper presents a novel mathematical and ANN model for examining the performance of PV/T systems, with a focus on predicting and assessing photovoltaic-thermal energy system production using artificial neural network models based on an experimental dataset in Sohar/Oman. The proposed neural models can generate future figures for any needed period that accurately fit the actual datasets.
prediction and evaluation of photovoltai.methodology: The study used a combination of mathematical and ANN models to examine the performance of PV/T systems, with experimental data collected from Sohar/Oman. The proposed neural models were trained using an experimental dataset and validated using descriptive statistics and Evaluation Metrics.
prediction and evaluation of photovoltai.research_outcomes: The results show that the proposed ANN model can accurately predict and assess PV/T system production, with improved performance compared to conventional methods. The study highlights the potential of ANN models in examining the performance of PV/T systems.

electrical modification and experimental.title: Electrical Modification and Experimental Study of Combine Harvester Reaping Unit
electrical modification and experimental.summary: This paper focuses on the electrical modification of a combine harvester reaping unit to improve efficiency and reduce labor requirements. The research team proposes an electric refit for the reaping unit, including the selection of motor and reducer, 3D design, and finite element analysis. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.
electrical modification and experimental.methodology: The methodology involves electrical modification of the reaping unit, including structural modifications, selection and design of motor and reducer, overall layout and mounting method, shaft connection method, external dimension comparison, finite element analysis, and multi-motor speed following based on PLC.
electrical modification and experimental.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates the feasibility of electrical modification for combine harvester reaping units, providing a theoretical basis and experimental data for robotics research in this area.

farmers' willingness to pay for sinar do.title: Farmers' willingness to pay for Sinar donkey conservation in selected districts of Metekel and Assosa zones, northwest Ethiopia: a contingent valuation study
farmers' willingness to pay for sinar do.summary: This paper conducts a contingent valuation study to assess farmers' willingness to pay for Sinar donkey conservation in selected districts of Metekel and Assosa zones, northwest Ethiopia. The study uses descriptive statistics and logistic regression to analyze the data, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
farmers' willingness to pay for sinar do.methodology: The study employed a contingent valuation approach using structured and semi-structured questionnaires to collect data on socio-economic and farming system characteristics from 160 respondents in two districts. Descriptive statistics were used to summarize the data, and logistic regression was applied to see the effect of independent variables on the dependent variable.
farmers' willingness to pay for sinar do.research_outcomes: The study found that farmers' willingness to pay for Sinar donkey conservation is influenced by their cash income, with an average willingness to pay of 98.25 Ethiopian Birr or 3.265US dollars per household per annum.

reward value-based goal selection for ag.title: Reward Value-Based Goal Selection for Agents' Cooperative Route Learning Without Communication in Reward and Goal Dynamism
reward value-based goal selection for ag.summary: This paper proposes a goal selection method to enable agents to cooperate without communication by adapting to dynamic changes in reward values and goals. The proposed method uses two unified conditions to select the appropriate purposes, making all agents learn to achieve their goals in order of minimum condition value.
reward value-based goal selection for ag.methodology: The paper proposes a noncommunicative multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) method based on unified conditions for goal selection. The method makes all agents learn to achieve their purposes in the order of minimum condition values, and each agent learns cooperative policy by PMRL-OM as the previous method.
reward value-based goal selection for ag.research_outcomes: The proposed method performs better than PMRL-OM without some conditions in grid world problems. The unified conditions can direct the appropriate goals for agents.

comparison of random forest, logistic re.title: Comparison of Random Forest, Logistic Regression, and Multilayer Perceptron Methods on Classification of Bank Customer Account Closure
comparison of random forest, logistic re.summary: This paper compares the performance of three machine learning methods (Random Forest, Logistic Regression, and Multilayer Perceptron) in classifying bank customer account closure. The results show that the Multilayer Perceptron method achieves the highest accuracy (85.5373%) and is therefore considered the best model for this task.
comparison of random forest, logistic re.methodology: The paper uses a data mining approach with early stage preprocessing to clean data from outliers and missing values, followed by feature selection to select important attributes. The three machine learning methods are then applied to the preprocessed data using 10-fold Cross Validation.
comparison of random forest, logistic re.research_outcomes: The Multilayer Perceptron method achieves the highest accuracy (85.5373%) in classifying bank customer account closure, outperforming Random Forest and Logistic Regression methods.

bank competition in china: a blessing or.title: Bank competition in China: a blessing or a curse for financial system?
bank competition in china: a blessing or.summary: This paper investigates the relationship between bank competition and systematic risk in China, using a dynamic causality model. The study finds a bidirectional causal relationship between banking competition and systematic risk, with both positive and negative effects.
bank competition in china: a blessing or.methodology: The authors use a time-varying rolling window approach to estimate the dynamic causality of bank competition and systematic risk in China.
bank competition in china: a blessing or.statistics: Granger and sub-sample time varying rolling window
bank competition in china: a blessing or.research_outcomes: The results show that increased bank competition leads to reduced systematic risk, supporting the competition-stability hypothesis. However, there is also evidence of reverse causality from systematic risk to banking competition.

deep reinforcement learning in a monetar.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning in a Monetary Model
deep reinforcement learning in a monetar.summary: This paper proposes the use of deep reinforcement learning to solve dynamic stochastic general equilibrium models. The authors combine a standard DSGE modeling approach with flexible expectations formation, using modern developments in deep reinforcement learning to enable agents to learn nonlinear decision rules via deep artificial neural networks.
deep reinforcement learning in a monetar.methodology: The authors use a policy-based deep reinforcement learning approach that can deal with high-dimensional continuous action spaces. They apply their proposed approach to a classical model from the adaptive learning literature in macroeconomics, which looks at the interaction of monetary and fiscal policy.
deep reinforcement learning in a monetar.research_outcomes: The results show that when an active fiscal or monetary policy is paired with a passive policy, the corresponding rational expectations equilibria are determinate, and both Adaptively Learning Agent and Artificially Intelligent Agent can learn these equilibria. However, when both monetary and fiscal policy are active (or passive), the corresponding rational expectations equilibria are explosive (or indeterminate), and contrary to the Adaptively Learning Agent, our Artificially Intelligent Agent remains capable of learning these equilibria.

on the enrichment of time series with te.title: On the enrichment of time series with textual data for forecasting agricultural commodity prices
on the enrichment of time series with te.summary: This paper presents a method to enrich time-series data with textual information for forecasting agricultural commodity prices. The authors use a combination of time-series and textual features, including domain-specific terms extracted from texts, to improve the accuracy of their models.
on the enrichment of time series with te.methodology: The proposed method, TSED, combines time-series data with vector representations of texts to enrich the predictive task. The authors use a set of finite terms extracted from texts to represent the textual information and concatenate it with the time-series observations.
on the enrichment of time series with te.statistics: Histogram-based Gradient Boosting Regression (HGBR), Support Vector Regression (SVR), Random Forest Regressor (RF), and Bagging Regressor (BR) are used for regression tasks
on the enrichment of time series with te.research_outcomes: The authors present promising results in several time-series forecasting works, including an increase in performance compared to traditional timeseries forecasting models.

differentiations in women\u2019s land te.title: Differentiations in Women’s Land Tenure Experiences: Implications for Women’s Land Access and Tenure Security in Sub-Saharan Africa
differentiations in women\u2019s land te.summary: This paper explores the differentiated land tenure experiences of women in sub-Saharan Africa, highlighting the need for policies to address the heterogeneity of women's situations. The study uses evidence from Ghana, Nigeria, and Zimbabwe to show that women have unique problems, needs, and statuses in their quest for land access and tenure security.
differentiations in women\u2019s land te.methodology: The study used a mixed-methods approach, combining literature review with empirical qualitative data from fieldwork. The authors collected data at district levels in Ghana and Zimbabwe, and at the local level in Nigeria.
differentiations in women\u2019s land te.research_outcomes: The findings include a matrix of factors that differentiate women's land access and tenure security, a visualisation of women's differentiation in land tenure showing possible modes for actions, and an adaptable approach for operationalising women's differentiation in land tenure policies.

covid-19 acceleration in digitalisation,.title: COVID-19 acceleration in digitalisation, aggregate productivity growth and the functional income distribution
covid-19 acceleration in digitalisation,.summary: This paper examines the impact of COVID-19 on digitalization, aggregate productivity growth, and the functional income distribution in the EU economy. The authors use a two-sector growth model to analyze the effects of a persistent increase in demand for digital services on productivity and inequality.
covid-19 acceleration in digitalisation,.methodology: The authors extend the standard one-sector neoclassical growth model by distinguishing between conventional and digital sectors, with the latter characterized by fixed costs but low marginal cost.
covid-19 acceleration in digitalisation,.research_outcomes: The paper finds that a persistent increase in demand for digital services can lead to a reduction of the labour share, particularly if accompanied by a reduction of competition. It also suggests that the digital transition may affect economic sectors and the workforce in differentiated ways, possibly exacerbating the decline in labour shares.

feasibility of nowcasting sdg indicators.title: Feasibility of nowcasting SDG indicators: a comprehensive survey
feasibility of nowcasting sdg indicators.summary: This paper explores the feasibility of nowcasting Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) indicators, aiming to address the issue of long publication lags. The authors conducted a comprehensive survey of 362 SDG indicators and sub-indicators, classifying them as highly likely, likely, or unlikely for nowcasting. The study highlights the potential of nowcasting in leveraging timely data from various sources, but also notes concerns over methodology robustness and data validity.
feasibility of nowcasting sdg indicators.methodology: The authors employed a comprehensive survey approach to assess the nowcasting feasibility of SDG indicators, considering factors such as data availability, publication lags, and explanatory variables.
feasibility of nowcasting sdg indicators.research_outcomes: The study found that 150 out of 362 surveyed indicators were highly likely to be suitable for nowcasting, while 87 were likely and 125 were unlikely. The authors also highlighted the importance of addressing concerns over methodology robustness and data validity in nowcasting SDG indicators.

tracking covid-19 decease through rollin.title: Tracking COVID-19 Decease Through Rolling Conditional Variance
tracking covid-19 decease through rollin.summary: This paper proposes a tracking indicator for volatility and COVID-19 direction, including a weekly window to observe its evolution. The research aims to track the total deaths caused by COVID-19 in the most affected countries after the approval, distribution, and implementation of vaccines from 2021.
tracking covid-19 decease through rollin.methodology: The authors use an Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) specification as a first adjustment, followed by estimating the conditional variance of total deaths from an Exponential Generalized Autoregressive Conditional Heteroscedasticity (EGARCH).
tracking covid-19 decease through rollin.research_outcomes: The paper proposes a tracking indicator for volatility and COVID-19 direction, including a weekly window to observe its evolution.

based on dpsir model environmental plann.title: Based on DPSIR Model Environmental Planning and Risk Evaluation in the Early Stage of State-Level New Areas Development
based on dpsir model environmental plann.summary: This paper applies the DPSIR conceptual model to summarize and extract a state-level new Area risk evaluation index system, using traditional statistical methods and high-order mathematical models as comparison. The study identifies 23 risk indicators and uses the adaptability and reliability and validity to test the reliability of the indicator system.
based on dpsir model environmental plann.methodology: The DPSIR model is used as a tool to construct a national-level new district risk assessment index system, identifying 23 risk indicators such as 'growth rate of production'. The random forest algorithm is used to explain the general process of State-level New Areas development risk assessment.
based on dpsir model environmental plann.statistics: traditional statistical methods and high-order mathematical models
based on dpsir model environmental plann.research_outcomes: The study provides a relatively reasonable model explanation for the application of risk assessment in environmental planning, combining the characteristics of the target object. The research outcomes provide strong support for the environmental planning and evaluation of the state-level new Area.

inclusive finance, industrial structure.title: Inclusive finance, industrial structure upgrading and farmers’ income: Empirical analysis based on provincial panel data in China
inclusive finance, industrial structure.summary: This paper empirically studies the relationship among inclusive finance, industrial structure upgrading and farmers’ income using a panel dataset of 28 provinces in China from 2006 to 2016. The research finds that inclusive finance can significantly promote the increase of farmers’ income through its intermediary mechanism, the Upgrading of Industry Structure (UIS). However, the development model of inclusive finance should be transformed to give full play to its hematopoietic function and guiding role, supporting the UIS.
inclusive finance, industrial structure.methodology: Empirical analysis based on provincial panel data
inclusive finance, industrial structure.research_outcomes: Inclusive finance can significantly promote farmers’ income through the UIS. The development model of inclusive finance should be transformed to support the UIS.

neural payoff machines: predicting fair.title: Neural Payoff Machines: Predicting Fair and Stable Payoff Allocations Among Team Members
neural payoff machines: predicting fair.summary: This paper presents a novel approach to predicting fair and stable payoff allocations among team members using neural networks. The authors combine solution concepts from cooperative game theory with the predictive power of neural networks, creating models that can generalize to games far from the training distribution and predict solutions for more players than observed during training.
neural payoff machines: predicting fair.methodology: The methodology involves training neural networks on large sets of weighted voting games and computing their respective game theoretic solutions. The authors use a combination of solution concepts from cooperative game theory, including the Shapley value, Banzhaf index, and Least-Core.
neural payoff machines: predicting fair.statistics: The paper uses statistical methods to analyze the performance of the proposed models and compare them to traditional approaches.
neural payoff machines: predicting fair.research_outcomes: The research outcomes show that the proposed approach can accurately predict fair and stable payoff allocations among team members, even in games far from the training distribution. The authors also demonstrate the applicability of their approach to feature importance games in explainable AI.

extension agents perception of open data.title: Extension Agents Perception of Open Data Usage in Agricultural Communication in Abia State
extension agents perception of open data.summary: This paper assesses the perception of open data usage among agricultural extension agents in Abia State, Nigeria. While open data is recognized as a driver for economic growth and a means to facilitate precision agriculture, its use is hindered by challenges such as lack of funding, internet facilities, and adequate knowledge of ICT tools.
extension agents perception of open data.methodology: Simple random sampling technique was used to select 83 extension agents. Data was collected using structured questionnaires and analyzed with frequency counts, percentages, and mean.
extension agents perception of open data.research_outcomes: The study found that a moderate percentage (68%) of extension agents were aware of open data, but faced challenges such as lack of funding and internet facilities. The use of open data was perceived to facilitate agricultural research, access to research findings, and sharing of information across country borders.
sources_of_inspiration: Open Data in the Agriculture System, 2019

cognitive sophistication and deliberatio.title: Cognitive Sophistication and Deliberation Times
cognitive sophistication and deliberatio.summary: This paper explores the relationship between cognitive sophistication, deliberation times, and behavioral heterogeneity in economics. The authors propose a model that links cognitive effort to choices and deliberation times, using stylized facts from psychophysiological literature on response times. They test this model experimentally in two games commonly used to study iterative thinking.
cognitive sophistication and deliberatio.methodology: The authors use a laboratory experiment to test their model, which incorporates stylized facts from the psychophysiological literature on response times. The experiment involves two games: the beauty contest game and another game.
cognitive sophistication and deliberatio.research_outcomes: The study confirms Predictions 1-4 of the proposed model, providing evidence that deliberation times can be used as a correlate of cognitive effort. The results suggest that increasing incentives leads to more steps of reasoning, but also shorter deliberation times per step.

irrelevant matches in round-robin tourna.title: Irrelevant matches in round-robin tournaments
irrelevant matches in round-robin tourna.summary: This paper investigates the existence of round-robin tournaments with no irrelevant matches. The authors formalize the notion of relevant and irrelevant matches, and study the circumstances under which relevant tournaments exist. They prove that all tournaments with a static schedule and at least five players include a match that is irrelevant for both agents, but show that dynamic schedules can be devised to avoid irrelevant matches.
irrelevant matches in round-robin tourna.methodology: The authors use a probabilistic setting, based on the Bradley-Terry model, to resolve uncertainty about future matches. They also postulate a set of admissibility conditions over preferences, modelling the fact that players aim at outdoing each other.
irrelevant matches in round-robin tourna.research_outcomes: The main results are: (1) all tournaments with a static schedule and at least five players include a match that is irrelevant for both agents; (2) for all numbers of players, there is a tournament with a dynamic schedule where all matches are relevant for at least one of the involved players; and (3) all tournaments where all players are called to play with approximately equal frequency (called balanced tournaments) with at least six players include a match that is irrelevant for one of the involved players.

determinants of banks\u2019 cost efficie.title: Determinants of banks’ cost efficiency: a case study of selected commercial banks, Ethiopia
determinants of banks\u2019 cost efficie.summary: This paper examines the determinants of cost efficiency in Ethiopian commercial banks using a stochastic frontier analysis. The study focuses on the role of bank-specific and macroeconomic factors in influencing cost efficiency, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
determinants of banks\u2019 cost efficie.methodology: The study uses a translog stochastic cost frontier approach to analyze the relative cost efficiency of commercial banks in Ethiopia based on an intermediation approach.
determinants of banks\u2019 cost efficie.research_outcomes: The findings show that bank-specific factors such as return on assets, intermediation ratio, and capital adequacy ratio have a significant impact on cost efficiency. Macroeconomic factors such as GDP also have a negative but insignificant effect on inefficiency.

real-time bidding for time constrained i.title: Real-time Bidding for Time Constrained Impression Contracts in First and Second Price Auctions -- Theory and Algorithms
real-time bidding for time constrained i.summary: This paper studies the optimal behavior of a bidder in real-time auctions with time constraints, focusing on first and second price mechanisms. The authors show that the problem can be reduced to a convex optimization problem and provide algorithms for implementing solutions. While ML/AI methods are not explicitly used, the paper's focus on dynamic bidding policies and contract management involves complex statistical estimation problems.
real-time bidding for time constrained i.methodology: The authors use convex duality and optimization techniques to analyze the problem and develop practical algorithms for implementation.
real-time bidding for time constrained i.statistics: classical control theory methods (e.g., PID controllers), MDP formulations, reinforcement learning
real-time bidding for time constrained i.research_outcomes: The paper shows that there is a close connection between first and second price cases, both theoretically and through experimental evidence. The authors also provide detailed simulation evidence and practical methods for adaptation to a stochastic environment.

covid-19 and its impacts on global econo.title: COVID-19 and Its Impacts on Global Economic Spheres
covid-19 and its impacts on global econo.summary: This paper analyzes the socio-economic impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic on global economic spheres, highlighting its effects on GDP, unemployment rates, and poverty. Although the study mentions artificial intelligence, robots, and changing technologies as necessary for survival in critical times, it does not explicitly use or integrate machine learning (ML) methods into its methodology.
covid-19 and its impacts on global econo.methodology: The study uses qualitative and quantitative methods to analyze secondary sources of data and information from scientific and academic journals, scholar articles, research papers, books, and other relevant sources.
covid-19 and its impacts on global econo.research_outcomes: The paper finds that the pandemic has had a significant impact on global economic indicators, including GDP, unemployment rates, and poverty. It also highlights the need for intergovernmental measures to support economies during the pandemic.

an integrated ecological-social simulati.title: An Integrated Ecological-Social Simulation Model of Farmer Decisions and Cropping System Performance in the Rolling Pampas (Argentina)
an integrated ecological-social simulati.summary: This paper presents an integrated ecological-social simulation model, AgroDEVS, which uses agent-based modeling and Cellular Automata to simulate land-use and cover change (LUCC) dynamics in the Rolling Pampas region of Argentina. The model integrates economic, environmental, and social factors to predict LUCC patterns and their associated economic and environmental changes.
an integrated ecological-social simulati.methodology: The authors employed a scenario-based analysis, exploring agricultural mosaic dynamics, and adopted an agent-based modeling approach using the Cell-DEVS formalism. The model was implemented using the CD++ simulation software toolkit.
an integrated ecological-social simulati.statistics: Normalized RMSE, Probability of a Match, Index of Observed Fit
an integrated ecological-social simulati.research_outcomes: The study found that economic goals were achieved on average each 6 out of 10 years, but environmental thresholds were only achieved in 1.9 out of 10 years. The model proved well-suited to reproduce empirical situations where changes in production/output prices, climate regimes, or farmer aspiration levels occurred.

german forecasters' narratives: how info.title: German forecasters' narratives: How informative are German business cycle forecast reports?
german forecasters' narratives: how info.summary: This paper analyses the information content of German forecasters' narratives for German business cycle forecasts. The authors apply textual analysis to convert qualitative text data into quantitative sentiment indices, which are then used to test the efficiency of numerical forecasts. While the results suggest some informational content of sentiment indices for growth and inflation forecasts, the predictive power is weak.
german forecasters' narratives: how info.methodology: Textual analysis using dictionary methods and text regression methods with recursive estimation
german forecasters' narratives: how info.research_outcomes: The study finds that German forecasters' narratives contain some additional information relative to numerical forecasts, but the predictive power is weak.

empirical study and model simulation of.title: Empirical study and model simulation of global stock market dynamics during COVID-19
empirical study and model simulation of.summary: This paper empirically studies the impact of COVID-19 on global stock markets, focusing on large volatility dynamics, variation-fluctuation correlation function, and epidemic-fluctuation correlation function. The authors generalize the Heston model to simulate stock market dynamics under the influence of COVID-19.
empirical study and model simulation of.methodology: Empirical analysis and model simulation using the Heston model
empirical study and model simulation of.research_outcomes: The study finds that COVID-19 has a significant impact on global stock markets, leading to increased volatility and correlation between oil markets and U.S. stock markets.

modeling unemployment duration, determin.title: Modeling Unemployment Duration, Determinants and Insurance Premium Pricing of Malaysia: Insights from an Upper Middle-Income Developing Country
modeling unemployment duration, determin.summary: This paper investigates the behavior and determinants of unemployment in Malaysia, an upper middle-income country with relatively low unemployment but rising labor market mismatches. The study uses statistical modeling to estimate unemployment duration and derive a model-based insurance premium pricing schedule that broadens the country's unemployment insurance coverage.
modeling unemployment duration, determin.methodology: The paper employs a parametric approach using the Burr distribution, which is fitted to the data set given its superiority over other forms in terms of flexibility. Survival analysis via hazard function corresponding to Burr distribution is used to estimate unemployment duration.
modeling unemployment duration, determin.statistics: Burr distribution, Cox proportional hazards model
modeling unemployment duration, determin.research_outcomes: The study finds that age, gender, and education are significant explanatory variables of unemployment. The results show that the youngest cohort has the least likelihood of being hired, while the older groups are found to have a lower hazard ratio that could be attributed to work experience.

accumulating risk capital through invest.title: Accumulating Risk Capital Through Investing in Cooperation
accumulating risk capital through invest.summary: This paper proposes a method for training policies that balance safety and cooperation in sequential social dilemmas, using the concept of risk capital to incentivize long-term cooperation. The proposed algorithm, ARCTIC, is shown to be effective in achieving cooperation while maintaining safety in Prisoner's Dilemma and Stag Hunt.
accumulating risk capital through invest.methodology: The authors use reinforcement learning (RL) to train policies that balance safety and cooperation. They propose a method for training policies that targets the objective of accumulating risk capital through investing in cooperation, using policy-conditioned beliefs to incentivize cooperation.
accumulating risk capital through invest.research_outcomes: The paper shows that ARCTIC achieves cooperation while maintaining safety in Prisoner's Dilemma and Stag Hunt. The authors also show that the trade-off between safety and cooperativeness decreases with length of interaction.

proportional justified representation.title: Proportional Justified Representation
proportional justified representation.summary: This paper extends the work of Aziz et al. on multi-winner elections by introducing Proportional Justified Representation (PJR), a relaxation of Extended Justified Representation (EJR) that is compatible with perfect representation and can be computed in polynomial time. The authors also show that PJR provides weaker guarantees than EJR regarding average voter satisfaction.
proportional justified representation.methodology: The paper uses mathematical modeling and proof-based reasoning to analyze the properties of multi-winner voting rules, including PJR and EJR.
proportional justified representation.research_outcomes: The authors prove that PJR is compatible with perfect representation and can be computed in polynomial time. They also show that PJR provides weaker guarantees than EJR regarding average voter satisfaction.

distributed gne seeking under partial-de.title: Distributed GNE seeking under partial-decision information over networks via a doubly-augmented operator splitting approach
distributed gne seeking under partial-de.summary: This paper focuses on distributed computation of generalized Nash equilibrium (GNE) in games with shared coupling constraints, assuming players have only partial-decision information. The authors propose a fully distributed GNE seeking algorithm using an operator-splitting approach, which is the first such algorithm in the literature.
distributed gne seeking under partial-de.research_outcomes: The proposed algorithm converges to a variational GNE with fixed step-sizes over any connected graph, leveraging monotone operator-splitting techniques.

tgv-regularized inversion of the radon t.title: TGV-regularized inversion of the Radon transform for photoacoustic tomography
tgv-regularized inversion of the radon t.summary: This paper proposes a reconstruction method for photoacoustic tomography using total generalized variation regularization for the inversion of the Radon transform. The method is shown to be capable of artifact-free inversion and has the potential to push the limits for optical phase-contrast PAT.
tgv-regularized inversion of the radon t.methodology: The proposed method uses variational regularization, specifically TGV regularization, to invert the Radon transform in photoacoustic tomography. The approach is shown to be capable of reducing imaging time towards real-time 3D PAT by parallelization and employing sophisticated image reconstruction methods.
tgv-regularized inversion of the radon t.research_outcomes: The proposed method has been validated numerically and experimentally, and shows a speed-up factor of four without compromising reconstruction quality. The results indicate that the method has the potential to push the limits for optical phase-contrast PAT.

summation of gaussian shifts as jacobi's.title: Summation of Gaussian shifts as Jacobi's third Theta function
summation of gaussian shifts as jacobi's.summary: This paper explores the connection between summation of Gaussian shifts and the solution to a Schrödinger equation, providing a concise and controllable upper bound for the saturation error in terms of the shape parameters. The results show that flatter Gaussian radial basis functions result in better approximation quality.
summation of gaussian shifts as jacobi's.methodology: The paper uses modular identity or Jacobi's imaginary transformation to derive a direct consequence of the result, providing an alternative perspective to using flat radial basis functions.
summation of gaussian shifts as jacobi's.research_outcomes: A precise formula for the saturation error is obtained, and it is shown that adjusting the shape parameter can control the saturation error to be negligible.

the problem of generalized d-stability i.title: The problem of generalized D-stability in unbounded LMI regions
the problem of generalized d-stability i.summary: This paper generalizes the concepts of D-stability and additive D-stability of matrices by considering a family of unbounded regions defined in terms of Linear Matrix Inequalities (LMI regions). The authors study the problem when the localization of a matrix spectrum in an unbounded LMI region is preserved under specific multiplicative and additive perturbations of the initial matrix. They provide new D-stability criteria using additive compound matrices and generalize the theory of stability with respect to LMI regions.
the problem of generalized d-stability i.methodology: The authors use a combination of theoretical necessary and sufficient conditions, as well as numerical linear algebra methods, to simplify the characterization of n × n matrices with n = 2, 3, 4, 5, .. and more. They also introduce a new point of view on D-stability within the context of LMI regions.
the problem of generalized d-stability i.research_outcomes: The authors provide necessary and sufficient conditions for generalized D-stability using additive compound matrices. They also generalize the theory of stability with respect to LMI regions, introducing a new approach that simplifies the characterization of n × n matrices.

optimal transport, convection, magnetic.title: Optimal Transport, Convection, Magnetic Relaxation and Generalized Boussinesq equations
optimal transport, convection, magnetic.summary: This paper establishes a connection between Optimal Transport Theory and classical Convection Theory for geophysical flows, using the Angenent-Haker-Tannenbaum model to relate different variants of the Navier-Stokes-Boussinesq equations to various models involving Optimal Transport.
optimal transport, convection, magnetic.methodology: The paper uses a unified framework to relate different variants of the NSB equations to various models involving Optimal Transport, using the AHT model as a generalization of the Darcy-Boussinesq equations.
optimal transport, convection, magnetic.research_outcomes: The paper establishes a connection between Optimal Transport Theory and classical Convection Theory for geophysical flows, providing a unified framework to relate different variants of the NSB equations to various models involving Optimal Transport.

formal degree of regular supercuspidals.title: Formal Degree of Regular Supercuspidals
formal degree of regular supercuspidals.summary: This paper focuses on the formal degree of supercuspidal representations, a numerical invariant that generalizes the dimension of unitary supercuspidals. The authors compute the formal degrees of Yu's supercuspidal representations and verify Kaletha's regular supercuspidal L-packets satisfy the conjecture.
formal degree of regular supercuspidals.methodology: The paper uses Bruhat-Tits theory, compact induction, and the Moy-Prasad filtration to compute the formal degree of a broad class of supercuspidal representations.
formal degree of regular supercuspidals.research_outcomes: The authors' main results are Theorem A, which computes the formal degrees of Yu's supercuspidal representations, and the verification that Kaletha's regular supercuspidal L-packets satisfy the conjecture.

finite-time stability criteria for a cla.title: Finite-Time Stability Criteria for a Class of High-Order Fractional Cohen–Grossberg Neural Networks with Delay
finite-time stability criteria for a cla.summary: This paper focuses on the finite-time stability of a class of delayed fractional Cohen-Grossberg neural networks with high-order fractional derivatives. The authors develop two criteria for guaranteeing finite-time stability based on analytical techniques, which are different from earlier works.
finite-time stability criteria for a cla.methodology: Analytical techniques using Caputo derivative and inequalities
finite-time stability criteria for a cla.research_outcomes: Two finite-time stability criteria are established for the network, ensuring that the system achieves finite-time stability with respect to given bounds.

generalized fisher-darmois-koopman-pitma.title: Generalized Fisher-Darmois-Koopman-Pitman Theorem and Rao-Blackwell Type Estimators for Power-Law Distributions
generalized fisher-darmois-koopman-pitma.summary: This paper generalizes the notion of sufficiency for estimation problems beyond maximum likelihood, focusing on power-law distributions and their sufficient statistics. The authors explore the relationship between sufficiency and robust inference methods, including Jones et al. likelihood function.
generalized fisher-darmois-koopman-pitma.methodology: The authors use mathematical derivations to establish a Rao-Blackwell type theorem for finding best estimators for power-law families, building on previous work by Fisher, Koopman, and Pitman.
generalized fisher-darmois-koopman-pitma.research_outcomes: The paper characterizes the family of probability distributions that has a fixed number of sufficient statistics independent of the sample size with respect to Jones et al. likelihood function, identifying power-law families as the relevant case.

application of the symbolic regression m.title: Application of the symbolic regression method for solving the inverse problem of control of the 3-RPR platform
application of the symbolic regression m.summary: This paper focuses on finding a functional dependence between the position of a 3-RPR platform and its control. The authors use symbolic regression, specifically the network operator method, to solve the inverse problem. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this research.
application of the symbolic regression m.methodology: The methodology involves using an evolutionary algorithm (particle swarm optimization) to find a set of solutions for the control parameters, followed by symbolic regression to obtain analytic dependencies.
application of the symbolic regression m.research_outcomes: The authors were able to derive six functional equations describing the relationship between the platform angles and the control lengths. They also introduced an additional parameter to account for multiple positions of the platform for the same control value.

tail behavior of dependent v-statistics.title: Tail behavior of dependent V-statistics and its applications
tail behavior of dependent v-statistics.summary: This paper establishes exponential inequalities and Cramer-type moderate deviation theorems for a class of V-statistics under strong mixing conditions. The theory is developed via kernel expansion based on random Fourier features, which is new and useful for handling many notorious classes of kernels.
tail behavior of dependent v-statistics.methodology: Kernel expansion based on random Fourier features
tail behavior of dependent v-statistics.statistics: Bernstein-type inequalities, Cramér-type moderate deviation results
tail behavior of dependent v-statistics.research_outcomes: Exponential inequalities and Cramer-type moderate deviation theorems for V-statistics under strong mixing conditions.

formation of inter-frame deformation fie.title: Formation of Inter-Frame Deformation Field of Images Using Reverse Stochastic Gradient Estimation
formation of inter-frame deformation fie.summary: This paper investigates the effectiveness of stochastic gradient estimation for detecting motion in image sequences. It proposes two approaches to estimate inter-frame deformation fields using reverse stochastic gradient descent, and compares their efficiency with other methods.
formation of inter-frame deformation fie.methodology: The authors use a combination of stochastic gradient descent and correlation maximum as criteria for estimating the shift vectors' field H.
formation of inter-frame deformation fie.research_outcomes: The results show that using CC maximum as the criterion can significantly improve the accuracy of joint processing of estimates, but increases computational complexity.

pi/pid controller stabilizing sets of un.title: PI/PID controller stabilizing sets of uncertain nonlinear systems: an efficient surrogate model-based approach
pi/pid controller stabilizing sets of un.summary: This paper proposes a novel numerical strategy to efficiently compute the PID stabilizing set of uncertain nonlinear systems. The method uses an adaptive surrogate model-based approach, specifically the Monte Carlo intersite Voronoi (MiVor) scheme, which classifies the PID controller space into stable/unstable regions using the largest Lyapunov exponent (LLE). This approach is applied to the blood glucose regulation problem in type 1 diabetes patients and demonstrates robust performance.
pi/pid controller stabilizing sets of un.methodology: The proposed numerical strategy relies on an adaptive surrogate model technique, specifically the MiVor scheme, which uses machine learning techniques such as ordinary kriging to speed up the computation of the LLE in nonlinear systems.
pi/pid controller stabilizing sets of un.research_outcomes: The paper presents a novel approach for computing the PID stabilizing set of uncertain nonlinear systems. The method is applied to the blood glucose regulation problem and demonstrates robust performance.

consistent estimation of identifiable no.title: Consistent Estimation of Identifiable Nonparametric Mixture Models from Grouped Observations
consistent estimation of identifiable no.summary: This paper proposes an algorithm for consistently estimating identifiable nonparametric mixture models from grouped observations. The method leverages an oracle inequality for weighted kernel density estimators and provides statistical guarantees. It is shown to outperform existing methods, especially when mixture components overlap significantly.
consistent estimation of identifiable no.methodology: The proposed algorithm uses a two-step process: first, it selects a mixture component using the weighted kernel density estimator; then, it draws a group of observations from that distribution. The method is shown to be consistent and provides statistical guarantees.
consistent estimation of identifiable no.statistics: oracle inequality for weighted kernel density estimators
consistent estimation of identifiable no.research_outcomes: The proposed algorithm consistently estimates identifiable nonparametric mixture models from grouped observations. It outperforms existing methods, especially when mixture components overlap significantly.

3d tensor based nonlocal low rank approx.title: 3D Tensor Based Nonlocal Low Rank Approximation in Dynamic PET Reconstruction
3d tensor based nonlocal low rank approx.summary: This paper presents a novel tensor-based nonlocal low-rank framework for dynamic positron emission tomography (PET) reconstruction. The method efficiently combines temporal and spatial information to enhance image quality, making it a substantial contribution in the field of PET imaging.
3d tensor based nonlocal low rank approx.methodology: The proposed framework uses tensor decomposition to jointly recover, denoise, and complete structures in dynamic PET imaging. It effectively combines nonlocal and sparse features with low-rank approximations in the temporal realm.
3d tensor based nonlocal low rank approx.research_outcomes: The experiments demonstrate excellent performance of the proposed method in dynamic PET reconstruction, validating its potential for improving image quality.

on a parabolic-hyperbolic filter for mul.title: On a Parabolic-Hyperbolic Filter for Multicolor Image Noise Reduction
on a parabolic-hyperbolic filter for mul.summary: This paper proposes a novel PDE-based anisotropic filter for noise reduction in multicolor images, generalizing Nitzberg&Shiota's model. The authors derive a well-posedness theory and study the long-time behavior of their new image filter.
on a parabolic-hyperbolic filter for mul.methodology: The authors use partial differential equations (PDEs) to develop an anisotropic filter for multicolor images, incorporating maximal L^2-regularity theory and Schauder's fixed point theorem.
on a parabolic-hyperbolic filter for mul.research_outcomes: The paper presents a well-posedness theory for the multicolor version of Equation (4), with solutions being more regular under weaker data regularity assumptions. The authors also study the long-time behavior of their model and prove exponential stability under a uniform positive definiteness condition.

iteratively linearized reweighted altern.title: Iteratively Linearized Reweighted Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers for a Class of Nonconvex Problems
iteratively linearized reweighted altern.summary: This paper proposes the iteratively linearized reweighted alternating direction method of multipliers (ILR-ADMM) for solving a class of nonconvex and nonsmooth problems. The ILR-ADMM combines the iteratively reweighted strategy with the linearized ADMM, resulting in convex subproblems that can be solved efficiently. The paper provides convergence results using the Kurdyka-Lojasiewicz property and demonstrates the efficiency of the proposed algorithm through numerical examples.
iteratively linearized reweighted altern.methodology: The ILR-ADMM is an iterative method that linearizes the outside function g and keeps h, resulting in convex subproblems. The proximal maps are used to solve the subproblems efficiently.
iteratively linearized reweighted altern.research_outcomes: The paper provides convergence results for the ILR-ADMM using the Kurdyka-Lojasiewicz property and demonstrates its efficiency through numerical examples.

linear asymptotic convergence of anderso.title: Linear Asymptotic Convergence of Anderson Acceleration: Fixed-Point Analysis
linear asymptotic convergence of anderso.summary: This paper studies the asymptotic convergence of Anderson acceleration (AA) for fixed-point methods, analyzing its properties and behavior. The authors investigate how AA affects the convergence speed of iterations and provide theoretical findings on its impact.
linear asymptotic convergence of anderso.methodology: The authors use a combination of mathematical analysis and numerical experiments to study the asymptotic convergence of AA. They derive theoretical results on the convergence properties of AA and compare them with numerical simulations.
linear asymptotic convergence of anderso.research_outcomes: The paper provides insights into the behavior of Anderson acceleration for fixed-point methods, showing that it can lead to improved convergence speeds in certain cases. However, the authors also identify limitations and potential issues with the method.

existence results to a nonlinear p(k)-la.title: Existence results to a nonlinear p(k)-Laplacian difference equation
existence results to a nonlinear p(k)-la.summary: This paper investigates the existence of non-trivial solutions to an anisotropic discrete nonlinear problem involving p(k)-Laplacian operator with Dirichlet boundary condition. The main technical tools applied here are the two local minimum theorems for differentiable functionals given by Bonanno.
existence results to a nonlinear p(k)-la.research_outcomes: The paper obtains the exact intervals for the parameter λ, in which the problem (1.1) admits non-trivial solutions.

identification of linear systems with mu.title: Identification of Linear Systems with Multiplicative Noise from Multiple Trajectory Data
identification of linear systems with mu.summary: This paper studies the identification of linear systems with multiplicative noise using multiple-trajectory data. The authors propose an algorithm based on the least-squares method and demonstrate its consistency under certain conditions.
identification of linear systems with mu.methodology: The proposed algorithm uses a combination of least-squares estimation and multiple-trajectory data to identify the system parameters and noise covariance matrix.
identification of linear systems with mu.research_outcomes: The authors provide high-probability bounds for the performance of the algorithm and demonstrate its consistency under certain conditions.

the basins of attraction of the global m.title: The basins of attraction of the global minimizers of the non-convex sparse spikes estimation problem
the basins of attraction of the global m.summary: This paper studies the shape of the basin of attraction of the global minimum of a non-convex functional in the context of sparse spikes estimation. The authors provide a bound on the conditioning of the Hessian at a global minimum and an explicit shape of the basin of attraction, showing that it increases with better RIP constants.
the basins of attraction of the global m.methodology: The paper uses mathematical techniques to analyze the behavior of non-convex minimization in the parameter space. The authors use gradient descent algorithms and provide conditions for convergence.
the basins of attraction of the global m.research_outcomes: The study provides a better understanding of the basin of attraction of global minima, which has implications for the theoretical study of greedy approaches. It also shows that enforcing separation constraints can improve descent algorithms.

srunet: stacked reversed u-shape network.title: SRUNet: Stacked Reversed U-shape Network for Lightweight Single Image Super-Resolution
srunet: stacked reversed u-shape network.summary: This paper proposes a stacked reversed U-shape network (SRUNet) to fully utilize multi-scale features in single image super-resolution. SRUNet consists of shallow feature extraction, stacked reversed U-shape module, multi-scale backward fusion module, and feature refinement module. The model achieves competitive performance compared to state-of-the-art methods and is the first attempt to employ iterative up-and-down sampling architecture in lightweight SISR models.
srunet: stacked reversed u-shape network.methodology: The proposed SRUNet consists of four parts: shallow feature extraction, stacked reversed U-shape module, multi-scale backward fusion module, and feature refinement module. The model uses a scale-wise dense connection and residual channel-wise attention to fuse features.
srunet: stacked reversed u-shape network.statistics: Extensive experimental results demonstrate the model's competitive performance compared to state-of-the-art methods.
srunet: stacked reversed u-shape network.research_outcomes: The proposed SRUNet achieves competitive performance compared to state-of-the-art methods, especially when scaling factor is 4. It takes 29.2ms for SRUNet to process per image in Urban100 dataset.

sympkf: a symbolic and computational too.title: SymPKF: a symbolic and computational toolbox for the design of parametric Kalman filter dynamics
sympkf: a symbolic and computational too.summary: This paper introduces SymPKF, a symbolic and computational toolbox for designing parametric Kalman filter dynamics. The tool uses the Sympy library to perform symbolic computations and generate code for numerical simulations. While machine learning is not directly used in this research, it has potential applications in data assimilation and parameter estimation.
sympkf: a symbolic and computational too.methodology: The methodology involves using a computer algebra system (CAS) to perform symbolic computations and generate code for numerical simulations.
sympkf: a symbolic and computational too.research_outcomes: SymPKF is able to compute PKF dynamics for univariate statistics and parameterized covariance models. It also includes an automatic code generator for numerical simulations.

a linear programming-based approach to e.title: A linear programming-based approach to estimate discrete probability functions with given quantiles
a linear programming-based approach to e.summary: This paper presents a novel method for estimating discrete probability functions using linear programming, focusing on the maximum entropy approach with given quantiles. The proposed method is an efficient solution to the nonlinear optimization problem, outperforming generic methods in solving nonlinear programming problems.
a linear programming-based approach to e.methodology: The methodology involves converting the nonlinear optimization problem into a system of nonlinear equations using Lagrange multipliers and then applying linear programming techniques to solve it.
a linear programming-based approach to e.research_outcomes: The proposed method is shown to be faster than generic methods for solving nonlinear programming problems, with computational experiments demonstrating its performance and validation.

a solution technique for l'evy driven lo.title: A Solution Technique for L'evy Driven Long Term Average Impulse Control Problems
a solution technique for l'evy driven lo.summary: This paper presents a step-by-step solution technique for long term average impulse control problems with L'evy processes. The authors characterize the value of the control problem as the value of a stopping problem and construct an optimal strategy from the optimizer of said stopping strategy.
a solution technique for l'evy driven lo.methodology: The paper uses martingale techniques, maximum representation of the payoff function, and ladder height processes to develop a solution technique for long term average impulse control problems.
a solution technique for l'evy driven lo.research_outcomes: The authors provide a sufficient criterion to verify existence of an optimal (s, S) strategy and in many cases lead to a semiexplicit or explicit characterization of the boundaries.

derivative-free optimization algorithms.title: Derivative-Free Optimization Algorithms based on Non-Commutative Maps
derivative-free optimization algorithms.summary: This paper proposes a novel class of derivative-free optimization algorithms that utilize non-commutative maps to approximate the gradient of the objective function. The algorithms are inspired by continuous-time Lie bracket based methods, but with a tailored integration scheme for discrete-time optimization.
derivative-free optimization algorithms.methodology: The proposed algorithms use deterministic non-commutative maps to evaluate the objective function at certain points, approximating a gradient descent step. The methodology involves constructing composite maps of the form (10) and using Euler- or Heun-integration methods for numerical integration.
derivative-free optimization algorithms.research_outcomes: The paper establishes convergence properties of the novel algorithms and presents simulation examples to demonstrate their effectiveness.

deep batch active learning by diverse, u.title: Deep Batch Active Learning by Diverse, Uncertain Gradient Lower Bounds
deep batch active learning by diverse, u.summary: This paper presents a new algorithm for batch active learning with deep neural network models. BADGE (Batch Active Learning by Diverse Gradient Embeddings) samples groups of points that are disparate and high-magnitude when represented in a hallucinated gradient space, trading off between diversity and uncertainty without requiring any hand-tuned hyperparameters.
deep batch active learning by diverse, u.methodology: The algorithm uses gradient embeddings to capture uncertainty about an example through the lens of gradients. It then selects a set of points by sampling via the k-MEANS++ initialization scheme, which tends to produce diverse batches similar to a k-Determinantal Point Process.
deep batch active learning by diverse, u.statistics: Proposition 1 shows that the norm of the gradient embedding is a lower bound on the norm of the loss gradient induced by the example with true label y with respect to the weights in the last layer.
deep batch active learning by diverse, u.research_outcomes: The paper shows that BADGE consistently performs as well or better than other approaches, making it a versatile option for practical active learning problems. It also demonstrates that switching between k-MEANS++ and k-DPP based sampling does not affect the active learner's statistical performance but greatly improves its computational performance.

aim 2020 challenge on video extreme supe.title: AIM 2020 Challenge on Video Extreme Super-Resolution: Methods and Results
aim 2020 challenge on video extreme supe.summary: This paper reviews the video extreme super-resolution challenge associated with the AIM 2020 workshop at ECCV 2020. The challenge focuses on upscaling videos with an extreme factor of 16, which results in more serious degradations that also affect the structural integrity of the videos. The paper discusses various methods for addressing this challenging task, including deep learning-based approaches and recurrent neural networks.
aim 2020 challenge on video extreme supe.methodology: The challenge uses a dataset with paired high-quality DSLR camera (Canon 5D Mark IV) HR ground truth and LR source data obtained by downscaling the ground truth by factor 16. The methods discussed in the paper include deep learning-based approaches, recurrent neural networks, and other techniques for addressing the VSR problem.
aim 2020 challenge on video extreme supe.research_outcomes: The challenge aims to super resolve the given input videos with an extremely large zooming factor of 16. The results show that various methods can achieve high-quality restoration, but there is still room for improvement in terms of fidelity and perceptual quality.

non-parametric variational inference wit.title: Non-Parametric Variational Inference with Graph Convolutional Networks for Gaussian Processes
non-parametric variational inference wit.summary: This paper proposes a novel approach to variational inference for Gaussian processes, leveraging graph convolutional networks to efficiently approximate the posterior distribution. The method significantly speeds up inference and often achieves more accurate results than previous methods.
non-parametric variational inference wit.methodology: The authors construct a variational distribution with which the inference for a data point takes information only from its K surrounding neighbors, making the ELBO highly decomposible. They then train Graph Convolutional Networks as a reusable model to identify variational parameters for each data point.
non-parametric variational inference wit.research_outcomes: The proposed method achieves better inference performance while using much less computation time compared to state-of-the-art methods.

the microsoft 2017 conversational speech.title: The Microsoft 2017 Conversational Speech Recognition System
the microsoft 2017 conversational speech.summary: This paper presents an updated version of the Microsoft conversational speech recognition system, which achieves a word error rate of 5.1% on the Switchboard evaluation set. The system combines recent developments in neural-network-based acoustic and language modeling to advance the state-of-the-art. Machine learning plays a central role in the methodology, with the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs), bidirectional long short-term memory (BLSTM) models, and sequence training.
the microsoft 2017 conversational speech.methodology: The system combines multiple acoustic models using a two-stage approach, followed by a word-level voting via confusion networks. The resulting system yields a 5.1% word error rate on the 2000 Switchboard evaluation set.
the microsoft 2017 conversational speech.statistics: Maximum mutual information (MMI) as the discriminative objective function
the microsoft 2017 conversational speech.research_outcomes: The paper presents an updated version of the Microsoft conversational speech recognition system, which achieves a word error rate of 5.1% on the Switchboard evaluation set.

steady-state planning in expected reward.title: Steady-State Planning in Expected Reward Multichain MDPs
steady-state planning in expected reward.summary: This paper explores the steady-state planning problem, which involves deriving decision-making policies for agents that satisfy constraints on their steady-state behavior. The authors propose a linear programming solution for multichain Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) and prove that optimal solutions yield stationary policies with rigorous guarantees of behavior.
steady-state planning in expected reward.methodology: The authors use linear programming to derive decision-making policies for agents in multichain MDPs, focusing on steady-state planning. They propose a novel approach that generalizes previous work by not imposing restrictions on the underlying MDP.
steady-state planning in expected reward.research_outcomes: The paper establishes a one-to-one correspondence between stationary policies and feasible solutions to linear programs for expected average reward criterion in multichain MDPs, providing provable performance and behavior guarantees for derived policies.

recursive-nerf: an efficient and dynamic.title: Recursive-NeRF: An Efficient and Dynamically Growing NeRF
recursive-nerf: an efficient and dynamic.summary: This paper presents Recursive-NeRF, a novel method for efficient and adaptive rendering of scenes using Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF). By recursively growing neural networks based on the complexity of the scene, Recursive-NeRF achieves significant gains in speed while providing high-quality view synthesis. The approach is complementary to existing methods such as NSVF and can be combined for further speed improvements.
recursive-nerf: an efficient and dynamic.methodology: Recursive-NeRF uses a recursive scene rendering method where early termination prevents further processing once output quality is good enough, achieving state-of-the-art novel view synthesis results with much reduced computation. A novel multi-stage dynamic growth method divides uncertain queries in the shallow part of the network and continues to refine them in differently grown deep networks.
recursive-nerf: an efficient and dynamic.statistics: The paper uses statistical methods for rendering and training neural networks, including hierarchical volume sampling and importance sampling.
recursive-nerf: an efficient and dynamic.research_outcomes: Recursive-NeRF achieves significant gains in speed while providing high-quality view synthesis. The approach is complementary to existing methods such as NSVF and can be combined for further speed improvements.

fast ip hopping protocol sdi implementat.title: Fast IP Hopping Protocol SDI Implementation
fast ip hopping protocol sdi implementat.summary: This paper proposes a new approach to protect against Distributed Denial of Service attacks and traffic eavesdropping in TCP/IP networks. The method, called IP Fast Hopping, introduces a dynamic mapping of server's address on a large set of temporary addresses, hiding the physical location of protected servers from unauthorized clients.
fast ip hopping protocol sdi implementat.methodology: The paper proposes an alternative approach to DDoS attacks resistance via randomization of network address by introducing a specific addressing policy. The method is based on a mathematical model of network traffic traversing with decomposition mapping of instantaneous traffic intensity.
fast ip hopping protocol sdi implementat.research_outcomes: The proposed method provides a way to attenuate or completely block malicious traffic in the network without analyzing and processing network traffic.

from data acquisition to data fusion: a.title: From Data Acquisition to Data Fusion: A Comprehensive Review and a Roadmap for the Identification of Activities of Daily Living Using Mobile Devices
from data acquisition to data fusion: a.summary: This paper presents a comprehensive review of sensor data fusion techniques for identifying activities of daily living (ADLs) using mobile devices. The authors focus on the state-of-the-art in sensor fusion, highlighting its importance in improving algorithm reliability and addressing mobile device constraints.
from data acquisition to data fusion: a.methodology: The paper proposes a new classification of sensors embedded in off-the-shelf mobile devices, identifying different techniques related to data acquisition, processing, and imputation. It also reviews data fusion techniques for off-the-shelf mobile devices and presents examples of sensor data fusion applications.
from data acquisition to data fusion: a.research_outcomes: The authors present a comprehensive review of sensor data fusion techniques, highlighting their importance in identifying ADLs using mobile devices. They propose a new classification of sensors and review data fusion techniques for off-the-shelf mobile devices.

joint bayesian gaussian discriminant ana.title: Joint Bayesian Gaussian Discriminant Analysis for Speaker Verification
joint bayesian gaussian discriminant ana.summary: This paper presents a novel approach to speaker verification using Joint Bayesian (JB) Gaussian discriminant analysis. The authors apply JB, originally proposed for face verification, to the speaker verification task and make three contributions: employing exact statistics in EM iterations, simultaneous diagonalization of within-class and between-class covariance matrices, and comparing similarities and differences with various Gaussian PLDAs.
joint bayesian gaussian discriminant ana.methodology: The authors use a probabilistic generative model, Joint Bayesian (JB) Gaussian discriminant analysis, to address the challenges in speaker verification. They employ EM iterations with exact statistics and simultaneous diagonalization of covariance matrices to improve performance.
joint bayesian gaussian discriminant ana.research_outcomes: The paper presents three main contributions: employing exact statistics in EM iterations, simultaneous diagonalization of within-class and between-class covariance matrices, and comparing similarities and differences with various Gaussian PLDAs. The authors also conduct extensive experiments on NIST SRE10 core condition 5, empirically validating the superiority of JB.

learning agent-aware affordances for clo.title: Learning Agent-Aware Affordances for Closed-Loop Interaction with Articulated Objects
learning agent-aware affordances for clo.summary: This paper proposes a novel closed-loop control pipeline that integrates manipulation priors from affordance estimation with sampling-based whole-body control. The pipeline is agent-aware, meaning it takes into account the robot's capabilities and embodiment, and outperforms state-of-the-art counterparts in tasks such as opening and closing an oven door.
learning agent-aware affordances for clo.methodology: The proposed pipeline combines affordance estimation with sampling-based whole-body control. Affordance estimation is performed using a neural network that predicts point-wise interaction scores, which are then used to select a favorable end-effector interaction pose. The sampling-based controller generates joint velocity commands based on the selected interaction pose.
learning agent-aware affordances for clo.statistics: The paper uses statistical methods for affordance estimation and control policy optimization.
learning agent-aware affordances for clo.research_outcomes: The proposed pipeline outperforms state-of-the-art counterparts in tasks such as opening and closing an oven door, with success rates of over 70%.

explore semantic pixel sets based local.title: Explore Semantic Pixel Sets Based Local Pattern with Entropy Information for Face Recognition and Application in Back Propagation
explore semantic pixel sets based local.summary: This paper presents a novel approach to face recognition using semantic pixel sets based local patterns with entropy information. The method combines the Local Binary Pattern (LBP) operator with a semantic pixel set of entropy information, which is used as input for classification using back propagation networks. The results show a high recognition rate of 98%.
explore semantic pixel sets based local.methodology: The methodology involves dividing the sample data into NxM zones and calculating the feature value of each zone. The LBP method is used to extract features from each image, followed by the semantic pixel set method to extract entropy information.
explore semantic pixel sets based local.research_outcomes: The paper presents a high recognition rate of 98% using the proposed approach.

psychological bidirectional influences o.title: Psychological Bidirectional Influences of Information Sampling and Concept Learning
psychological bidirectional influences o.summary: This paper investigates how humans actively sample information from sources expected to provide behaviorally relevant information, developing a computational model called Sampling Emergent Attention (SEA) that reflects this effect. The model consists of two interacting components and predicts classic behavioral effects associated with selective attention.
psychological bidirectional influences o.methodology: The authors develop a computational model, SEA, designed to reflect the effect of humans actively sampling information from sources expected to provide behaviorally relevant information.
psychological bidirectional influences o.research_outcomes: The model predicts classic behavioral effects associated with selective attention and closely resembles patterns of human eye movements.

burn image segmentation based on mask re.title: Burn image segmentation based on Mask Regions with Convolutional Neural Network deep learning framework: more accurate and more convenient
burn image segmentation based on mask re.summary: This paper proposes a novel method for burn image segmentation using the Mask R-CNN deep learning framework, achieving more accurate and convenient results compared to traditional methods. The authors employed state-of-the-art techniques, including Atrous Convolution in Feature Pyramid Network (FPN), to segment burn wounds in images.
burn image segmentation based on mask re.methodology: The proposed method employs a deep learning framework based on Mask R-CNN, with modifications to adapt to the dataset and improve training speed. The authors used Atrous Convolution in FPN as the backbone network.
burn image segmentation based on mask re.research_outcomes: The R101FA backbone network achieved the highest accuracy of 84.51% in 150 pictures, with the best segmentation effect in superficial, superficial thickness, and deep partial thickness burn wounds.

phase distribution in probabilistic move.title: Phase Distribution in Probabilistic Movement Primitives
phase distribution in probabilistic move.summary: This paper investigates a method to temporally align observations for learning ProMPs, maximizing spatial structure information while maintaining smooth phase velocity. The proposed system recognizes and reproduces human movements using probabilistic movement primitives.
phase distribution in probabilistic move.methodology: The authors propose a two-step procedure for estimating phase profile parameters that minimize variability on w. They use empirical estimators to obtain distributions for w and φ(t).
phase distribution in probabilistic move.research_outcomes: The proposed method is demonstrated to be effective in recognizing and reproducing human movements.

design principles for data analysis.title: Design Principles for Data Analysis
design principles for data analysis.summary: This paper introduces design principles for data analysis, which are complementary to statistical thinking. The authors propose six principles: data matching, exhaustive, reproducibility, transparency, interpretability, and explainability. They argue that these principles can help induce variation in data analyses and provide a framework for teaching students how to build data analyses using formal design principles.
design principles for data analysis.methodology: The authors use a combination of statistical thinking and design thinking to introduce the design principles for data analysis. They describe an example in the classroom for how the design principles can be mapped to data analyses in a quantitative, objective, and informative manner.
design principles for data analysis.research_outcomes: The paper introduces six design principles for data analysis: data matching, exhaustive, reproducibility, transparency, interpretability, and explainability. The authors provide empirical evidence of variation in principles within and between both producers and consumers of data analyses.

urdufake@fire2020: shared track on fake.title: UrduFake@FIRE2020: Shared Track on Fake News Identification in Urdu
urdufake@fire2020: shared track on fake.summary: This paper presents the first shared task at FIRE 2020 on fake news detection in the Urdu language. The study uses machine learning methods, including BERT-based approaches, to identify fake news and achieves an F-score value of 0.90.
urdufake@fire2020: shared track on fake.methodology: The paper employs a binary classification task using various machine learning methods, including feature-based traditional machine learning and neural network techniques.
urdufake@fire2020: shared track on fake.statistics: F1-macro score is used as the evaluation metric to accommodate class imbalance
urdufake@fire2020: shared track on fake.research_outcomes: The best performing system achieved an F-score value of 0.90, showing that the BERT-based approach outperforms other machine learning classifiers.

system identification with student\u2019.title: System Identification with Student’s t-Process Dynamical Model
system identification with student\u2019.summary: This paper proposes a Student's t-process dynamical model (TPDM) for state space modeling, which is an extension of the TPLVM. The TPDM is applied to the problem of satellite orbit estimation, where it successfully estimates the true position of the satellite from observed information.
system identification with student\u2019.methodology: The paper uses a particle filter-based approach for online Bayesian estimation, which treats the parameter vector as a dynamical variable.
system identification with student\u2019.research_outcomes: The TPDM is shown to be effective in estimating satellite orbits from observed information.

a high-quality multilingual dataset for.title: A High-Quality Multilingual Dataset for Structured Documentation Translation
a high-quality multilingual dataset for.summary: This paper presents a high-quality multilingual dataset for structured documentation translation, which advances research on localization of structured text. The dataset is built from the online documentation of an enterprise software platform and includes XML-structured parallel text segments in 16 languages. Machine learning-based translation models are used to improve translation accuracy, and the beam search accurately generates XML structures.
a high-quality multilingual dataset for.methodology: The dataset is built by collecting parallel text segments from the online documentation of an enterprise software platform, using a pairwise sequence alignment algorithm for each bilingually-aligned file. The XML elements are well formed and translators keep the same tagging structure as much as their languages allow it.
a high-quality multilingual dataset for.research_outcomes: The experiments show that learning to translate with the XML tags improves translation accuracy, and the beam search accurately generates XML structures. The dataset can also serve as a corpus for domain adaptation research.
sources_of_inspiration: Michel and Neubig, 2018; Bawden et al., 2018; Müller et al., 2018

part attentioned fine-grained categoriza.title: Part Attentioned Fine-Grained Categorization Using Context Sensitive Flow
part attentioned fine-grained categoriza.summary: This paper proposes a novel multiple scales attention fusing convolutional neural network for fine-grained image recognition. The proposed method, FFCSnet, consists of two main components: a new part feature fused attention net and a context sensitive loss.
