It achieves state-of-the-art performance on two challenging fine-grained image recognition datasets, CUB Birds and Stanford Cars.
part attentioned fine-grained categoriza.methodology: The proposed method uses a self-attention study network (SASN) to compute region attention and a context-sensitive module to take advantage of deeper and wider network features. The whole scale feature maps are added element-wise to the part feature maps, mixing low-level features with high-level features.
part attentioned fine-grained categoriza.research_outcomes: The proposed method achieves state-of-the-art performance on two challenging fine-grained image recognition datasets, CUB Birds and Stanford Cars.

cu-ud: text-mining drug and chemical-pro.title: CU-UD: text-mining drug and chemical-protein interactions with ensembles of BERT-based models
cu-ud: text-mining drug and chemical-pro.summary: This paper presents an ensemble system for text-mining drug and chemical-protein interactions using BERT-based models. The system combines the outputs of individual models using majority voting and multilayer perceptron, achieving state-of-the-art performance on the DrugProt task in BioCreative VII.
cu-ud: text-mining drug and chemical-pro.methodology: The paper uses an ensemble approach combining multiple BERT-based language representation models to achieve better predictive performance. The system considers two entity tagging schemes and employs a class-weighted loss function, majority voting, and meta-learning method to mitigate the unbalance in the training dataset.
cu-ud: text-mining drug and chemical-pro.research_outcomes: The paper presents state-of-the-art performance on the DrugProt task in BioCreative VII, with an F1 score of 0.8902 for the ANTAGONIST relation and 0.8570 for the INHIBITOR relation.

fast evaluation of real and complex poly.title: Fast Evaluation of Real and Complex Polynomials
fast evaluation of real and complex poly.summary: This paper proposes a novel algorithm for quickly evaluating polynomials, with a focus on improving the speed without compromising precision. The algorithm is designed for repeated single-point evaluations and can also be used as an embarrassingly parallel multipoint evaluator.
fast evaluation of real and complex poly.methodology: The proposed algorithm uses a divide and conquer recursion to evaluate polynomials at multiple points simultaneously, with a cost of O((d + k) log d log kd).
fast evaluation of real and complex poly.research_outcomes: The paper presents a detailed analysis of the complexity and accuracy of the proposed algorithm, showing that it outperforms existing methods in many cases.

statistically profiling biases in natura.title: Statistically Profiling Biases in Natural Language Reasoning Datasets and Models
statistically profiling biases in natura.summary: This paper proposes a light-weight statistical profiling framework, ICQ (I-See-Cue), to identify biases in natural language reasoning datasets and models. The framework automatically identifies possible biases in multiple-choice NLU datasets without the need for additional test cases, and evaluates through blackbox testing the extent to which models may exploit these biases.
statistically profiling biases in natura.methodology: The ICQ framework consists of three phases: data filtering, cue discovery, and model probing. In the data filtering phase, it extracts from the dataset those problem instances that contain a given linguistic feature. In the cue discovery phase, it identifies the possible cues in this dataset. Finally, in the model probing phase, it does two tests: 'accuracy test' and 'distribution test'.
statistically profiling biases in natura.statistics: mean squared error (MSE) and Jensen-Shannon Divergence
statistically profiling biases in natura.research_outcomes: The paper makes several contributions, including providing a light-weight but effective method to uncover statistical biases and cues in NL reasoning datasets, proposing two simple tests to quantitatively and visually assess whether a given model has taken advantage of a spurious cue when making predictions, and evaluating the statistical bias issues comprehensively on 10 popular NLR datasets and 4 models.

proximal distilled evolutionary reinforc.title: Proximal Distilled Evolutionary Reinforcement Learning
proximal distilled evolutionary reinforc.summary: This paper proposes a novel algorithm called Proximal Distilled Evolutionary Reinforcement Learning (PDERL) that integrates evolution and learning to enhance each other. PDERL uses learning-based variation operators that compensate for the simplicity of genetic representation, addressing the scalability problem of Genetic Algorithms (GAs).
proximal distilled evolutionary reinforc.methodology: The proposed method combines Evolutionary Reinforcement Learning (ERL) with learning-based genetic operators to improve the performance and scalability of GAs.
proximal distilled evolutionary reinforc.research_outcomes: PDERL outperforms ERL, PPO, and TD3 in all five robot locomotion environments from the OpenAI gym.
sources_of_inspiration: Evolutionary Reinforcement Learning (ERL) framework by Khadka and Tumer (2018)
DDPG algorithm by Lillicrap et al. (2015)

real-time social network-based knowledge.title: Real-Time Social Network-Based Knowledge Discovery System for Decision Making
real-time social network-based knowledge.summary: This paper presents a real-time social network-based knowledge discovery system that uses natural language processing and text mining techniques to automatically interpret user opinions about venues. The system is designed for decision-making, allowing users to quickly identify positive, negative, or neutral thoughts about foods, beverages, and venues.
real-time social network-based knowledge.methodology: The system uses a natural language processing pipeline to organize and correct user recommendations, followed by text mining techniques to classify opinions as positive, negative, or neutral. The organized data are then classified according to feelings and thoughts, and the system identifies whether a venue near the user's location was liked.
real-time social network-based knowledge.statistics: Classification accuracy of 84.49% for Turkish and 95% for English
real-time social network-based knowledge.research_outcomes: The developed system achieves high classification accuracy and can be used as a baseline for sentiment analysis in social networks.

automated maxillofacial segmentation in.title: Automated Maxillofacial Segmentation in Panoramic Dental X-Ray Images Using an Efficient Encoder-Decoder Network
automated maxillofacial segmentation in.summary: This paper proposes a deep learning-based approach for automated maxillofacial segmentation in panoramic dental X-ray images. The proposed model, EED-Net, achieves better accuracy and speed trade-offs than state-of-the-art methods, making it suitable for real-time applications.
automated maxillofacial segmentation in.methodology: The paper proposes an efficient encoder-decoder network (EED-Net) for maxillofacial segmentation. The model consists of three modules: a feature encoder, a corresponding decoder, and a multipath feature extractor. The encoder uses residual blocks to obtain deeper features, while the decoder employs skip connections to pass low-resolution texture and location information.
automated maxillofacial segmentation in.statistics: The paper uses statistical methods to evaluate the performance of EED-Net on the maxillofacial dataset.
automated maxillofacial segmentation in.research_outcomes: The proposed model achieves better overall performance than state-of-the-art real-time semantic segmentation models, demonstrating its efficiency for maxillofacial segmentation.

use of pupil area and fixation maps to e.title: Use of Pupil Area and Fixation Maps to Evaluate Visual Behavior of Drivers inside Tunnels at Different Luminance Levels—A Pilot Study
use of pupil area and fixation maps to e.summary: This study investigates the visual behavior of drivers in tunnels under different luminance levels, using pupil area and fixation maps to evaluate their gaze patterns. The research focuses on improving traffic safety in tunnels by understanding how drivers' visual features change with illumination.
use of pupil area and fixation maps to e.methodology: The study used non-intrusive eye-tracking equipment to collect data from six experienced drivers in a relatively long tunnel during the daytime, at three luminance levels (2 cd/m2, 2.5 cd/m2, and 3 cd/m2).
use of pupil area and fixation maps to e.research_outcomes: The results demonstrated that luminance levels had a significant effect on pupil areas and fixation zones. Fixation area and average pupil area had a significant negative correlation with luminance levels during the daytime.

medications, deep brain stimulation, and.title: Medications, Deep Brain Stimulation, and Other Factors Influencing Impulse Control Disorders in Parkinson's Disease
medications, deep brain stimulation, and.summary: This review paper examines the factors influencing impulse control disorders (ICDs) in patients with Parkinson's disease. The authors discuss various risk factors, including demographics, medical and surgical associations, premorbidities and comorbidities, family history and genetics, and personality traits. They conclude that dopamine alone cannot account for all ICDs and highlight the need for further investigation.
medications, deep brain stimulation, and.methodology: The authors use a review methodology to summarize the known risk factors and associations with ICDs in PD patients.
medications, deep brain stimulation, and.research_outcomes: The study highlights the complexity of ICDs in PD patients and the need for further investigation into their etiology and management.

polymer optical fiber sensors in healthc.title: Polymer Optical Fiber Sensors in Healthcare Applications: A Comprehensive Review
polymer optical fiber sensors in healthc.summary: This paper presents a comprehensive review of polymer optical fiber sensors in healthcare applications, discussing their advantages and potential for widespread use. The authors highlight the benefits of POF sensors in various healthcare devices, including movement analysis, physiological parameters monitoring, and instrumentation of robotic devices.
polymer optical fiber sensors in healthc.methodology: The paper presents a literature review of existing research on polymer optical fiber sensors in healthcare applications.
polymer optical fiber sensors in healthc.research_outcomes: The authors conclude that POF sensors have the potential to revolutionize healthcare by providing accurate and reliable measurements, improving patient outcomes, and reducing healthcare costs.

interpretable machine learning-derived n.title: Interpretable machine learning-derived nomogram model for early detection of diabetic retinopathy in type 2 diabetes mellitus: a widely targeted metabolomics study
interpretable machine learning-derived n.summary: This paper proposes an interpretable machine learning-derived nomogram model for early detection of diabetic retinopathy in type 2 diabetes mellitus using metabolomics and clinical indicators. The model shows excellent performance in predicting DR, with AUCs of 0.99 (95% CI) in both training and testing sets.
interpretable machine learning-derived n.methodology: Propensity score matching-based case-control study using metabolomics techniques and machine learning algorithms
interpretable machine learning-derived n.statistics: Hosmer–Lemeshow test, receiver operating characteristic curve, decision curve analysis
interpretable machine learning-derived n.research_outcomes: The nomogram model shows excellent quality of classification for DR detection, with a reasonable degree of calibration.

a novel stroke risk model using machine.title: A novel stroke risk model using machine learning techniques
a novel stroke risk model using machine.summary: This paper presents a new stroke risk model developed using machine learning techniques, specifically extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost), to predict 1-year thromboembolic events in Chinese patients with atrial fibrillation. The model integrates three key variables: congestive heart failure or left ventricular dysfunction, age, and prior stroke, and outperforms the widely-used CHA2DS2-VA score in predicting low-risk patients.
a novel stroke risk model using machine.methodology: The study used a prospective cohort design, with data collected from the China Atrial Fibrillation Registry. The XGBoost algorithm was used to select important features and construct a Cox proportional hazards model. The risk score was derived from coefficients of the three variables in the Cox regression model.
a novel stroke risk model using machine.research_outcomes: The novel stroke risk model (CAS) outperformed the CHA2DS2-VA score in predicting low-risk patients and had a higher C-statistic. The CAS model identified a large proportion of patients with low risk of TEs, which could potentially improve anticoagulation decision-making.

effectiveness and treatment moderators o.title: Effectiveness and treatment moderators of internet interventions for adult problem drinking: An individual patient data meta-analysis of 19 randomised controlled trials
effectiveness and treatment moderators o.summary: This paper investigates the effectiveness and moderators of treatment outcomes in internet-based interventions for adult problem drinking. The study conducted a one-stage individual patient data meta-analysis (IPDMA) on 19 randomised controlled trials, including 14,198 adults at baseline. The results show that internet-based alcohol interventions are effective in reducing mean weekly alcohol consumption and achieving adherence to low-risk drinking limits, but the use of waitlist control may inflate outcomes.
effectiveness and treatment moderators o.methodology: The study used a systematic search approach to identify relevant trials, followed by a one-stage individual patient data meta-analysis (IPDMA) using linear mixed models. The primary outcome measure was mean weekly alcohol consumption in standard units (SUs), and secondary outcomes included treatment response (TR).
effectiveness and treatment moderators o.statistics: linear mixed models, odds ratio (OR), number needed to treat (NNT)
effectiveness and treatment moderators o.research_outcomes: The study found that internet-based interventions are effective in reducing mean weekly alcohol consumption and achieving adherence to low-risk drinking limits. Human-guided interventions showed a stronger impact on treatment outcome than fully automated ones.

feasibility and acceptability of a milk.title: Feasibility and acceptability of a milk and resistance exercise intervention to improve muscle function in community-dwelling older adults (MIlkMAN): Pilot study
feasibility and acceptability of a milk.summary: This pilot study examines the feasibility and acceptability of a milk and resistance exercise intervention to improve muscle function in community-dwelling older adults. The study found that the intervention was feasible and acceptable, but did not show significant improvements in muscle strength or function.
feasibility and acceptability of a milk.methodology: The study used a parallel groups design with three arms: whole milk + resistance exercise, skimmed milk + resistance exercise, and control drink + resistance exercise. Participants performed a 6-week community-based resistance exercise programme and consumed either whole milk, skimmed milk, or an isocaloric carbohydrate drink after each exercise session.
feasibility and acceptability of a milk.research_outcomes: The study found that the intervention was feasible and acceptable, with high recruitment and attendance rates. However, there were no significant improvements in muscle strength or function compared to the control group.

effect of n-acetylcysteine on remission.title: Effect of N-acetylcysteine on remission maintenance in patients with ulcerative colitis: A Randomized controlled clinical trial
effect of n-acetylcysteine on remission.summary: This study investigates the effect of N-acetylcysteine on remission maintenance in patients with ulcerative colitis. The research focuses on the antioxidant properties of NAC and its potential to prevent relapse in UC patients, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
effect of n-acetylcysteine on remission.methodology: The study employed a randomized controlled clinical trial design, where patients were randomly assigned to receive either NAC supplementation or placebo. The primary outcome was remission maintenance, and secondary outcomes included endoscopic relapse, serum levels of hs-CRP, hemoglobin, and fecal calprotectin.
effect of n-acetylcysteine on remission.statistics: Statistical analysis was performed using SPSS version 21, including chi-square test, independent t-test, one-way analysis of covariance (ANCOVA), Kaplan-Meier methodology, and log-rank test.
effect of n-acetylcysteine on remission.research_outcomes: The study found that NAC supplementation significantly improved remission maintenance compared to placebo. Patients in the NAC group had a lower rate of relapse and better endoscopic outcomes.

deep learning-based postoperative recove.title: Deep Learning-Based Postoperative Recovery and Nursing of Total Hip Arthroplasty
deep learning-based postoperative recove.summary: This paper presents a deep learning-assisted recovery and nursing system for total hip arthroplasty, utilizing Mask R-CNN to improve postoperative care. The model is trained on human hip X-ray images and can accurately identify prosthetic structures, predict complications, and assist doctors in formulating postoperative care plans.
deep learning-based postoperative recove.methodology: The study uses a deep learning-based approach, specifically Mask R-CNN, to analyze X-ray images of patients with hip lesions. The model is trained on manually labeled medical images and can accurately identify prosthetic structures, predict complications, and assist doctors in formulating postoperative care plans.
deep learning-based postoperative recove.statistics: Statistical methods used: VAS index, Harris score, Barthel index
deep learning-based postoperative recove.research_outcomes: The study found that the application of deep learning method in rapid nursing after total hip replacement can significantly improve the nursing ability. The model was able to accurately identify prosthetic structures, predict complications, and assist doctors in formulating postoperative care plans.

exploring sentiment and care management.title: Exploring Sentiment and Care Management of Hospitalized Patients During the First Wave of the COVID-19 Pandemic Using Electronic Nursing Health Records: Descriptive Study
exploring sentiment and care management.summary: This study explores the use of electronic nursing health records to analyze sentiment and care management of hospitalized patients during the COVID-19 pandemic. The authors used a descriptive study design, analyzing the textual content of electronic nursing clinical notes (ENCN) from nurses working in post-intensive care units for COVID-19 and non-COVID-19 wards. Sentiment analysis was performed using the National Research Council of Canada's Emotion Lexicon, Affin, and Bing dictionaries, revealing significant differences in sentiment between patients with COVID-19 and those without.
exploring sentiment and care management.methodology: The study used a descriptive study design, analyzing the textual content of ENCN from nurses working in post-intensive care units for COVID-19 and non-COVID-19 wards. Sentiment analysis was performed using the National Research Council of Canada's Emotion Lexicon, Affin, and Bing dictionaries.
exploring sentiment and care management.statistics: Statistical analysis was performed using the R package (version 3.5.1). The level of significance was established at P<.05.
exploring sentiment and care management.research_outcomes: The study found significant differences in sentiment between patients with COVID-19 and those without. The authors concluded that electronic nursing health records can be used to analyze sentiment and care management of hospitalized patients during the COVID-19 pandemic.

children\u2019s rare disease cohorts: an.title: Children’s Rare Disease Cohorts: An Integrative Research and Clinical Genomics Initiative
children\u2019s rare disease cohorts: an.summary: This paper presents the Children's Rare Disease Cohorts initiative, a program at Boston Children's Hospital integrating genomic, research, and clinical data to expedite pediatric precision medicine. The authors developed a genomics learning system (GLS) for storage and use of the data, which was used to analyze clinical and research data of an additional set of 6075 exomes and 112 genomes.
children\u2019s rare disease cohorts: an.methodology: The authors developed a genomics learning system (GLS) for storage and use of the data, which integrated analytical systems, including machine learning algorithms for automated variant classification and prioritization, as well as phenotype extraction via NLP of clinical notes.
children\u2019s rare disease cohorts: an.research_outcomes: The CRDC initiative enrolled 2441 participants and collected genotypic data and phenotypic data from the medical record and research surveys. The GLS was used to analyze clinical and research data, resulting in improved gene discovery and diagnosis rates.
sources_of_inspiration: National Institutes of Health's Genomic Data Sharing Policy
Global Alliance for Genomics and Health (GA4GH) Data Use Ontology

a practical guide to preclinical systema.title: A practical guide to preclinical systematic review and meta-analysis
a practical guide to preclinical systema.summary: This paper provides a comprehensive guide to conducting preclinical systematic reviews (SRs) and meta-analyses (MAs), highlighting their importance in generating empirical evidence for robust experimental design, informing research strategy, and supporting funding applications. The authors emphasize that SRs can be conducted without machine learning expertise, using free and widely accessible software.
a practical guide to preclinical systema.methodology: The paper outlines the methodology for conducting preclinical SRs, including identifying, selecting, and critically appraising available literature to answer a specific research question in an unbiased manner.
a practical guide to preclinical systema.research_outcomes: Preclinical SRs provide empirical evidence to improve study design, methods, and analysis, increasing usability, accessibility, and reproducibility. They can also inform clinical trial design and establish whether there is evidence to justify a clinical trial.

differentiation of cytomegalovirus and h.title: Differentiation of Cytomegalovirus and Herpes Simplex Virus Esophagitis Based on Endoscopic Findings
differentiation of cytomegalovirus and h.summary: This paper investigates the differentiation of cytomegalovirus (CMV) and herpes simplex virus (HSV) esophagitis based on endoscopic findings. The authors develop a predictive model to distinguish between the two conditions, which is challenging due to overlapping endoscopic features. The study uses logistic regression analysis and receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve analysis to evaluate the model's performance.
differentiation of cytomegalovirus and h.methodology: The study used a retrospective cohort design, analyzing data from 169 patients with suspected CMV or HSV esophagitis. Endoscopic findings were categorized into four categories using average linkage clustering, and logistic regression analysis was used to identify candidate variables for differentiating CMV esophagitis from HSV esophagitis.
differentiation of cytomegalovirus and h.statistics: chi-square test, Fisher exact test, Student's t test, Mann-Whitney U test
differentiation of cytomegalovirus and h.research_outcomes: The authors developed a predictive model with good discriminatory power (area under the ROC curve = 0.967) to differentiate between CMV and HSV esophagitis based on endoscopic findings.

diabetic retinopathy detection by image.title: Diabetic Retinopathy Detection by Image Processing Algorithms and Machine Learning Technique
diabetic retinopathy detection by image.summary: This paper presents a machine learning-based approach for detecting diabetic retinopathy from fundus images. The proposed system uses Support Vector Machine (SVM) classification and image processing techniques to identify microaneurysms, hemorrhages, and exudates in the retina. The method is shown to be effective in distinguishing between normal eyes, diabetic retinopathy, and Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD).
diabetic retinopathy detection by image.methodology: The proposed system uses a combination of image processing techniques, including adaptive histogram equalization, median filtering, and edge zero padding, to preprocess the fundus images. The preprocessed images are then fed into an SVM classifier for classification.
diabetic retinopathy detection by image.research_outcomes: The proposed system is shown to achieve high accuracy in detecting diabetic retinopathy from fundus images.

toward improved endoscopic examination o.title: Toward improved endoscopic examination of urinary stones: a concordance study between endoscopic digital pictures vs microscopy
toward improved endoscopic examination o.summary: This paper presents a concordance study between endoscopic and microscopic observations of urinary stones. The authors aim to improve the recognition of urinary stone morphologies using endoscopic examination, which is essential in lithiasis. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.
toward improved endoscopic examination o.methodology: The study adhered to all local regulations and data protection agency recommendations. An expert urologist intraoperatively and prospectively examined stones using a flexible digital ureterorenoscope. Visual cues were considered for the estimation of stone type, and laser-based stone section was performed.
toward improved endoscopic examination o.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates the feasibility of using endoscopic morphology for urinary stones recognition. The overall matching rate was 81.6%. Diagnostics were confirmed for specific morphologies, and didactic boards of confirmed endoscopic images are provided.

deepaise -- an end-to-end development an.title: DeepAISE -- An End-to-End Development and Deployment of a Recurrent Neural Survival Model for Early Prediction of Sepsis
deepaise -- an end-to-end development an.summary: This paper presents DeepAISE, a recurrent neural survival model for early prediction of sepsis. The model uses clinical criteria and treatment policies to rank the relative utility of various consensus criteria through policy evaluation. The authors show that by coupling a criterion with a treatment policy, one can use the framework of Attributable Treatment Effect Estimates (ATEE) to compare the different criteria.
deepaise -- an end-to-end development an.methodology: The methodology involves using a recurrent neural network to predict sepsis onset time based on clinical risk factors and temporal patterns. The model is trained on two cohorts: Emory and MIMIC-III.
deepaise -- an end-to-end development an.statistics: Survival analysis, attributable treatment effect-size estimates
deepaise -- an end-to-end development an.research_outcomes: The study shows that the Third International Consensus Definition of Sepsis (Sepsis-3) criterion is more effective than the Center for Disease Control (CDC) criterion in predicting sepsis onset time. The authors also demonstrate the use of ATEE to compare different treatment policies and identify the most optimal one.
sources_of_inspiration: Third International Consensus Definitions for Sepsis

effects of high-intensity interval and m.title: Effects of high-intensity interval and moderate-intensity continuous aerobic exercise on diabetic obese patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease
effects of high-intensity interval and m.summary: This study investigates the effects of high-intensity interval and moderate-intensity continuous aerobic exercise on diabetic obese patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease. The research finds that both types of exercise reduce hepatic fat and visceral lipids, but there is no significant difference between the two groups.
effects of high-intensity interval and m.statistics: Analysis of variance, paired t test
effects of high-intensity interval and m.research_outcomes: Both high-intensity interval and moderate-intensity continuous aerobic exercise reduce hepatic fat and visceral lipids in diabetic obese patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease.

long non-coding rna profile study identi.title: Long non-coding RNA profile study identifies a metabolism-related signature for colorectal cancer
long non-coding rna profile study identi.summary: This paper presents a novel approach to predicting outcomes of colorectal cancer patients by identifying a metabolism-related long non-coding RNA signature. The study uses machine learning techniques to integrate clinical data and transcriptome information, resulting in a prognostic scoring system that can predict patient prognosis with high accuracy.
long non-coding rna profile study identi.methodology: The study used a combination of machine learning algorithms and statistical methods to identify metabolism-related long non-coding RNAs associated with colorectal cancer outcomes. The methodology involved data preprocessing, feature selection, model training, and validation using external cohorts.
long non-coding rna profile study identi.statistics: Pearson test, Wilcoxon test, Kruskal-Wallis test, univariate cox proportional hazards regression
long non-coding rna profile study identi.research_outcomes: The study identified a metabolism-related long non-coding RNA signature that can predict patient prognosis with high accuracy. The nomogram constructed using the risk score and clinical parameters showed good predictive ability.

flairectomy: resecting beyond the contra.title: FLAIRectomy: Resecting beyond the Contrast Margin for Glioblastoma
flairectomy: resecting beyond the contra.summary: This paper discusses the resection of peri-tumoral FLAIR signal in glioblastoma patients, which has been shown to improve survival outcomes. The authors review existing studies on the composition of peri-tumoral FLAIR and its relationship with patient survival, highlighting the importance of considering FLAIRectomy as a treatment option for GBM.
flairectomy: resecting beyond the contra.methodology: The paper reviews existing literature on the topic, using histopathological and imaging studies to understand the role of FLAIR signal in glioblastoma progression and recurrence.
flairectomy: resecting beyond the contra.research_outcomes: The study finds that resection of peri-tumoral FLAIR signal is associated with improved survival outcomes in GBM patients. The authors suggest that FLAIRectomy may be a valuable treatment option for improving patient outcomes.

identification and analysis of glioblast.title: Identification and Analysis of Glioblastoma Biomarkers Based on Single Cell Sequencing
identification and analysis of glioblast.summary: This paper identifies biomarkers for glioblastoma tumors using single-cell RNA sequencing and computational methods. The study applies machine learning algorithms, specifically support vector machines, to screen core biomarkers that can distinguish between tumor cells and surrounding tissue. The results provide insights into GBM mechanisms and may be useful for diagnosis and therapy.
identification and analysis of glioblast.methodology: The study uses single-cell RNA sequencing data from Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) to analyze the gene expression profiles of glioblastoma tumor cells and surrounding tissue. The maximum relevance minimum redundancy (mRMR) method is used to select core biomarkers, and support vector machines are applied for classification.
identification and analysis of glioblast.research_outcomes: 31 important genes were extracted as potential biomarkers for GBM tumor cells. An optimal classification model using a support vector machine algorithm was also built.

the impact of mind-body exercises on mot.title: The Impact of Mind-Body Exercises on Motor Function, Depressive Symptoms, and Quality of Life in Parkinson’s Disease: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
the impact of mind-body exercises on mot.summary: This systematic review and meta-analysis investigates the effects of mind-body exercises (Tai Chi, Yoga, Health Qigong) on motor function, depressive symptoms, and quality of life in patients with Parkinson’s disease. The study finds significant improvements in motor function, depressive symptoms, and quality of life, suggesting that mind-body exercises can be an effective method for clinical exercise intervention in PD patients.
the impact of mind-body exercises on mot.statistics: Meta-analysis using Cochrane collaboration software (Review Manager 5.3) and Stata14.0
the impact of mind-body exercises on mot.research_outcomes: Significant improvements in motor function, depressive symptoms, and quality of life in patients with Parkinson’s disease

real-time surgical tools recognition in.title: Real-time Surgical Tools Recognition in Total Knee Arthroplasty Using Deep Neural Networks
real-time surgical tools recognition in.summary: This paper proposes a real-time surgical tools recognition system for total knee arthroplasty using deep neural networks. The system uses a convolutional neural network (CNN) to detect surgical tools in real-time, improving the accuracy and precision of TKA procedures.
real-time surgical tools recognition in.methodology: The proposed method uses a region-based convolutional neural network (R-CNN) architecture, which includes a base network with 16 convolutional layers and a region proposal network (RPN).
real-time surgical tools recognition in.research_outcomes: The system achieved 87.6% mAP, outperforming state-of-the-art methods for tools detection.

advance care planning and care coordinat.title: Advance Care Planning and Care Coordination for People With Parkinson's Disease and Their Family Caregivers—Study Protocol for a Multicentre, Randomized Controlled Trial
advance care planning and care coordinat.summary: This study evaluates the impact and feasibility of a nurse-led palliative care intervention for people with Parkinson's disease across seven European countries. The intervention focuses on Advance Care Planning (ACP) and care coordination, aiming to improve quality of life and manage end-of-life perspectives.
advance care planning and care coordinat.methodology: Multicentre, single-blinded randomized controlled parallel group design
advance care planning and care coordinat.statistics: Mantel–Haenszel methods and multilevel logistic regression models
advance care planning and care coordinat.research_outcomes: Effectiveness of a nurse-led palliative care intervention for people with PD and their family caregivers; feasibility of the PD_Pal intervention across seven European countries

effects of the sodium\u2013glucose co-tr.title: Effects of the sodium–glucose co-transporter 2 inhibitor dapagliflozin in patients with type 2 diabetes and Stages 3b–4 chronic kidney disease
effects of the sodium\u2013glucose co-tr.summary: This paper investigates the effects of dapagliflozin, a sodium-glucose co-transporter 2 inhibitor, in patients with type 2 diabetes and Stages 3b–4 chronic kidney disease. The study found that dapagliflozin did not decrease HbA1c levels but decreased UACR, BP, and body weight to a clinically meaningful extent.
effects of the sodium\u2013glucose co-tr.methodology: The study used a pooled analysis of 11 phase 3 randomized controlled clinical trials to examine the effects of dapagliflozin in patients with type 2 diabetes and Stages 3b–4 CKD.
effects of the sodium\u2013glucose co-tr.statistics: Descriptive statistics were used for presenting baseline characteristics and safety data. The mean change from baseline value and 95% confidence interval (CI) were derived using a longitudinal repeated measures mixed model.
effects of the sodium\u2013glucose co-tr.research_outcomes: The study found that dapagliflozin decreased UACR, BP, and body weight but did not decrease HbA1c levels in patients with type 2 diabetes and Stages 3b–4 CKD.

evaluation of adherence to anti-retrovir.title: Evaluation of Adherence to Anti-Retroviral Treatment: Experience of SANRU, DRC
evaluation of adherence to anti-retrovir.summary: This study evaluates adherence to anti-retroviral treatment (ART) in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The authors analyzed data from 2586 patients and found that 82% were adherent to ART, with a strong association between adherence and the presence of HIV care trained healthcare providers.
evaluation of adherence to anti-retrovir.methodology: Cross-sectional study using SPSS software package 21.0 version for data analysis
evaluation of adherence to anti-retrovir.research_outcomes: The study found that adherence to ART was strongly associated with the presence of HIV care trained healthcare providers and setting/distance between facilities and patient's habitat.

locating the quad: informality, institut.title: Locating the Quad: Informality, Institutional Flexibility, and Future Alignment in the Indo-Pacific
locating the quad: informality, institut.summary: This paper examines the Quad, an informal intergovernmental organization consisting of Australia, India, Japan, and the US. The authors argue that the Quad's informality is a geopolitical necessity, allowing for coordination on security activities while maintaining equivocal positions vis-à-vis China.
locating the quad: informality, institut.methodology: The paper uses theoretical discussions about International Organizations (IOs), including formal alliances, to examine the Quad's evolution and character of members' interactions.
locating the quad: informality, institut.research_outcomes: The authors conclude that the Quad's informality currently suits its members because it places minimal obligations on parties and allows avoidance of issues in which the members hold divergent positions.

institutional castling: military enlistm.title: Institutional Castling: Military Enlistment and Mass Incarceration in the United States
institutional castling: military enlistm.summary: This paper examines the historical relationship between penal confinement and military employment, highlighting how changes in social policies have affected the risk of incarceration among young black men. The authors argue that the intersection of these institutions is crucial to understanding patterns of social inequality.
institutional castling: military enlistm.methodology: The authors use standardization and decomposition techniques, as well as other statistical methods, to quantify levels of incarceration associated with shifts in the race and class distribution of military enlistment across generations.
institutional castling: military enlistm.research_outcomes: The study finds that changes in the racial, educational, and population distributions of active duty military personnel are associated with racial and educational inequality in incarceration. The authors demonstrate the demographic consequences of institutional castling-the shifting prominence of state institutions in the lives of particular demographic groups following changes in social policies or judicial decisions.

pile of law: learning responsible data f.title: Pile of Law: Learning Responsible Data Filtering from the Law and a 256GB Open-Source Legal Dataset
pile of law: learning responsible data f.summary: This paper presents Pile of Law, a 256GB open-source legal dataset that can be used for pretraining large language models. The authors propose using legal norms to filter out private and toxic content from the dataset, providing an approach to responsible data filtering.
pile of law: learning responsible data f.methodology: The authors curate a dataset of legal and administrative text by compiling data from 35 sources, including court opinions, contracts, statutes, regulations, and more. They then use this dataset to train a BERT-large equivalent model, demonstrating its potential for pretraining large language models.
pile of law: learning responsible data f.research_outcomes: The authors demonstrate that their approach to filtering out private and toxic content from the dataset is effective in reducing bias and improving model performance. They also show that pretraining on Pile of Law can improve access to justice by providing a more nuanced understanding of legal norms.

ethical global citizenship education: fr.title: Ethical Global Citizenship Education: From Neoliberalism to a Values-Based Pedagogy
ethical global citizenship education: fr.summary: This paper proposes an ethical global citizenship education framework that goes beyond neoliberal principles toward promoting social responsibility, justice, human rights, and glocal sustainability. The authors argue for a values-based pedagogy that fosters critical thinking, self-awareness, and international understanding.
ethical global citizenship education: fr.methodology: The paper uses a theoretical approach to conceptualize ethical global citizenship education, drawing on multiple critical literatures and frameworks.
ethical global citizenship education: fr.research_outcomes: The authors propose an ethical GCE framework with five dimensions: values-creation, identity progression, collective involvement, glocal disposition, and intergenerational mindset. They argue that this approach can foster global citizens who are critically oriented, reflexive, and committed to social justice.

there is no substitute for human intelli.title: There is No Substitute for Human Intelligence
there is no substitute for human intelli.summary: This paper explores the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) and handheld devices in point-of-care ultrasound (POCUS), demonstrating its potential to improve image acquisition, diagnostic yield, and portability. The authors highlight the benefits of AI-guided software in facilitating bedside use by frontline medical personnel, particularly in settings with limited access to ultrasound expertise.
there is no substitute for human intelli.methodology: The study employed a combination of AI-guided software and handheld devices to facilitate POCUS, comparing its effectiveness against traditional methods. The authors trained novice users using the AI-guided software, which guided them in acquiring diagnostic quality images with automated analysis.
there is no substitute for human intelli.research_outcomes: The study demonstrated that AI-guided POCUS can achieve high-quality images and accurate diagnoses, even with novice users. The results showed a significant reduction in time taken for assessment compared to traditional methods.

the technological construction of sovere.title: The Technological Construction of Sovereignty
the technological construction of sovere.summary: This paper explores the impact of technology on sovereignty, arguing that technological construction can redefine core aspects of state authority. The authors contend that digital technologies shape internal and external legitimacy, accountability, and transparency, and propose a dialogue between policymakers and technologists to design law and policy in alignment with sovereignty safeguards.
the technological construction of sovere.methodology: The paper employs a conceptual approach, drawing on social constructivist theory and the interplay of technology and law.
the technological construction of sovere.research_outcomes: Key findings include the redefinition of core privileges of the state through technological means, the potential for technology to undermine internal legitimacy, and the need for policymakers to engage in dialogue with technologists to design sovereignty safeguards.

possibilities for modernization of conci.title: Possibilities for Modernization of Conciliation Board Procedures in the Countries of Central and Eastern Europe-Online Dispute Resolution and Electronic Communication
possibilities for modernization of conci.summary: This paper examines the role of conciliation bodies in consumer disputes, focusing on the potential for modernization through online dispute resolution and electronic communication. Although the authors mention the possibility of using artificial intelligence and other software solutions, their methodology primarily relies on traditional procedures and written communication.
possibilities for modernization of conci.methodology: The paper uses a qualitative approach, examining the case law of conciliation bodies in Central and Eastern Europe and discussing the potential for modernization through online dispute resolution and electronic communication.
possibilities for modernization of conci.research_outcomes: The authors highlight the need for more efficient and effective conciliation procedures, particularly in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. They suggest that the use of electronic communication and online dispute resolution could improve the effectiveness of these procedures.

future of us-china relations: conflict,.title: Future of US-China Relations: Conflict, Competition or Cooperation?
future of us-china relations: conflict,.summary: This paper analyzes the future nature of US-China relations using both Realism and Liberalism paradigms. The authors conclude that China's ambitions are limited, and it is unlikely to challenge US hegemony due to its relative weakness.
future of us-china relations: conflict,.methodology: The authors use a combination of theoretical frameworks from International Relations, including Realism and Liberalism, to analyze the future nature of US-China relations.
future of us-china relations: conflict,.research_outcomes: The paper concludes that China's ambitions are limited, and it is unlikely to challenge US hegemony due to its relative weakness. The authors also argue that the security dilemma remains valid in US-China relations, but counterbalancing mechanisms such as MAD can offset the dangers of misperception and potential clashes.

predicting election outcome from social.title: Predicting Election Outcome from Social Media Data
predicting election outcome from social.summary: This paper proposes a simple and straightforward technique for predicting election outcomes based on tweets counts. The authors aggregate two efficacious techniques to extract information from tweet data, counting virtual votes for each corresponding political group. The results closely match the original election findings, published by the Australian Electoral Commission.
predicting election outcome from social.methodology: The authors propose a novel method of counting system by two-way extraction of virtual support from Twitter mentions of political parties during the election season.
predicting election outcome from social.research_outcomes: The proposed technique shows promising results in predicting election outcomes, with a high accuracy rate compared to other approaches.

restorative justice and its impact on pr.title: Restorative Justice and its impact on Primary Schools Students of Swat, KP- Pakistan: In Psychological Perspective
restorative justice and its impact on pr.summary: This paper explores the implementation of Restorative Justice in primary schools of Swat, KP-Pakistan. Despite its increasing recognition and use, there is a limited amount of research on its effect and impact. The study aims to evaluate the success of Restorative Justice in reducing misconducts among students and promoting social healing.
restorative justice and its impact on pr.methodology: The study uses a qualitative approach to explore the implementation of Restorative Justice in primary schools. It involves a review of existing literature on Restorative Justice and its application in educational settings.
restorative justice and its impact on pr.research_outcomes: The study finds that Restorative Justice has been successfully implemented in primary schools, resulting in a reduction of misconducts among students and an increase in their psychological capitals.
sources_of_inspiration: Lawrence W. Sherman and Heather Strong (2007)

the death of law: another obituary.title: The Death of Law: Another Obituary
the death of law: another obituary.summary: This paper argues that the distinctive mode of judgment in modern law, known as Legal Adjudication by Judgment (LAJ), is destined for 'the dustbin of history' due to its supersession by technological management. The author contends that LAJ's emphasis on generality and abstraction is being replaced by a more nuanced approach that incorporates machine learning and artificial intelligence.
the death of law: another obituary.methodology: The paper uses a combination of legal theory, historical analysis, and philosophical critique to argue for the decline of LAJ. The author draws on the work of Roger Brownsword and Michel Foucault to develop their argument.
the death of law: another obituary.research_outcomes: The paper concludes that LAJ is being superseded by technological management, which seeks to prevent certain forms of conduct or action from arising through design and automation. This shift has significant implications for our understanding of law and its relationship to technology.

the role of serology testing in the cont.title: The Role of Serology Testing in the Context of Immunization Policies for COVID-19 in Latin American Countries
the role of serology testing in the cont.summary: This paper reviews the role and value of serology testing in the context of COVID-19 immunization policies in Latin American countries, highlighting the barriers and challenges to its adequate use. The study finds that serology testing has not been widely adopted in the region due to various factors, including lack of infrastructure, limited resources, and conflicting guidelines.
the role of serology testing in the cont.methodology: The paper builds on a review of literature and policies, as well as a multistage process of discussion, validation, and feedback with a group of five experts from Latin America.
the role of serology testing in the cont.research_outcomes: The study highlights the need for improved serology testing infrastructure and guidelines in the region to support immunization initiatives.

climate change, malthusian catastrophe,.title: Climate Change, Malthusian Catastrophe, and a Global Rule of Law
climate change, malthusian catastrophe,.summary: This paper discusses the implications of global warming as a successor to the Malthusian Population Catastrophe, exploring the differences between two legal cultures and their applications to human life. The authors argue that the Anglophone solution is to impose a strict global Rule of Law, while the Civilian counterpart emphasizes cultivation and learning.
climate change, malthusian catastrophe,.methodology: The paper uses a historical and philosophical approach to compare the Continental and English legal traditions, examining their differences in application to human life and the logic of a transcendent Anglophone legality.
climate change, malthusian catastrophe,.research_outcomes: The authors conclude that there are fundamentally two types of solution to global warming: those enforced from the top down by coercive authority and those from the bottom up by public cultivation and learning.
sources_of_inspiration: Condorcet, N. (2012a). Progress of the Human Mind.

design and analysis of multi-layer and c.title: Design and Analysis of Multi-Layer and Cuboid Coding Metamaterials for Radar Cross-Section Reduction
design and analysis of multi-layer and c.summary: This paper presents a design and analysis of multi-layer and cuboid coding metamaterials for reducing Radar Cross-Section (RCS) values in C- and Ku-band applications. The research focuses on developing coding metamaterials with unique properties, which can manipulate electromagnetic waves to achieve different functionalities.
design and analysis of multi-layer and c.methodology: The authors utilised a high-frequency electromagnetic simulator known as computer simulation technology throughout the simulation process. Analytical simulation analyses were performed using well-known Computer Simulation Technology (CST) software and High-Frequency Structure Simulator (HFSS) software.
design and analysis of multi-layer and c.research_outcomes: The study presents promising outcomes wherein several one-bit coding designs for multi-layer or coding metamaterials manifested unique results, which almost reached 0 dBm2 RCS reduction values. The coding metamaterials were validated by performing several framework and optimal characteristic analyses in C- and Ku-band applications.
sources_of_inspiration: tensor-coding metasurface at the terahertz frequency

study of wear performance of deep drawin.title: Study of wear performance of deep drawing tooling
study of wear performance of deep drawin.summary: This paper studies the wear behavior of high carbon high chromium steel, specifically Viking grade steel, under various processing parameters. The research aims to investigate the mechanical and tribological properties of die steel and develop a statistical model to predict wear under dry conditions.
study of wear performance of deep drawin.methodology: Experimental investigation using factorial experimental design and analysis of variance (ANOVA) to examine the influences of process parameters on wear behavior
study of wear performance of deep drawin.research_outcomes: The study found that Viking grade steel exhibits high toughness and wear resistance. The results show that the wear rate and coefficient of friction are significantly affected by the processing parameters.

understanding and optimization of hard m.title: Understanding and optimization of hard magnetic compounds from first principles
understanding and optimization of hard m.summary: This paper reviews recent developments in computational schemes for rare-earth magnet compounds, focusing on the use of first-principles calculations to understand and design magnetic materials. The authors discuss the limitations of current methods and propose new approaches, including data-driven methods for optimizing chemical composition.
understanding and optimization of hard m.methodology: The paper uses density functional theory (DFT) and other computational schemes to study rare-earth magnet compounds.
understanding and optimization of hard m.research_outcomes: The authors review recent developments in computational schemes for rare-earth magnet compounds, highlighting the importance of first-principles calculations for understanding magnetic properties. They propose new approaches for optimizing chemical composition using data-driven methods.

study on the linkages between microstruc.title: Study on the linkages between microstructure and permeability of porous media using pore network and BP neural network
study on the linkages between microstruc.summary: This paper presents a framework to characterize the pore microstructure of porous media and predict permeability using a combination of pore network modeling (PNM) and back-propagation neural networks (BPNN). The PNM is used to represent the complex geometry of the pore space with morphology parameters, while the BPNN maps these parameters to permeability. The study demonstrates excellent prediction performance of the BPNN and identifies key morphology descriptors that significantly affect permeability.
study on the linkages between microstruc.methodology: The framework consists of four parts: building a dataset of porous media samples, extracting pore networks from images, training a BPNN model to predict permeability, and explaining the trained model. The study uses X-ray micro-computed tomography technology to obtain 3D digital images of porous media.
study on the linkages between microstruc.statistics: Pearson correlation coefficient (PCC) is used to determine linear relationships between morphology parameters and permeability. Feature importance scores are calculated to show which morphology parameters have a significant effect on predicting permeability.
study on the linkages between microstruc.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates that the proposed framework can effectively characterize porous media and predict permeability with high accuracy. The results show that six key morphology descriptors (porosity, coordination number, average pore diameter, average throat diameter, average pore throat ratio, and average throat length) are reserved to characterize pore microstructure.

application of bayesian family classifie.title: Application of Bayesian Family Classifiers for Cutting Tool Inserts Health Monitoring on CNC Milling
application of bayesian family classifie.summary: This paper presents the application of supervised Machine Learning classifiers to design empirical classification models for tool condition monitoring in CNC milling. The study uses Bayesian family classifiers, including Bayes Net and Naïve Bayes, to classify tool conditions based on vibration data collected during face milling.
application of bayesian family classifie.methodology: The study incorporates a statistical approach to extract attributes from vibration data and reduces dimensionality using the J48 decision tree algorithm. The Bayesian classifiers are then used to classify tool conditions.
application of bayesian family classifie.statistics: Statistical methods, including Principle Component Analysis (PCA) and regression analysis, are used to analyze vibration data.
application of bayesian family classifie.research_outcomes: The study achieves a classification accuracy of 90% using machine learning algorithms, outperforming traditional condition monitoring methods. The results demonstrate the effectiveness of Bayesian classifiers in tool condition monitoring.

an inductively coupled plasma metal orga.title: An inductively coupled plasma metal organic chemical vapor deposition based on showerhead structure for low temperature growth
an inductively coupled plasma metal orga.summary: This paper proposes a new method for the low-temperature growth of semiconductor thin films using inductively coupled plasma metal organic chemical vapor deposition (ICP-MOCVD) with a showerhead structure. The research focuses on optimizing the showerhead structure to improve uniformity and crystalline quality, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
an inductively coupled plasma metal orga.methodology: The authors use computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations based on Navier-Stokes equations and laminar flow models to analyze the transport of precursors in the ICP-MOCVD chamber. They also perform preliminary experiments using the optimized showerhead structure.
an inductively coupled plasma metal orga.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates improved uniformity and crystalline quality of GaN films grown at low temperature using the proposed ICP-MOCVD method with a showerhead structure.

a new approach for measurement of tensil.title: A New Approach for Measurement of Tensile Strength of Concrete
a new approach for measurement of tensil.summary: This paper presents a new approach to measure the tensile strength of concrete using a compression-to-tension load transformer device. The method involves applying compressive loads to the top and bottom of a hole in the specimen, causing it to be subjected to uniaxial tensile stress.
a new approach for measurement of tensil.methodology: The methodology involves developing a new loading device called compression-to-tension transformer to apply a tensile stress to the concrete-like specimen. The proposed device is designed and fabricated for use with most commercially available compression loading machines.
a new approach for measurement of tensil.research_outcomes: The results show that the direct tensile strength of concrete is clearly lower than the Brazilian test, with a difference of about 33%. The study also presents a criterion for determining the real tensile strength of concrete based on numerical simulation.

damage monitoring of single lap bonded c.title: Damage Monitoring of Single Lap Bonded Composite Using Acoustic Emission Technique
damage monitoring of single lap bonded c.summary: This paper investigates the damage monitoring of single lap bonded composite using acoustic emission technique. The authors experimentally investigate the type of failure involved in single adhesive lap joints of composite and use an acoustic emission technique to monitor the pre and post aspects of damage growth in adhesive composite joint.
damage monitoring of single lap bonded c.methodology: The authors used an acoustic emission technique (AET) to monitor the pre and post aspects of damage growth in adhesive composite joint. The AET was used to scan the pre and post failure mechanism involved during tensile loading.
damage monitoring of single lap bonded c.research_outcomes: The study found that the acoustic emission technique can be used as a failure-monitoring tool for studying damage sensitivity and material degradation.

hydrogen adsorption on doped mos2 nanost.title: Hydrogen adsorption on doped MoS2 nanostructures
hydrogen adsorption on doped mos2 nanost.summary: This paper investigates the hydrogen adsorption characteristics in chemically modified MoS2 nanostructures using density functional theory calculations. A machine learning model is used to facilitate the screening of suitable structures, achieving a promising level of prediction accuracy with minimal structural input.
hydrogen adsorption on doped mos2 nanost.research_outcomes: The study finds clear benefits of doping the basal plane and provides new insight into doping-enhanced activity. The machine learning model is shown to be effective in screening suitable structures.

critical increase in na-doping facilitat.title: Critical increase in Na-doping facilitates acceptor band movements that yields ~180 meV shallow hole conduction in ZnO bulk crystals
critical increase in na-doping facilitat.summary: This paper investigates the effect of Na-doping on the electronic properties of ZnO bulk crystals. The authors report a critical increase in Na-acceptor concentration, which leads to shallow hole conduction and p-type conduction in ZnO crystals.
critical increase in na-doping facilitat.methodology: The authors used a unique experimental set-up for high Na-doping by thermal diffusion in the bulk ZnO single crystals. They measured the incorporation and concentration of Na-dopants using Secondary-ion mass spectrometry (SIMS).
critical increase in na-doping facilitat.research_outcomes: The study shows that Na-doping at high temperature leads to a significant increase in Na-acceptor concentration, resulting in shallow hole conduction and p-type conduction in ZnO crystals.

prediction of endpoint sulfur content in.title: Prediction of Endpoint Sulfur Content in KR Desulfurization Based on the Hybrid Algorithm Combining Artificial Neural Network With SAPSO
prediction of endpoint sulfur content in.summary: This paper presents a data-driven model to predict endpoint sulfur content in KR desulfurization process using a hybrid algorithm combining artificial neural network with SAPSO. The proposed model achieves higher accuracy than traditional statistical models and is used to optimize the KR desulfurization process.
prediction of endpoint sulfur content in.methodology: The authors use a hybrid algorithm combining artificial neural network with Particle Swarm Optimization revised by Simulation Anneal algorithm (SAPSO) to predict endpoint sulfur content in KR desulfurization process.
prediction of endpoint sulfur content in.statistics: Correlation Coefficient (R), Root Mean Square Error (RMSE), and Mean Absolute Relative Error (MARE)
prediction of endpoint sulfur content in.research_outcomes: The proposed model achieves higher accuracy than traditional statistical models, with R value of 0.54, RMSE of $2.61	imes 10^{-4}$ % and MAER of 0.47.

design and high-throughput screening of.title: Design and High-Throughput Screening of High Entropy Alloys
design and high-throughput screening of.summary: This paper explores the design and high-throughput screening of high entropy alloys, proposing new parameters to predict phase formation. The authors introduce the mixing entropy (ΔS mix ) and Delta (δ) parameter to comprehensively reflect phase formation laws in multi-component alloys.
design and high-throughput screening of.methodology: The methodology involves designing high-entropy alloys using a balanced parameter, Ω, which is defined as the average melting temperature T m times entropy of mixing Δ S m over enthalpy of mixing Δ H m .
design and high-throughput screening of.research_outcomes: The authors propose new parameters to predict phase formation in multi-component alloys, including the mixing entropy (ΔS mix ) and Delta (δ) parameter.

editorial on special issue \u201chologra.title: Editorial on Special Issue “Holography, 3-D Imaging and 3-D Display”
editorial on special issue \u201chologra.summary: This paper is an editorial that discusses the application of modern holographic techniques in various fields, including 3D inspection, 3D microscopy, metrology and profilometry, augmented reality, and industrial informatics. The paper does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
editorial on special issue \u201chologra.methodology: The paper discusses the application of modern holographic techniques in various fields, but it does not describe a specific methodology or approach.
editorial on special issue \u201chologra.research_outcomes: The paper presents an overview of the current state-of-the-art techniques in 3D imaging and 3D display, as well as future development prospects.

predicting mechanical properties from mi.title: Predicting Mechanical Properties from Microstructure Images in Fiber-reinforced Polymers using Convolutional Neural Networks
predicting mechanical properties from mi.summary: This paper explores the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to predict mechanical properties from microstructure images in fiber-reinforced polymers. The authors modified a pre-existing CNN, StressNet, for non-linear finite element simulations and trained it on data generated from FE simulations. The resulting model can make predictions within seconds, compared to 92.5 hours for the full FE simulation.
predicting mechanical properties from mi.methodology: The authors used a fully convolutional neural network with an encoder-decoder structure to predict the stress field from microstructure images. The model was trained on data generated from FE simulations and evaluated using metrics such as accuracy and speed.
predicting mechanical properties from mi.research_outcomes: The study shows that CNNs can be used to quickly and accurately predict mechanical properties from microstructure images, making them a promising tool for materials science research. The authors also demonstrate the ability of their model to capture important characteristics, especially on fibers.

evaluation of ann and anfis modeling abi.title: Evaluation of ANN and ANFIS modeling ability in the prediction of AISI 1050 steel machining performance
evaluation of ann and anfis modeling abi.summary: This paper evaluates the performance of Artificial Neural Network (ANN) and Adaptive Neuro-Fuzzy Inference System (ANFIS) models in predicting machining responses for AISI 1050 steel turning operation. The study finds that ANN is relatively superior to ANFIS, with a maximum value of 92.1% recorded using the ANN compared to that of the ANFIS of 73%. The results demonstrate the substantial impact of ML/AI on the research, as the models are used to predict machining responses and optimize process parameters.
evaluation of ann and anfis modeling abi.methodology: The study uses a central composite design (CCD) with three-level experimental matrix to generate data for training, validation, and testing of the ANN model. The network is trained using MATLAB 2016b software, with periodic checking of network error for early stopping.
evaluation of ann and anfis modeling abi.statistics: Coefficient of correlation (R2), root mean squared error (RMSE)
evaluation of ann and anfis modeling abi.research_outcomes: The study finds that ANN is relatively superior to ANFIS in predicting machining responses. The results demonstrate the potential of ML/AI in optimizing process parameters and improving machining performance.

frequency-dependent dielectric constant.title: Frequency-dependent dielectric constant prediction of polymers using machine learning
frequency-dependent dielectric constant.summary: This paper develops a machine-learning-based model to predict the frequency-dependent dielectric constant of polymers, which is critical for various applications. The model uses a dataset of 1210 experimentally measured values and a hierarchical polymer fingerprinting scheme to accurately and rapidly predict ϵ of new polymer candidates across a wide range of frequencies.
frequency-dependent dielectric constant.methodology: The methodology involves training an ML model using a dataset of 1210 experimentally measured ϵ values at various frequencies. The model uses a hierarchical polymer fingerprinting scheme and the Gaussian process regression algorithm to capture the frequency-dependent behavior of polymers.
frequency-dependent dielectric constant.statistics: The paper uses statistical methods such as LASSO for dimensionality reduction and feature elimination.
frequency-dependent dielectric constant.research_outcomes: The research outcomes include the development of an ML model that can accurately predict ϵ of new polymer candidates across a wide range of frequencies. The model is also used to propose five representative polymers satisfying specific ϵ and T g requirements for capacitor and microelectronic applications.

a study on casting of structural mesh-li.title: A Study on Casting of Structural Mesh-like Metal Parts
a study on casting of structural mesh-li.summary: This paper presents a case study on the casting of structural mesh-like metal parts, focusing on cylindrical spacers. The research aims to improve design and manufacturing practices by parametrically defining shapes, examining alternative casting deployment, and ending with prototype manufacture. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.
a study on casting of structural mesh-li.methodology: The methodology involves numerical simulation using commercially available dedicated software, considering solidification time and lack of defects as primary quality indices accompanied by an investigation of residual stress and deformation fields.
a study on casting of structural mesh-li.research_outcomes: The research outcomes include the determination of the best combination of casting mode and parameter values for manufacturing cylindrical structural mesh-like metal spacers. The study also investigates the effects of different mold geometries on solidification time and porosity, finding that vacuum casting is preferable to gravity casting.

computational engineering of the oxygen.title: Computational engineering of the oxygen electrode-electrolyte interface in solid oxide fuel cells
computational engineering of the oxygen.summary: This paper focuses on computational modeling of the microstructure evolution at the oxygen electrode–electrolyte interface in solid oxide fuel cells. The authors use thermodynamic, 1D kinetic, and 3D phase-field modeling to study the effects of different ceramic processing techniques for the CGO interlayer and operating parameters on the performance of SOFCs.
computational engineering of the oxygen.methodology: The authors combine thermodynamic, 1D kinetic, and 3D phase-field modeling to computationally reproduce the element redistribution, microstructure evolution, and corresponding ohmic loss of the interface.
computational engineering of the oxygen.research_outcomes: The study shows that computational numerical modeling can be used to optimize the fabrication parameters for SOFCs and minimize the degradation caused by YSZ-CGO interdiffusion and SZO formation.

theoretical and experimental investigati.title: Theoretical and experimental investigations of ultrasonic vibration–assisted boring for titanium alloy
theoretical and experimental investigati.summary: This paper investigates the use of ultrasonic vibration-assisted boring (UB) to improve the quality of machined surfaces in titanium alloy. The authors analyze the kinematics characteristics of UB and compare it with conventional boring, finding that UB can reduce boring force and surface roughness effectively.
theoretical and experimental investigati.research_outcomes: UB can reduce boring force and surface roughness effectively

preparation of a low-cost and eco-friend.title: Preparation of a low-cost and eco-friendly superabsorbent composite based on wheat bran and laterite for potential application in Chinese herbal medicine growth
preparation of a low-cost and eco-friend.summary: This paper focuses on developing a low-cost, eco-friendly superabsorbent composite using wheat bran and laterite for potential application in Chinese herbal medicine growth. The study optimizes the conditions to prepare the WB-g-PAA/LA superabsorbent composite and investigates its properties and applications as a urea fertilizer carrier and in the growth of Chinese herbal medicine.
preparation of a low-cost and eco-friend.methodology: The methodology involves free-radical graft co-polymerization of wheat bran, acrylic acid, and laterite in an aqueous solution. The reaction temperature is allowed to increase to 70°C and maintained for 1.5 h to complete polymerization.
preparation of a low-cost and eco-friend.research_outcomes: The study finds that the WB-g-PAA/LA superabsorbent composite has high thermal stability, water absorbency, and water-retention capacity. It also regulates the release of urea and influences the growth of Chinese herbal medicine.

high precision, low excitation capacitan.title: High Precision, Low Excitation Capacitance Measurement Methods from 10 mK- to Room-Temperature
high precision, low excitation capacitan.summary: This paper presents a high precision capacitance measurement method that can measure capacitance from 10 mK to room temperature with excellent accuracy. The method uses a passive bridge at the sample stage and radio frequency excitation to increase the output signal, and develops a high sensitivity radio frequency lock-in technique to analyze the bridge output.
high precision, low excitation capacitan.methodology: The paper introduces a new approach for high precision capacitance measurement using a passive bridge at the sample stage and radio frequency excitation. The method uses a voltage-controlled-variable-resistor to in-situ tune the balance of the bridge, and develops a high sensitivity radio frequency lock-in technique to analyze the bridge output.
high precision, low excitation capacitan.research_outcomes: The paper presents a high precision capacitance measurement method that can measure capacitance from 10 mK to room temperature with excellent accuracy. The method is capable of resolving 240 ppm variation of a 0.5 pF capacitor within a few second.

automatic segmentation of ceramic materi.title: Automatic segmentation of ceramic materials with relaxed possibilistic c-means clustering for defect detection
automatic segmentation of ceramic materi.summary: This paper proposes a Possibilistic C-Means pixel clustering algorithm with fuzzy stretching to enhance the contrast of ceramic material images for defect detection. The method is shown to be effective in segmenting defects from the background, outperforming standard K-means clustering.
automatic segmentation of ceramic materi.methodology: The proposed method involves preprocessing the image using Gaussian filtering and Max-Min binarization with a Sobel mask, followed by fuzzy stretching to enhance contrast. Then, Possibilistic C-Means pixel clustering is applied to form the target object from the preprocessed image.
automatic segmentation of ceramic materi.research_outcomes: The proposed method was successful in detecting defects in 49 out of 50 images (98% accuracy), outperforming standard K-means clustering.

metal nanoclusters/polyvinyl alcohol com.title: Metal Nanoclusters/Polyvinyl Alcohol Composite Films as the Alternatives for Fabricating Remote-Type White Light-Emitting Diodes
metal nanoclusters/polyvinyl alcohol com.summary: This paper presents a novel approach to fabricating remote-type white light-emitting diodes using metal nanoclusters/polyvinyl alcohol composite films. The research focuses on the synthesis and characterization of these composite materials, which exhibit high emissivity and stability.
metal nanoclusters/polyvinyl alcohol com.methodology: The authors employed a casting method to prepare the MNCs/PVA composite films, followed by various characterization techniques such as TEM, DLS, UV-vis spectroscopy, FTIR, XRD, and AFM.
metal nanoclusters/polyvinyl alcohol com.research_outcomes: The study demonstrates that the MNCs/PVA composite films can be used to fabricate remote-type white LEDs with high color rendering index (CRI) and tunable correlated color temperature (CCT).

gan-based flip-chip leds with highly ref.title: GaN-based flip-chip LEDs with highly reflective ITO/DBR p-type and via hole-based n-type contacts for enhanced current spreading and light extraction
gan-based flip-chip leds with highly ref.summary: This paper presents a novel double-layer electrode flip-chip LED (DLE-FCLED) with ITO/DBR p-type contact and via hole-based n-type contacts, which improves light extraction efficiency, current spreading, and heat dissipating. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this research.
gan-based flip-chip leds with highly ref.methodology: The methodology involves growing GaN-based LEDs on a c-plane patterned sapphire substrate using metal-organic chemical vapor deposition (MOCVD) technique, followed by fabrication of the DLE-FCLED chip through various processing steps.
gan-based flip-chip leds with highly ref.research_outcomes: The results show that the DLE-FCLED has improved light extraction efficiency, current spreading, and heat dissipating compared to top-emitting LEDs. The external quantum efficiency (EQE) of DLE-FCLED is enhanced by 15.4% and 132% at 90 mA and 300 mA, respectively.

investigation on crack analysis of h13 f.title: INVESTIGATION ON CRACK ANALYSIS OF H13 FIXED DIE AND STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS OF MOVING DIE WITH TWO DIFFERENT MATERIALS
investigation on crack analysis of h13 f.summary: This paper investigates the physical phenomenon of die casting for two dies (moving die and fixed die) using two different alloy materials.
